column6: This was my first Lululemon purchase EVER! The sales associate was super helpful during my first shopping experience and I finally selected the Fast and Free. These pants felt great in the store but then I went for my first run. They kept slipping down. Finally had to knot the drawcord and then they were more comfortable. The whole reason I came to Lululemon was because I wanted running pants that had a “stay put” waistband. Wish I had sized down but now I know next time to try a smaller size.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear TenKES,\n\nThank you for taking the time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'February 8, 2019'}

column5: I want to give these 5 stars SO BAD
column6: I was given a bunch of Lulu stuff for the holidays from family members and this pair of leggings was by far my favorite. They are amazing and as a rower who works out 6 days a week at the crack of dawn, this is a great pair to stay warm in during winter. I was so sad to be told today as I was wearing them that I had thread hanging from my waste. The waistband thread had begun to unravel and the fabric separating. I have always been the same size, I wash in cold and hang dry all my Lulu leggings. I am so, so sad, but honestly best leggings I think you guys have made besides the unraveling of course

column6: Stitching came undone after only a month of occasional wear of my fast and free nulux. I handwash all my lululemon leggings and hang them to dry. I would advise against purchasing this item.

column6: Love these for CrossFit type workouts. They don’t live especially during burpees which I’m super picky about. Totally recommend these.

I bought these leggings because they are very flattering, NOT suppose to stretch out, and have great pockets. They initially fit very tight, and although I am typically a 4, I went with a 6 for my first pair because they were so fitted in store. Shorty after wearing them and taking the tags off, they were noticeably GROSSLY too big. I couldn't keep them up. So, since I loved them, I just went ahead and bought the 4 since that is my usual size and no joke after a few workouts in them, they started scrunching in the backside and got loose in the legs. They are too big to workout in now. I have tried drying them to get them back to size, but they just stretch back out again. After all this, the 2 appears it would be the perfect size. I just wish I would have known they would stretch like this before buying TWO pair that are too big. I love these leggings and so disappointed they are both the wrong size.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear KJFIT0316,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'February 7, 2019'}

column6:
I simply cannot understand the bad reviews this pants are getting.
I own two pairs of the pants in black. I bought them 13 months ago. I spin 6 days per week, and I wear each pair 3 times in 1 week. This means that I wash each pair 3 times per week. 13 months after, each pair must have gone through almost 170 washing cycles, and they look just like the first day. Just make sure you wash in cold, and do not tumble dry (just hang to dry).
I am 5'2 and I weight around 105 pounds. The person that helped me at the store told me to buy the size 2, but I went for a size 4. I think that maybe the reason why a lot of people are saying it is breaking is because they are buying sizes that are just too small!
I hope this pants are not discontinued, The Nulux material is perfect for sweaty biking sessions. I used to wear the Wunder Under, I was always dying from the heat. This pants are a game changers. Oh, and I love the pockets (I use them to keep my earplugs, headphones, etc).

first pair fell apart a week in and second pair after 3 wears is see-through and stretched out. I was excited about these because of the material and the draw string and now i feel the quality is terrible.

Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'February 7, 2019'}

column6: I put these on for my workout and they felt great...at first. Half way through my workout I found my self pulling these up not only in my waist (I had the drawstring tightened) but also on my legs! It felt like the longer I wore them the baggier or looser they became. SO NOT LIKE MY OTHER LULU'S! I'm disappointed because Lulu is the only thing I wear for workouts. I think maybe these ones just aren't their best. Bummed I can't return/exchange.

column6: Bought the black and polka-dot pairs of these. Not only are they see-through, but I washed them ONCE and they basically fell apart. I have never been so disappointed. not only are they pilling, something very strange is happening to the pockets on these, they're beyond pilling and almost have a fuzzy texture to them. Absolutely horrible quality, can't believe I wasted $250. Been a lulu customer for years but recently has not been performing for me.

column6: I recently bought these leggings at the store. I tried on a size 6 which fit well in store, but after wearing them only three times and washing them in cold water once (and air drying), the seams have already started to fray and the waistband is loose. I have to tighten the waistband just to hold them up. I think the leggings are cute, but I just wish that they were more fitted and kept their shape. Considering the price, I'm disappointed in these leggings.

column6:
Okay, so I tried these leggings on and completely loved how they look, the soft fabric, I was really impressed with how it was built. SO I bought my respected size(, I probably could have done with a size smaller.) BUT, I decided to buy the size I originally tried on! Flip forward to my first run with them, I was worried about the see-throughness but I continued on, and immediately I noticed they kind of kept falling down throughout my run & I couldn't put my phone in the side panel pockets because it would make them fall more. Overall, I was kind of disappointed that my first leggings from Lulu didn't meet my expectations because I did spend a lot of money for them, but I am going to keep them for day-to-day wear, just not running leggings.
TO THOSE OTHERS CONSIDERING BUYING THESE: If you do buy this, get a darker size and I would go a size down than what you originally buy @lululemon.

column6: I love the fit and function of these pants, they are comfortable and I love the pockets. However, after the first wash (not yet worn) I noticed a hole inside the pocket. Took them to my local store and was treated rudely by the sales associate.. long story short I could only get them sent away to "see if they could mend them," but that there was no guarantee if they could be fixed and when they would be shipped back. I was so bothered by the encounter that I took them home and continued to wear them as is. Aside from that, some of the stitching/fabric has begun to look clumped together and no longer appealing.. I'm disappointed in the discussion I had with the sales associate, and that my pants were basically defective from purchase :( as much as I want to repurchase, I'm hesitant

column5: They feel great, but don't get the wrong color
column6:
So - I think these pants would be wonderful however I don't trust them.
I received them as a Christmas gift in the Rose print and the color turns really white where they are stretched. These leggings are meant to be stretchy and form fitting and while they are flattering on, the fact that they're white on the opposite side shows too much and gives my legs an ombre effect.
I think maybe a darker print would be a little more forgiving.
The material is great, the fit is great, but they make me really self conscious when I run.

column6:
I’ve looked these reviews over and over and it’s so hard because they are mixed. I recommend trying them and because lulu is awesome at returns, there is no risk.
I like that they hold in my post partum belly without sliding. Using the loop to make them more snug around the waist makes it easy to stay in place. I also love that the pocket fits my iPhone plus. Every time i wear them someone also tells me how fit I look which is a plus as it gives your butt a lift!
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column14: easy to adjust to fit snug around waits.

column6:
I was soooooo excited to finally get a pair of the highly recommended, super-hyped Fast & Frees. Sadly, I am returning.
For reference I am 5'2", 130lbs give or take. I ordered a size 6, and then tried a size 4. I feel like if they had made a size 5 they would have fit perfectly. The 6 had a lot of bunching fabric around the back of my knees and just under the butt cheek. They felt nice on, but the bunching made it look obvious that they just didn't fit me right. I am not crazy about the drawstring waist, however I can see how that would be helpful if you're a runner to keep them in place. Size 4 got rid of the bunching, but was just WAY too snug around the waist for me to be comfortable.
Pros of these pants are definitely the print. The Sunrise Silhouette Multi print is gorgeous and doesn't stretch out and loose it's intense colour. 100% squat-proof. Love the pockets, they're deep and useful, barely noticable. Also love the reflective dots on the leg and the Lululemon Logo on the leg. I feel like I'm the only one who misses the Lululemon logo on the leg of their leggings. Bring back the Lulu leg-logo!! Love the seamless ankle and high waist. So yeah, lots of pros, but not enough for me to keep them.
I feel like the price is too steep for these. The fabric is nice, yes, but I don't feel like they're any more significant than any of my Wunder Unders. Only real advantage are the pockets. In fact as I thought about when and how I would wear these leggings, I could tell that I wouldn't be reaching for these much. Hard to believe because they are so pretty, but just not my jam. I'm sticking with my Wunder Unders.

I heard such great reviews about theses pants and wanted to really like em, but they’re not worth the hype. Maybe I got a bad pair? The inside stitching (from the back pocket that connects/creates logo on back side) was so rough it was stratching/irritating against my skin/back thigh.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Dear Catxcat,\n\nWe're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.", 'LL_response_date': 'February 4, 2019'}

column6: I have been wearing lulu for years and have some pants that were originals.... the quality is spot on. Sadly, these are not them. When taking in a different pair of leggings that pilled and had seam issues I was told I was not wearing them for the proper exercise. The yoga/training pants I had should not be used on turf or for lifting, is what I was told. I asked them to recommend a pant that could handle lifting. This is what they suggested. I wash them on cold with other lulu clothing, air dry them, and guess what? Pilling on all of the seams still. In my opinion lulu quality is not like it used to and their products are not withstanding simple workouts. I do LOVE the fit, the quality is just simply not worth the price. I would take them in but I am certain they would tell me again they won't back up their product because of "user error" and suggest I pay another $120 for a pair that pills again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear kbailey,\n\nThank you for taking the time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. Please give us a ring at 1.877.263.9300 so we can make things right. Chat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'February 2, 2019'}

column6: These were my very first lulu purchase ever and I love them! There are a couple other pants that I have worn and these are still my favorites. I have a few pairs and just wish there were more color options. I will say that I learned that I should size down as the pants do stretch after several wears, but still hold up and feel great! They really do feel cool to the touch and do not show sweat at all!

column5: Keep on making them please! Best tights ever!
column6: I absolutely love everything about these - the two side pockets, the fabric weight which works for anything including hot yoga!

i was a bit skeptical of buying these because of the high price. They are so soft and comfy and i love all of the pockets! i don’t know what i’ll do if i ever buy leggings without pockets ever again! i love these pants so much!

These are among my very favorites lululemon has designed. They fit perfectly-like a glove. The fabric is light and so therefore are not the best for outdoor cold weather activity but they can not be beat indoors. I highly recommend these tights-I’m obsessed with them!

These leggings fit great however, I find that they do not last long. I wear them weekly, wash in cold water and hang to dry. Despite this, the seams are pilling and can be easily pulled off (I have one pair with a long hanging thread). My second pair has a hole in the side pocket from my phone (case is a smooth rounded edge), which tells me the material clearly is not durable.

column6:
I absolutely loved these. I bought them first in cropped length and then in 7/8 for the cooler months. I wear them all the time. The fabric feels like you are wearing nothing and butter to the touch. I cant stop touching my legs. lol
After having them for a few months, they have since bagged out in the waist and leg. I used to be able to run in them with my phone in the pocket without them budging. Now, I cannot. I am constantly pulling them up. Super disappointed.

column5: Fell in love, but was very disappointed
column6: I went to the store for my birthday and got sized for these leggings. They felt perfect in the beginning, but after a week or two of wearing them, the legs and waist stretched out. I couldn't wear them running without tightening the waist a lot, but i don't think I can run comfortably with them anymore. Doing legs was difficult, because I kept having to pull my pants up every other set. I was super excited to to hit the gym with my new lulus I got for my birthday, but now I don't think it will be compatible with my gym workouts. I still love the brand 100%, but these leggings were slightly disappointing.

column5: I love them but I wouldn't buy again :(
column6: These are absolutely the best pants I have ever owned as far as fit, performance and comfort. However, after buying them in black a few years ago, they began to fall apart, so I took them into a store and they replaced them. Sadly, even the new pair they gave me is falling apart (the serged seams are pilling and can be easily pulled off). Despite all this I would still buy another pair because I love them so much, I just can't justify the cost now knowing that they aren't going to last. (I wash them separately, on cold and hang them to dry)

column6: I wear these leggings all the time to run in and they are fantastic! I am curvy and these do not fall down my hips whatsoever. I love that I can put my phone in the pocket when I run and not have to deal with it. I also lift in these and they are not see through at all! I cannot recommend these enough and I hope they continue to release these in new colors.

column5: I can't stop buying these pants
column6: If you are hesitating about these pants, buy them now! These are my absolute favorite (not just Lululemon) pants of all time. I can't even describe how comfortable and lightweight the fabric is. They are so stretchy, so light, so smooth, and have a drawstring at the top to help them stay up since they are so stretchy. I bought a pair in black and now I own 3 other colors too. The fabric is not warm by any means so unfortunately you probably won't be wearing these outside in the winter. I've washed them once and air dried and they still look great. I get a Size 6 (5'4, 135 lbs) and they fit comfortably. I can also fit in a size 4 and they are a little more snug but still comfortable.

I've bought a number of lulu items over the years, and have been very satisfied with my purchases until I bought this item. At first, I was in love with the feel of these tights and their fit, and even recommended them to many of my friends. I've had these tights for just over a year now and the material has developed a hole just above the knee. The hemming between the legs has also come out quite a bit. I'm quite disappointed because I spent more money than I usually spend on leggings because I loved the material, however the material has not performed as I expected. I brought my leggings into my local store and asked whether there was anything they could do to repair the hole, but they told be there was nothing they could do. I've never had an experience like this with leggings; I've owned Nike and Underarmour leggings that have lasted me 5 years, which were half the price of these.

Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 31, 2019'}

column6: These are the most comfortable and soft leggings ever! They are squat proof and have very convenient pockets and are my favorite leggings ever!! Highly recommend, seriously the softest leggings!!!

I just got these in the new Melanite color and absolutely love them. I already have them in black and red and couldn't be happier. The fabric is super soft and the fit is super flattering. I take really good care of them when I wash them and usually put everything in its own separate washing baggy, but so far they haven't pilled or changed after washing. The pocket on the side is amazing...it fits my IPhone plus so that I don't have to worry about leaving my phone by itself in the gym when I get weights, switch between machines, etc. I would 100% recommend. I have a ton of lulu and this is by far my favorite pants I have purchased. My only concern is that there aren't more colors. and when there are new colors they sell out in the smaller sizes super quickly (Like the Dark Carbon color). Hopefully with the spring coming up Lulu will come out with some cute, brighter colors!
These leggings are the best things ever! They are perfect for your workout and are great to run in! Not see through and absolutely amazing leggings! I recommend them to everyone!
column14: not see through and very comfortable

column5: Love These... But sizing is way off
column6: I was highly encouraged to purchase these by an associate at Lulu while I was shopping. I communicated to the associate about how I preferred for my leggings to fit. She said that these would be great. She also sized me in a 6, my normal Lulu size. So I purchased the leggings and went straight to the gym for a work out. I was pulling these up the whole time I worked out. Being that this was the first time I worked out in these leggings I was very surprised that they stretched out. I am now unable to wear these. I wish I had sized down because I love the way these legging feel... they just fall down when participating in any activity from walking to running they will not stay up. I wish I could exchange for a smaller size but the tags are all off. Very sad...

column5: Love the design, fit didn't work for me
column6: Ordered the Sunrise Silhouette Multi in sizes 4 and 6. I am 5'1", 115 lbs, I have muscular legs and carry most of my weight in my hips and thighs. Loved the design of the tights and had several tops that would have paired well with it, however the fit did not work out for me. The size 6 fit great above the knee and was loose mid-calf and below. The size 4 gave me a muffin top and was slightly loose at the ankle. For the price I couldn't justify keeping either with the fit not working out, wish there was petite sizes available.

column6: This is my fourth pair of fast and free tights. I purchased them and immediately took the tags off to take them for a run. The waist and fabric feels different in the sunrise print and than in my solid colors and they aren't as comfortable. The fabric doesn't feel as slick and stretchy and now that the tags are off I'm stuck with them. Wishing I would have spent more time in them before committing. I love the Fast and Free tights and am bummed I can't return and am stuck with them.

column6: If you're on the shorter side and never bought lulu 7/8 pants, I highly recommend! They will fit like full length, where as true lulu full length are way too long on me. The fabric of these pants is so buttery soft and comfortable. I was afraid that without a seam on the bottom these wouldn't stay in place, but they do. They stayed in place perfectly. Love!

I bought these leggings with confidence that the employee who sized me would have sized me properly - she also chose the leggings based on her personal preference, and assured me that my purchase was what I did want, and that trying them on would not be necessary because they would fit the same as my other leggings from this company. These leggings are very uncomfortable and when I tried to return them in store, I was turned down for not having the tags to go with them. Extremely disappointed :(

column6: The feel of these pants reminds me of the Align Pant with the compression and shaping of a good running tight. I have a pair myself in purple, and love them. I recently bought my mother-in-law a pair of these and she really enjoys them! The pockets are functional and they look great. This is her first pair of Lululemons and she actually hasn't worn them out of the house yet because she thinks they are too nice to get dirty! Haha

I got these pants in November and love them. They fit super well and they are my favorite pants to work out in. However today I noticed that there is a small hole in the side right against the seam above the pocket. This is disappointing for how much I spent on these pants.
column15: got a hole after having them for 2 months
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Stellapanda1917,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux is not performing for you. We stand behind our gear and we'd love to get in touch. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'January 29, 2019'}

column6: I've heard so much about Lululemon and the magical pants that I decided to splurge and spend 128 bucks on these. I was soooo so happy at first. Loved them. They look so flattering and held up for a run or just errands around town. They lasted about a month, with just two washes--I followed the instructions exactly--and have stretched out so much that they don't fit anymore. I'm bummed. I can't run in them or they fall down, and the string at the waist just feels uncomfortable. With all the money I spent, I don't want to have to tie the string so tight just to keep them up. I definitely expected them to last longer and am very disappointed with the quality. I'm sad.

column6: These felt perfect when I tried them on in the store, but after wearing them for a few weeks or so they have stretched out and must be pulled up every 30 seconds. I couldn't imagine running in these, as I can't even walk around the house without them inching down so that the crotch is about 3 inches lower than it should be. I'm highly disappointed because I was extremely excited to work out in these. This will not be happening, and they are used only for sitting around at home now.

column6: I have purchased 2 pairs of these pants, in both black and navy. I was absolutely in love with the fit, look, and material of these pants, however BOTH pairs have gotten holes in the pockets within about 1 month of wear. I wear them for running and yoga, and there is no reason the pockets should have holes in them. While the hole doesn't go all the way through the pants, just to the inside of the pockets, I am very disappointed with the quality because of the price I paid for these pants. This is something I would expect more of Under Armour or Reebok than Lululemon.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear LAS14,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". We’d like to get to the bottom of this and work towards a resolution, so I\'ve sent you an email to follow up.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 28, 2019'}

column6: As a fitness coach at two very different studios (HIIT, pilates), this is the perfect pant to teach (and take) class in! The Nulux fabric creates a naked sensation but gives me all of the coverage I need to feel secure while working with clients. As a 5'3 petite woman, the length meets up above my ankle - the perfect length with added detail at the bottom! Love this pant, would suggest for all of my friends, runners, and anyone in between!

I purchased these in the beautiful violet red colour, because I wanted something 'fun'ctional. Much to my horror you can see a tattoo on my derriere right through the lightweight material. So much for coverage. I would not dare wear these to teach a class, how unprofessional. Fair warning to any ladies out there with ink!
The fit in the crouch area is also strange. I am a true size 4 in the countless number of leggings I've purchased from Lulu, but these seem to have a lot of excess fabric in that region. At least there is a drawstring in the waist so you can customize your fit.
I still can't help but love these leggings though (I think it's the pockets tbh). For reference I am 5'9", 135lbs, and purchased a size 4.

I own almost every kind of lululemon legging and these are by far my favorite -- I have them in almost every color. they're perfect! soft, comfortable, and stretchy while being as tight as a second skin at the same time

When these first arrived, I tried them on and thought they were awesome! But a couple days later, I went to wear them for a workout. Before I ever left the house, they were bagging at the crotch, butt, a knee area. In 15 minutes they were unwearable to make it to the gym, had to change. The thigh and calf area are great, and they feel amazing. But unusable to me.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear coolm,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" is not performing as you hoped it would be. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 27, 2019'}

column6: It took everything in myself to buy these and wow am i glad. I am forever addicted.

column5: I love the feel of these....however,...
column6: At the end of November, went on a shopping spree to get some new workout clothes, and I found these leggings and crops. I instantly fell in love with the feel. I purchased a pair of the leggings and the crops. I wore the legging for one workout, and the stitching came undone around the right hip area. So I took them back (which is an hour drive from my house), explained what happened, and I was told, "you must have the wrong size, because that doesn't usually happen." So, I exchanged the pair for another one, a size up. I haven't worn those yet. I've worn the crops 4 times...and today, the stitching came out across the back. These crops are the same size as the exchanged pants I have. So, I don't think it's a sizing issue. If I go any bigger, they will fall down when I jump or do anything else besides walk basically. Again, I love the way they feel, but both pairs I purchased had the same issue with the stitching. For over $100, I expected a higher quality. I'm assuming since I've worn the crops multiple times and washed them that I cannot return them. Just a shame that I only got to wear them 4 times. Hopefully the exchanged leggings I have don't do the same thing.

I love that there is no hem on the bottom and the material of the pants. If you are debating on which pants to get, these are hands down the best! I have another style of lululemon pants which are still good, but I never wear them because I love these so much more!

column6: Je passe au minimum 1h30 par jour en legging de sport depuis plusieurs années et rien est comparable à ce modèle!

I was looking forward to the "naked" feel and sweat-wicking that was promised but I was so disappointed. They are not supportive at all and quite frankly feel unfinished. column6: These leggings are perfect to go from a run to class - they're the perfect amount of snug and supporting without cutting off circulation. I would literally buy these in every color. I use them primarily for day to day use but also for runs on colder days.

column5: Love at First Sight to Heartbreak
column6: The moment I tried on the Fast and Free 7/8 I fell in love. They fit perfect and were so comfortable. I needed a new pair of pants for my HIIT workouts and I felt like I had found the perfect pair. I wore them once and they stretched out so much. By the end of my workout they were falling down. I washed them by instruction and tried again-- they were even bigger the second time. If I would have realized they stretched so much so fast I would have sized down. If they fit properly I would love them. I'm so disappointed that I spent $130 on pants that don't fit right. They are too big on the waist, butt, and legs. They seriously stretched out everywhere! If you take the risk on buying these definitely size down.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear HITTandreformergirl,\n\nThank you for taking the time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 25, 2019'}

column6: I work in a gym and wear these almost daily. They are like butter on your legs!! So soft and so comfortable. Truly worth every penny.

Purchased these over a year ago and have worn them consistently to the gym and on some hiking/walking. I always hand wash and hang to dry, and have they honestly still look brand new. They have not stretched out at all, are colour fast, and are the perfect addition to my quiver of activity pants (like having the pocket for my phone in the gym). I have them in black and also in green. Both colours are great. Would recommend!

column5: You've got to be kidding me with these
column6: Hands down the best pants I've ever bought for training. They compress in all the right places, but don't ever feel too tight. The material is perfect for a high sweat training sesh. I always get compliments when I wear these, which is saying a lot for a basic black tight. Wish I could live in these! Great investment.

column5: You MUST buy these, like right now.
column6: I own 7 pairs of fast and frees, and they are worth every last penny. They are the only tights i will workout in! They are seriously life changing. The first time you run in a pair of these, its like a spiritual experience. Just go ahead and get one in every color. Lulu - keep making these in new colors please so i can expand my collection :)

I was excited about these but it turns out the fit (they are so loose around the ankles) and fabric sheen are enough for me to not want to wear them. I'll be returning to hopefully get something different.
Totally worth the investment!! Should have may the decision sooner, they are well worth the $$.

Was not impressed with this pair of Lululemon leggings. The material was very thin and sheer and did not seem to be squat proof. I would not recommend these leggings to a friend because they do not wick sweat well. Another down side to these leggings is that they aren't sown at the bottom, and it seems as if the fabric was simply cut right at the ankle and not finished. Very weird.

Also, Lulu- I am so impressed with your customer service! In stores and replies to customer reviews online. Well done!! It definitely keeps me coming back! :) THANK YOU for being a customer service role model!
These are my favorite Lululemon pants! The fabric is amazing, so comfortable.

I really wanted to love these because I thought they would be perfect for workouts, however they stretched out within 2 weeks and the fabric was too slippery to do workouts in. Was really disappointed with these when I was hoping they would be my new go to pant.

column5: My first bad experience with Lululemon
column6: I bought two pair of these Fast and Free pants -- one cropped length and one in 7/8 length (pink color, purchased as final sale). I wore the pink pants to an intense cardio workout and was extremely disappointed when half way through my workout, I could see sweat showing through my pants. It was embarrassing to say the least! I came online to see if others had similar experiences and I see I'm not the only one. These pants do not wick sweat well. I bought a pair in black as well and am afraid to wear them for fear the same thing will happen.

I had previously owned the crops and wanted to splurge on the pants for the holidays. I got the fast and free pant in melanite but noticed the dot design on the pants were missing. I love the pants, but am wondering if I got a defective pair. Any one else have this issue with the melanite color?

column6: What I love most about these tights is that they do not have a seam around the ankle. They are comfortable, sleek, and great to run in! I like that they are easy to take off also. By far the best bottoms I have ever gotten from Lululemon.
These were my first pair of lulus and i was super excited when i got them but after only a few wears they started to come apart at the seams :(

column6: These are hands down my favourite Lululemon tights. I currently own 6 different colours and would highly recommend them to anyone. They keep their shape, although I did go down 1 size (from a 6 to a 4). They were tight initially and gave out after a couple times wearing them, they are now perfect. I am 5"2 and find that the 28" are too long, the 7/8s fit me perfectly, just above the ankle. I coach CrossFit and find that they very functional. I like that I can keep my phone in my pocket. I don't overheat in the summers and they keep me warm in the winters (yay for Canadian weather!) lol.
I love these pants for everything. They dont move and they are super comfy

Great for working-out in! These pants keeps you nice and snug without hindering your ability to breathe. The material is comfortable. This pair is my preferred choice of leggings for working-out in. I've had them for about a year and have not had any issues with pilling. Overall, flattering and hold everything in. The high-waisted is a must! Fits true to size .

Bought in same size as all my other lululemon tights - after wearing for about half an hour stretched out to the point they no longer stay up on waist. Constantly having to pull up. Loved these in store, but would recommend buying a size smaller if you plan on doing any activity at all in them.

column6: I wear this for strength and HIIT workouts and they are perfect. The light materia hugs you without being too much. The higher waist let’s me workout hard without thinking about my pants. And I love the side pockets for stashing my phone for to and from the gym!

column5: Don't get it if you have small waist-to-hip ratio
column6: My first Lululemon purchase. When I tried it on at the store, they felt great. When I first used them, in the middle of my workout, I felt the waist area becoming loose and falling. It happened again the second time I worked out. I tried to tie the drawcord but it became really loose. Really wanted to love them but I couldn't. They cost so so much too. Quite disappointed.

column6: I really liked these leggings and the sales associate was really great at helping me find the pants and what they thought was the right size, however I really wish I would have sized down now. After one wear the waist stretched out a significant amount so that they now gap whenever I wear them. I washed them to try and shrink them back to the original fit with no luck, but they did wash well with no pilling. I really like the material and length so I will hopefully buy another pair in the future but in a size 2. For reference I am 5'2" and 100lbs and the 4 fit perfectly in store, but they definitely stretch out more than you would expect.
These are one of my favorite workout pants. Love love love
column14: they fit perfect and look great

column6: J’ai porté les leggings maximum 4 fois. Les leggings sont bien ajustés et très confortables, cependant je suis déçue du produit puisque la couture arrière s’est défaite très rapidement. Au prix, qu’ils sont vendus, je crois qu’ils devraient assurer une meilleure qualité de leur produits.

column6: I absolutely love these leggings for working out! They’re super comfortable and stay up the whole time. My only wish is that I had more of them, but I’ll have to save up for that.

brand new these leggings were great but I don't think I'm a fan of the fabric because it bags out and becomes saggy rather quickly. Despite loving them when I first got them, I don't think I will replace them, especially because they're on the more expensive side.

column6:
I want to start by saying I wanted to love these pants. When I put them on the fabric felt so nice and light. I bought the Carbon Blue and the Dark Olive.
As per the pants "function" I bought these for running/cardio. First I wore my Carbon Blue to the gym, and imagine my surprise when I went to the change room after my workout and looked in the mirror to see it looks like I full on peed my pants. I was hoping that maybe it was just that particular colour, so the next time I wore my Dark Olive pants. I think you know what happens next, I went to the change room after my workout and once again it looks like I peed myself.
This is extremely frustrating. "Sweat-Wicking and Quick-Drying" these are not. I am not a heavy sweater. I have never had this happen to me in any other pants I own. I can't believe I paid so much money for pants I will not be able to wear in public. It's not like I bought yoga pants and tried to do a cardio session in them. These pants are designed for running, but the only place you can run in these is home.
So disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear Meowmix12,\n\nThank you for taking the time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I completely understand why you\'re disappointed with this and I\'d love to help turn this around. To carry on this conversation, we\'ve sent you a follow up email. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 18, 2019'}

column5: Great for Yoga, Terrible to Sweat In
column6:
I like to do combination workouts but this pant makes it hard. I go into the gym for yoga, cardio, and weight lifting. I was recommended this pant in-store where it fit nicely and was very comfortable as I went to squat and stretch. I find that the pant feels loose as my workout goes on so I end up tightening the waistband while working out. I have to pull up my pants when I run or do the Stairmaster. I'm 5'2", 172 and wearing a size 8.
These pants do not wick any moisture. I bought them in black so my sweat stains aren't super visible but when I would sit on any machine after only 15 minutes of cardio I would leave embarrassing sweat marks behind. I can't imagine working on any machines if I were to run beforehand. I avoid these on the days I want to run or know I'm going to sweat.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear Ccha08,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. To carry on this conversation, we\'ve sent you a follow up email. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 18, 2019'}

column6:
Oh my goooosh. Tbh, I never thought to try these on because I am not a fan of the dots on the side, but IMO these are almost better than the aligns, mostly because of the pockets and the fabric is less prone to snagging and stuff.
I have them in black and the color is still perfect. I wear them often.
Honestly the pockets are great. And I like these a little more than the All the Right Places because they are not as tight, and I personally prefer the fabric more.

I have two other lululemon pants that are size 6 and fit perfectly. When I got these, they fit well in the store. But after running in them a few times, I'm finding that they keep falling down! I haven't lost any weight (unfortunately) but these pants seem to get looser the more I wear them. My other two lulu pants don't do this, so I'm disappointed in these. I'm also starting to notice some piling on the seams of the pants, when I've only washed them twice so far.

During my Sculpting class, I fell, and it caused a rip in my leggings around the knee area. It was not a hard fall, and it is already ruined. I am sad to say that the quality of these leggings is poor.

Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 18, 2019'}

column6: These leggings are probably my all-time favorite Lulus that I have purchased so far. The conveniency of the pockets are wonderful and the material is stretchy and flexible.

I went for my first run in these pants and not only did they constantly fall down but after I had a minor trip they ripped as I fell onto the grass. Previous leggings I've owned have fit great and have held up for years so I was disappointed in the quality of these.

I bought these in a size 4 (my typical for Align/Wunder Under/Pace Rival) and they fit great in the store! However, after wearing them for a few hours, the waist stretched a ton and they got all saggy in the bum. I had to keep pulling them up during my run-- which definitely slowed me down.
To make things worse, they got pills after the first wear, despite following the wash/dry instructions.
I sized down for next time, but this pair is virtually unwearable after owning for less than a month.

These are some of my favorite leggings! the material is very thin and not to constricting, but they are also snug enough that they stay up very well. I've had them for about 3-4 months now and they are holding up very well, no pilling.

I just got these leggings as a birthday gift and was super excited as I could not bring myself to buy them due to the high price point. They are super comfy and cute but really see-through. I can’t bend over because then the whole gym will see my color underwear. I stretched the fabric in the light and it was almost transparent. My other lulu’s do not do that and I think it is related to the leggings being mostly nylon but I do not have the receipt and it sucks because they are a lot of money ):

column5: Perfect for running and cross training
column6: I was looking for some higher waist running tights with a a phone pocket. These were a recommendation from a friend and they did not disappoint. The material is very sweat wicking and flexible. My new favorite tights! I wear them for running and orange theory classes. I am 5'3, 115lbs and bought a size 4. Snug but in a good way - they hold you in and dont dig into your waist.

J’ai acheté ces leggings en pensant avoir les meilleurs disponibles sur le marché. Malheureusement, les leggings s’agrandissent rapidement lorsqu’on les porte et ne sont plus aussi ajustés que dans les premières minutes. Je crois que le problème est avec le tissu, puisque j’ai les mêmes dans une autre couleur et que je fais face au même problème. Aussi, il est toujours très difficile de défaire le noeud de la taille élastique, même si je fais attention de ne pas trop le serrer. Malgré tout, ces pantalons sont très confortables et ne sont pas transparents, ce qui est important pour les danseurs comme moi. Donc, je crois que pour le prix élevé, ces leggings n’en valent pas la peine.

A little sad for my very first pair of Lululemon tights.

column6: I received my Fast & Free 7/8 leggings over the holidays as a gift. After wearing them a couple of times, they seemed to become looser as I continued my workout. I recently went on an outdoor run and I was constantly pulling them up and they were very stretched out in the upper thigh area. Comparing them to my other pairs of lulu leggings, this is the only pair that seems to run big. I have not had any other problems with my other leggings but I'm disappointed in the sizing of these pants.

column5: Buy these if you want to look like you peed your pants when you go for a run...
column6:
I was so excited to receive these colored pants as a Christmas gift.
I wore them to the gym for a run and walked out looking like I had peed in my pants. This "Nulux™ fabric is quick-drying, sweat-wicking, and offers lightweight coverage", is not the case! If your butt sweats (don't lie to yourself, all of us have had it happen) you will embarrass yourself at the gym in these pants!

column6: WOW, je ne peux plus m'en passer. Léger et confortable! Vraiment comme une seconde peau.

These leggings are AMAZING!!! I love them because of their sweat wicking material, and soft feel. They fit amazing in all the right places. I bought mine in a size down than I usually do just because they were on sale, but I think that they would still fit great in my normal size. Because I usually wear shorts under my hockey gear and don't do a lot of movement at crew (because I am a coxswain), I use them occasionally as running tights. They work amazing for this because of their reflective details and pockets. I wash mine with my luxtreme Lulu Wunderunders and hang dry and haven't had a problem! If you are considering buying these please do!

I recently received a pair of Fast and Free 7/8 tights as a gift for Christmas. I initially was really pleased with the fit and feel of the tights. However, that did not last long as one of the seams began to come undone after only wearing them twice. Very disappointing.

column5: Pros and Cons... but the cons outweigh the good
column6: So I read the reviews and noticed a lot of people had problems with bagginess in their regular size... I’m kind of between a 4-6 and went with the 4 just in case they did get loose... it was never an issue for me. They really were a bit tighter than I was comfortable with for one wear, but after that they were fine. What is the issue is that I’ve worn them a handful of times, washed them even less and according to the instructions - but now the bottom of the leggings are fraying and I feel like they’re going to start looking really gross really quickly. So even though I’m not having the issue others are having, these still don’t quite hold up to the standards I’d expect from lulu, especially when I pay full price for a product. Sigh.

column6: I have these leggings in black and LOVE them. The deep pockets are great, they stay put and are comfortable for any type of work out. I thought I would buy another pair in a different color and am so disappointed. I am not someone who is very sweaty, and I wear underwear with my leggings and I have never had leggings show so much butt/crotch sweat. The sweat stains stayed long after my workout had ended. I had to leave my workout, I was so embarrassed and grossed out. I would only recommend ever purchasing in black, otherwise it is basically throwing money away for leggings with fabric not made for moving your body.

column6:
This pair of leggings were the first ever lulu lemons I bought (size 12). I loved them because I looked amazing and they felt amazing. After about 5 months there was a hole on the seam, so I went to one store and they said they couldn't do anything, but I knew that they should exchange them because it was on a seam, so I went to another location. At that location she exchanged them no problem (and gave me a smaller size because the other size was too big) and it was all good. Fast forward 5 more months and now my "new" ones have a hole in the back of the leg. I have no idea why this hole happened, but since it isn't on a seam I cannot exchange them. So overall they didn't really last me that long. Also even my "new" ones were really loose, I recommend getting a size or two down because I had to tie them up with the elastic waist band on both pairs.
Other than that though I loved the actual design and feel of the leggings, it honestly doesn't even feel like you're wearing anything. They are super light material, which make them great to work out in without getting overly hot. They look amazing and the pockets are the perfect deepness so your phone doesn't fall out.

column5: You wont find a better pair of leggings
column6:
These and the Fast & Frees are my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE LEGGINGS! Seriously cannot stop buying them I have 5 pairs now. SO flattering, stay on no matter what activity, no pilling, no stretch. They're the best and definitely worth the money. 100% would recommend.
Just be cautious that they run tight!
I'm shot but just fold over the bottom a tad.
I just recently bought 2 of these pants an am in love with them! They wore and held up extremely well in my high intensity kick boxing class. Will be buying more!

I have a crop version of the fast & free which I LOVE; however, the 7/8 pair that I recently purchased were of very poor quality. They fit great at first, but after only two runs they were so stretched out that they kept falling down within two minutes of running, even when I make use of the drawcord.
I ran a half marathon in the fall in my crop version, and they were perfect for holding everything I needed. I'm running another one in February, and I bought these thinking they would be the same (I bought the exact same size), but they can't even stay up on their own during a short run! Can't image what would happen if I tried to stash gels or a phone, which is ridiculous considering the pockets are a selling point. Really disappointed in the quality and how much they stretched, especially since I bought them on sale & they can't be returned.

column5: Do Not Buy! Or Size Down!
column6: I was so looking forward to these leggings and I absolutely loved them for the first 15 minutes, however they quickly started to sag in the knee and butt area and I cannot take 3 steps without pulling them up because the waist loosened so drastically. It got to the point where people actually commented that I was clearly wearing the wrong size. I bought the size I have in other Lululemon leggings, however these quickly lost their shape, making them hard to wear for a workout and frankly a bit embarrassing. If you are still keen to buy, SIZE DOWN otherwise you will waste $140 like me. Very disappointing.

These are probably my new favorite pants from Lulu! They fit great and they don't sag or anything while running. The only downside is that if your thighs are a bit more muscular, the seams that run down the leg pull, and it makes the pants look too small even if they fit perfectly. Other than that, they're great pants!

These tights are my new favorite! They stay put!
No tugging or sagging! Great fit! Great for Crossfit!

column5: I need the dark carbon colour!
column6: I purchased the black colour, I love them. This will be my first time writing a review and I am mostly doing this because the dark carbon colour is beautiful and I would love to purchase it and add it to my collection. So please bring it back! It is no longer available in my size. What a gorgeous colour and shine to the leggings. I really hope you do!

These tights are so comfortable and soft! It hardly feels like I'm wearing anything haha! I am concerned that they will stretch... but as of now, they fit perfectly! I don't find them see through at all either. I got them on sale a week ago and have loved them so far! All 6 (i think) pockets are amazing!!! The seamless part on the ankles makes them extra comfortable.
column15: very thin therefore can see underwear line

column6: I have these tights in two colors. They are very soft and extremely comfortable. I've worn them for running and crossfit and they've performed well for both. The only downside is that dog hair sticks to them, but I keep a lint roller handy for that purpose.

column5: Wish I read reviews before buying
column6: I bought this pair in the Dallas store on Knox and immediately loved them. I was even planning on going back for the full-length pair. However, just as other reviewers mentioned, after the first wear/wash, I noticed that the leggings no longer fit like they did when I tried them on in the store. They have become a lot looser and I feel myself pulling them up constantly at the gym. I also feel like they lost any compression they had when I first tried them on. This is my first pair of lululemon leggings and I was expecting an improvement over my typical Nike Pro leggings, but after spending almost double on these compared to the Nike ones and having the pair not hold up after the first wear and wash, I am extremely disappointed.

column6: I wanted to add to the comments about the pants falling down. I have to pull them up constantly. I don't feel that they're too big. My original fast and free 7/8 in the same size are perfection and I rarely have to pull them up. They are otherwise quite flattering .. It seems that something may have changed from one version to the next.

column5: Fell in love w/ them, but sorely disappointed
column6:
I LOVED these leggings for over a year, but they just dont hold up. I bought them almost exactly a year ago this month. The leggings look amazing, feel like a second skin and the pockets are so convenient.
HOWEVER, they have stretched considerably, the pilling along the seams is pretty bad and today after feeling a breeze in yoga class I noted that the seams along the crotch were broken resulting in two holes. I've treated and cleaned the leggings according to Lululemons suggestions, but they just didnt hold up.
These leggings would be the holy grail if they didn't fall apart. I will be swapping the pair my family bought me for this Christmas for a different style.

column6: Got these in black a couple months ago and these are very thin, I have a few in different prints/ colors but the black fabric feels thinner and they are see through. they started to get these little holes around the back area from the fabric being so thin.

column5: Great fit - beware of bright colours
column6:
I love the fit of these pants, they are comfortable, lightweight, and stay where they are supposed to whether I am running or squatting and lifting weights. However, beware of the bright colours. My pants are pink - and when I sweat the wet fabric has a huge colour change. Even when lightly sweating the pants look like I've pee'd in them. I am now afraid to wear them unless I'm around my house or running in the dark. Hopefully the darker colours hide the sweat marks better.
- Afraid to sweat at the gym
Hands down my new favorite workout pants. But the stitching on the butt already started to come unwind and I’ve only washed them twice and never dried.
I was really excited about the color. But when I turned around, all you can see is cellulite I didn’t know I even have. Disappointed these are so see through!!

column6: At first I was hesitant to purchase leggings that are over $100, but these are so worth it! They are so comfortable and stretchy. I realize why they are so expensive now. I highly recommend having at least one pair of Lululemon leggings.

Okay, hear me out. I NEVER write reviews, but I feel very strongly about this particular purchase. This was my first time ever purchasing anything Lululemon because I am pretty active and I figured I should finally start investing in athletic clothing that will last me a while. I went to the store and tried on pretty much every pair of leggings and landed on these because they were so buttery soft and I do quite a bit of HIIT. Firstly, the person who helped me out recommended a size that was about 1 to 2 sizes too big upon wearing them by the second time. I went back to the store and they happily exchanged my purchase to the correct size and I was thrilled to work out in them, use them for commute, and honestly, just to hang around my apartment. The exchange happened about a month and a half or two ago, and they've already stretched out significantly (I have not lost weight). Additionally, they have started to pill between my thighs, which I get would happen with jeans or cheaper material, but my inexpensive leggings from discount stores that I've had for years haven't even done that. The fact that $16 leggings are holding up better than $128 leggings is so baffling. The reason I did give it two stars is because they make my booty look so good, the fabric is so, so, so soft and as long as they don't stretch out, they give you a really nice shape. Again, mine have stretched and not even the waistband tie can hold them up while I WALK, let alone when I'm doing burpees at the studio. Honestly, if you're going to buy these, size down about three sizes, or find another legging from Lulu that is made for the same activity. I'm so disappointed that this has been my first experience with the brand because I've heard so many great things about it.

column6: I am very petite and it’s very hard to find a pair of leggings that can fit like a glove.

I bought these hoping to get great fitting pants to wear all day and to the gym. They do fit well at first but with wear throughout the day they slip down and seem to stretch. I find myself constantly pulling them up and adjusting to keep them in place. This makes them extremely impractical to attempt to workout in, i'd expect more from this pricepoint.

column5: I like it, but I wish it was better quality!
column6: I absolutely love how it fits, but this pants is not sweat proof. Unless you have a black pair, a drop of sweat will be shown to the world to see. Also the seam created so much piling, which really bums me out since I only wore it twice so far, and I gentle wash and hang dry my pants. For the price I paid, I wish it was better quality...

I got these pants for my birthday in black. I needed a staple legging to wear everyday. They were my favorite for awhile but overtime they stretched out. I took care of these exactly how lululemon directed, but they still stretched. It is a bummer as I can't wear them to yoga or running without pulling up the leggings 100 times. Also overtime they pilled on the inner thighs, which shouldn't happen especially with the way I take care of them. Also, I feel as the fabric is very thin as there is a hole in mine and Im not even sure how it got there. Now with all these factors combined, I can't even wear these leggings. Overall, very dissapointing as I usually love lululemon and these pants were very expensive. Wouldn't reccomend anyone buy these.

column6: This is my third pair of leggings and of the three kinds I have tried rugs style is by far my favorite! They are extremely flattering and fit true to size!

All time favorite leggings! My go to yoga (of course) and travel pants (the side pocket is awesome for phone/passport when traveling). The material is so soft and not to be corny but luxurious. Perfect fit, enough to tuck in my lower tummy without suffocating me. PLEASE RESTOCK in navy!!! I want to buy more colors :)
I love Love LOVE that these do not roll! I caught my girlfriend asking around on Facebook for the best Lulus that don’t roll, and these were mentioned. I now have two pair!

I love these legging. They are so comfy, the only thing is, I wish the sales lady would of told me about them stretching out a bit after wearing them awhile. I washed them hoping it would help, and then wore them again today. They are still so comfortable, it just that after a couple hours, I find them a bit saggy around my knees and I'm pulling them up often. I wish I would of sized down. I will still buy them in the future, I just know now to purchase down a size.
thanks.
Great fitting pant with a perfect outside pocket.

Wow after 3 months I am very disappointed in the quality of these leggings. While they are not meant to be as compressive as my other Lulu leggings, this pair has lost almost all its shape! I consistently have to pull them up while running and the pilling is unbelievable!!! I don't even reach for them anymore, and they stay at the bottom of my drawer.
These are not worth the money. Instead, I'd recommend the Speed Up tights. They are my favorites for running and they have the same side pocket feature and actually hold their shape (they're even a bit cheaper??).

I am a competitive runner and it is always hard to find a good pair of leggings that I won't have to constantly pull up while on the run, but these are the best!! They fit perfectly and stay up on the run. BUT... the seams are starting to fray which is disappointing.
5'3", 125-130 pounds, size 4 based on reviews. Red Violet color was too sheer. Comfort good.

column6: The fast and free tight is the best leggings I have ever put on. This is my 2nd pair... first pair- black and second pair- dark grey!!! They stay up while I workout and while at practices. They are smooth and truly fit amazing! I love the side opening if I need to stick anything in a pocket.

So let me start by saying I have 2 pairs of these pants in black-love them- they are the best for cross training and running.
I recently purchased another pair but in blue. I’m not sure if there is something defective with this pair because I also noticed it doesn’t have the reflective dots going down the bottom of each side like my 2 other pairs.
The real mortifying thing is, I finished my class and looked in the mirror and was shocked to see massive sweat marks in my crotch and back region. I had to leave class early to go get my sweater to cover up! I’m really hoping I got a defective pair. To pay $130 for these pants and them not to have the defect plus the embarrassing sweat stains is just not acceptable.
Please help Lulu!

column6: Bought these for my wife and they make her buns and legs look amazing! She likes them too.

I have asked my husband to bury me in these when I pass... they truly fit the description of “barely there.” I was afraid I would miss the lack of hard core compression from other tights, but instead I find myself not missing needing to reposition, pull up the waist, pull down the legs and constantly adjust other tights. These are like a second skin. I couldn’t be happier so far.

After ordering (and being disappointed in) 3 pairs of Lululemon running tights online, I finally went in to a local store and the worker recommended the fast and free tights. I instantly fell in love. The material is so smooth, second skin feeling and feels great on. I thought the side pockets would be weird but it turns out I really love them while running. I've also learned that the interior drawcord is a must for me while running; no more sagging pants! I've already recommended them to a friend and will hopefully be buying more in the near future. I am 5' 4", 143lbs and purchased size 6.

I just want to start by saying that I love these pants! I am wanting to buy another pair but my only hesitation is that the seams on mine have MAJOR piling. I don't know how to get rid of this or prevent it from happening?
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear anniew1234,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I\'m sorry to hear of the pilling that you\'re experiencing on your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" and can understand why you\'re not pleased. To carry on this conversation, we\'ve sent you a follow up email. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 31, 2018'}

column6: So far I’ve only worn these for hot yoga and they worked great!!! Definitely comfortable and breathable material and they stayed in place very well.

Bought these for my teenage daughter as a Christmas gift. She is an 8, and when I took these out of package they looked so small, I didn’t think they would fit, but they did. She does not use them for exercise, so I can’t comment on how they work for running, etc. my daughter just wears them like any other pair of leggings. She is curvy, athletic, 5’4 and they are flattering and fit like a glove. They are soft and silky and she absolutely loves them!

Love love love. New favorite workout pants/tights. The material is so smooth and the tights seem to hug all the right places. I have a curvier/more muscular build (from CrossFit) and I really thought these tights were flattering. I can’t wait to buy more!
My wife loved them. Said they were like she was wearing nothing.
The fit and feel are perfect!!

These are the perfect fit for long distance run. I never have to readjust or feel like they are moving around & uncomfortable. I’m training for a half & refuse to wear any other tights on my long runs.

I've bought three pairs of these pants as I loved them so much. After having one of the pairs for about 6 months now, the seam in-between my legs has ripped and there is now two holes. For the price, I do not thing this should be happening. Very disappointed in this, but other than that I loved them. It seems as though this pant is not good for people who's thighs touch.

Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 29, 2018'}

column6: These are hands down my favourite pants and I have several styles. They feel like a second skin and stay up very well. I use them for running, yoga, pilates and barre. They are true to size in my opinion, 5'6", 128lb, size 4.

Love the fit, love the feeling. The sizing is consistent with other products and this material feels incredible. However, have the same thoughts as some other reviewers regarding quality. One review had mentioned being see through...I did slightly notice during my initial wear but didn't pay too much attention to this as I was so impressed with the feeling of the material and the fit. After one wash, seems between the legs began to run and the faded / "see-through-ness" had really increased. I so badly want to love these but was bummed about the quality - I've never had an issue with quality.
Love these tights. Great fit and they stay in place

I have been wearing Fast and Frees for the past year and a half and love them! They are perfect for lifting, running, HIIT, etc. I recently bought the Dark Olive color and WHOA - you can see all my sweat! The first time I wore them, my workout was weight focused so not a very sweaty work and noticed my sweat showing. I wore them again today for a cardio focused workout and my sweat showed everywhere - my knees, butt and crotch. Not just a little but a lot! It was a hard workout so everyone was sweaty but I was still embarrassed of how much sweat showed in my lower region. I recommend these pants but in a dark color - navy, black or a pattern.

column6: Love the fit and feel of these pants but disappointed in the quality. After a few wears the seam along the backside has started pulling and unraveling in parts. It’s too bad because these are the only running tights I’ve found that don’t slide down and are comfortable for long runs. I wanted to love these and buy them in different lengths too, but can’t afford the seams to come apart again...
These are amazing, it’s like you have nothing on. They hold all my problem areas in. I’ll kever buy another legging!!

column5: loved them but they stretch out easily
column6: I got these as a gift and at first, I loved them but after a couple of workouts, I noticed that they stretch out more making these pants really hard to work out in. I recommend going a size smaller. I think the idea of these leggings are great it's just not executed well

column5: Go to leggings for the Gym
column6: These are my go to leggings for the gym. I love them. After losing 70 lbs, I have invested in Lulu for the gym and everyday. These leggings were the third pair I tried for the gym. After wearing these a couple times per week for months of workouts, I've gradually added more and phased out my other leggings for "if all my Fast & Free are dirty" days. These are a second skin and keep me cool while running. They don't bunch or ride up while I'm on the rower or lifting weights. I loooooooove them and will buy them in every color that won't show sweat. My favorite!!

Recently purchased these and my excitement for them was short lived. I had tried on my usual size and also a pair one size down, just to be sure. I had to wiggle and jump to get the smaller pair on and it felt way too tight. Well, I wish I had purchased the smaller size! After wearing them for less than an hour I could already feel the pants being stretched out. I was seeing extra material, in the form or creases and gathering where I would bend or twist.
Very disappointed especially because these were on the more expensive end. Also, perhaps the store employees could've suggested a smaller size, like with the Align pants.

column5: Stretched way out after first wear
column6: I bought these in store a couple months ago and absolutely loved them the first time I wore them. I have to say if they wouldn't have stretched, they would've been my favorite lulus ever. Unfortunately, even following the care instructions they stretched out drastically to the point where I can't even wear them without feeling self conscious and pulling them up every few seconds, let alone ever running in them again. I love lululemon and have tons of different styles, and I've never experienced an issue like this. Have to say I'm very disappointed and regret spending so much on them.

I initially purchased these leggings because I run cross country, and I was looking for a sturdy pair of pants that were long lasting. Despite the comfortable running experience they provided for the first few weeks, I was hoping they would last longer than they did for the amount I had spent on them. The pocket openings became very loose after following the directions on how to properly wash them. Similarly, the seamless ankles were very loose after a few wears. I don't believe the quality of the pants were worth the cost, and I wished they had lasted longer.

I debated spending this much at first, but being that I've spent this on several other styles and loved them, I assumed the same would be for these. I was constantly having to pull them up, not only that, but they are extremely baggy and unattractive on my butt and around my legs because they have stretched out a ridiculous amount. I wear a size 4 in all lulu pants and maybe had I sized down they would fit better and look more flattering. I am extremely disappointed, in that I always end up taking them back of and never making it to the gym or on a run in them.

column6: These are the best pants I’ve bought from lulu! They fit perfectly.

These are the best running legging that Lulu makes. I love the material, fit and they have pockets. They are super smooth and lightweight and dry very quickly after a sweaty run. my only issue is that the seams tend to get really fuzzy with use. I'm not sure how that happens when you run but it does. It makes them look less durable but it doesn't effect the function.

I recently bought my first Lululemon leggings as an early Christmas present to myself. I bought both the Pace Rival Crop and Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II. The first time I wore the leggings they were fantastic! The fit was perfect- I slipped my legs into the smoothest leggings ever made. They allowed for great range of motion, and I made it through a 5-mile run in the Fast & Free tights without having to pull them back into place. I lifted in the Pace Rival Crop, and the experience was equally enjoyable. And I'm in love with the slide pockets on the legs! The leggings were so comfortable that I forgot I was even wearing them. After the first wear, I would have given 10 stars for each!!
Unfortunately, after washing according to care instructions and hanging dry a couple of times, BOTH pairs seem to have stretched out and are no longer true to size. The legs seem too large, the bottom stretched and isn't as form-fitting anymore, and I have to cinch the drawstring at the waist about 4 inches in order to keep them in place. It's hard to enjoy and focus on a workout when I'm constantly tugging at my leggings to keep them in place. I lift 4 days a week and run 5 days a week, so having the right apparel is crucial. The price tag on these leggings was high, but I was willing to pay it for leggings that seemed so perfect when I tried them on and during my first few workouts with each. I REALLY wanted these to be my favorite leggings, but I'm disappointed that I spent so much money on items that the fit seemed to change so dramatically. Maybe purchasing a size down would have helped?

column6: These are my absolute favorite pants lulu has ever made! Many of my friends swear by the "naked" feel of the align pants, but since I am a runner I knew the aligns would not hold up the way I need them to. So I went into lulu and the sweet Educator recommended these tights for what I was looking for. These pants combine the awesome "naked" comfort of the align, with the sweat-wicking material of many of my other running tights. They are truly the best of both worlds!
Extremely comfortable and well made.

column5: I love them but they stretch in all the wrong places.
column6:
These are super comfy, breezy, and amazing. My qualm started when the waistband, knees and booty area stretched out.
I'm a climber, practically vertical yoga, and in the last three months they've stretched, which breaks my heart because I love them so much.
Just for the fabric that's being used I'd get them again. On the condition that the stitching for waistband and knee areas are reinforced to prevent stretching.

column5: Back seam unraveling: do not buy until corrected
column6: Love the feel and fit of these...feel amazing on. So disappointed that like many other reviews the upper back seam is unraveling. The serged seam must not be finished off properly for this to be happening to mine and so many others. At $128 this is unacceptable. Only worn twice and it’s not a sizing issue. 5’5 and 130. I will be taking into store tomorrow. Please read reviews and wait until Lululemon fixes this issue before purchasing.

column6: These have been my favorite pair of leggings since I got them about 9 months ago. They fit true to size and cover up the love handles! They are so comfy and free feeling! However, i only wear them a few times a month for working out because they are already showing wear and tear. A hole is starting to form above the knee and the stitching is frayed all over. This should not be happening for $100 leggings. Don’t waste your money :(

column6: Tights fit great and the lightness of the fabric is perfect!
I really like these leggings. They run bigger than I’m used to so I went from my usual size 10 to an 8 but then if I wear a pattern the pattern stretched. Love them in solid colors though.

This is my first pair of Lululemon leggings and I am EXTREMELY disappointed! I wore them twice and they are not what I expected. The fabric becomes so lose after the first time wearing them, they do not feel tight anymore at all. It feels uncomfortable to run in these as they will not keep up. I bought one size down from my normal size thinking I would get the real "naked" feel. The sales associate at the store assured me they will be great for running but when I tried to run in them the kept on falling. Horrible quality and I cannot wear them anymore because they do not look or feel good.

column6: These are the first pants I ever bought from lulu and I use them quite frequently, especially since I love the feel of the pants. I specifically wanted to buy pants that had pockets and naked sensation. I had them hemmed, but I'd say that I'm disappointed at the fact that the pockets and the pants stretch out very easily. Also, when I hemmed it, the bottom part is flaring out a bit. I've only have them for a month and I can already tell the pockets are stretched and the pants itself. I wash them according to the instructions, but they are stretched already.

column6: I absolutely love these leggings! It is my new favorite pair to wear to any type of workout. They passed the squat test with glory and have been hugging my curves in all the right places. The color is also great, it definitely makes me feel empowered and confident.
I loved these leggings at first, but only after having them for 2 months, there are several small holes in the knees. Kind of upsetting as I haven't had the chance to wear them very much either

I'd love to chat with you further about this and find a resolution. Watch out for an email coming your way soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 12, 2018'}

column6: I now have 3 pairs. The best thing I can say is they stay up. As someone with narrow hips I’m forever pulling up tights. I go from circuit training to running and they stay where they are. The pockets are great I can’t remember how I lived without them. Describing the fit as naked feeling is exactly what they feel like. I do buy one size up. I’m 5’4 120, normally a 2. My fast and free tights are all size 4.

Really disappointed about these leggings. I had the wunder under leggings for almost 4 years until I lost them this fall. I bought this style in black online and I’m really unhappy with the product. I ordered my normal size but they were loose and became stretched out after a few wears, and are constantly falling down. It’s impossible to workout or go running in these because you’re constantly pulling them up. The cord waistband is useless in my opinion because it’s so stretchy. The outer pockets have became slightly stretched out as well which is unflattering. The only things I liked were the reflective dots on the side and the stitching is very flattering. I would buy this design only if it were in a different fabric.
