We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 12, 2018'}

column6: I personally love Lulu and their pants along with legging. the thing is I have bought 2 pairs of these black leggings and they tend to get very ugly the 1st time I wash them. they easy rip on the sides after drying. Also I was sitting on carpet and they got messed up with the material not being so smooth anymore. overall the price is a bit to much but they are comfortable. I wish they didn't get so ugly after washing though.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Jacki23,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. Oh no, I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. Hang tight for an email coming your way! Chat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 12, 2018'}

column5: Comfiest leggings ever but wear out quickly
column6: I loved these leggings immediately when I tried them on and decided to buy them in black. I'm pretty short, and the 25" was the perfect length for me. I was super happy with them until they started to pill slightly between my thighs, and now the seam is beginning to become loose. When I first got the leggings they were pretty tight, but after a while they are kind of stretched out.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear anap1216,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We\'re sorry to read of your recent experience with the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" and would love to discuss this further. We\'d love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 11, 2018'}

column6: I bought these 7 months ago and they are the best leggings I own. They hug/fit so nice. You can tell they are quality. They are great for outside runs because they can hold things in the side pockets without having to worry something may fall out. Unfortunately I am noticing they are not as tight as they were when I first bought them. They seem to be loosening up a bit. But still my favorite leggings!

Give me all the fast & free's. These are my favorite pant by far to sweat in. I have the 19" and I ordered the full length but they wrapped around my heels. Too long for me. I am 5'5" and the 7/8 length is almost full length on me. I love everything about them.

I was most surprised to find how versatile these leggings are, in terms of both activity type and temperature conditions; they've held up perfectly for running, cycling, yoga and hiking; the material is thin and lightweight yet insulating enough to keep me warm in 40-50 degree weather.
The ONLY downside is that after a year and a half of continuous use, the waist band has began to lose its elasticity and the seams are starting to come undone. Fair, given the amount of use, and 100% worth the purchase!
(For reference I'm 5'4", 118lb and wear a size 4 - the 7/8 tight fits like full length)

These leggings are AMAZING! I am a dedicated runner and being from the south, I need a pair of leggings that I trust will keep me warm, are functional, and maintain comfort throughout the entire run. Like I said in the title, I already have 3 pairs! Most leggings slide down when I run, but I am not constantly pulling up these leggings which is so nice. Also, I love that these leggings have pockets. I am 5'4" so the 7/8 length are basically regular length leggings for me. So if you are shorter to average height, I would definitely recommend these as full length leggings. I also really like how sweat-wicking the fabric is and the stitching is very flattering!
This is my second pair because they are some of the best and most flattering tights I have found recently. Love them for winter and likely summer too.

column5: Great tights but beware of color sheer
column6:
I own these in three colors now: black, Flowerescent Multi, and Pixel Haze Multi Black. The black ones are perfect! Super soft, comfortable, slight compression, pockets.
The other two, on the other hand, are printed on white (??) so at the slightest amount of stretch, the tights turn white instead of black. I'm 5'2", 49kg, with bigger quads, and the patterned tights stretch over the quads so much that the rest of the tight is black but the quad area is light grey. The Flowerescent Multi that I own are a size 2, and the Pixel Haze Multi Black are a size 4 -- the size 2 has a lot more color sheer but fit more comfortably at the waist, whereas the size 4 have less color sheer but are looser/less comfortable.
Again -- just beware of your color choice. The black ones have been perfect but the patterned ones have weird printing that is prone to sheer.

Loved these leggings, the colors are beautiful (true navy and dark olive), and they were very comfortable! But started getting worried after wearing them a couple of times, the back seams started unraveling. Now I am extremely disappointed. I have a couple different friends who have these leggings, and they had no problem (which is why I chose to purchase them) so maybe it's a manufacturer error? I am just disappointed I cannot wear them anymore!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Dear LU22,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm super sorry to hear that your Fast & Free tight didn't work out for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'December 9, 2018'}

column6: I have bought lululemon pants as gifts for my family many times, but I never could justify treating myself to a pair because of the price. With my first half marathon coming up I decided to splurge and invest in a great pair of pants. I spoke with the sales associate in the store and she told me that the Fast & Free pants would be best for running. I chose the Dark Olive color in a size 6 (normally a 4). She recommended that I size up for extra comfort saying these pants compress the body and won't stretch. I just got home from my first run since purchase and, while the material felt amazing, I had to pull them up multiple times as I ran and when I got home I saw I had an embarrassing sweat mark in my crotch that made it look like I peed myself!! I feel sad that I spent this money on pants that I do not want to wear again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Dear MeowMeowJess,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm super sorry to hear that your Fast & Free tight didn't work out for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'December 9, 2018'}

column6: This tight is super cute and I really like it when I got it. Unfortunately, it doesn't hold its fit very well. After 2 wears, it has stretched out a lot and does not fit like a lululemon tights should. It now shows extra fabric at the back of the knee. I usually wear a size 6-8 and already got a size 6. It's almost like you have to buy a really small size and deal with it being uncomfortable and then it stretches out to your size.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear Tokidoki18,\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hear you and would love to help you turn this around. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 10, 2018'}

column5: My favorite leggings- but size down because they stretch
column6: I bought the black ones about 6 months ago in size 10 as recommended in store by an employee, and I loved them however in a few months they stretched out and became baggy. Then I bought the dark pink ones and sized down and they are my go-to leggings I love them so much, they are so comfortable, and don't fall down as you run or work out. However, I highly recommend sizing down on the leggings because I wish I would have initially sized down on the black ones as I don't wear them very much anymore:(

My mom bought me a pair of Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" not so long ago and I loved them, but after a few wears I saw the fabric thinning between the thighs. I've been wearing lululemon leggings for a long time and it's the only brand I wear, and my sister wears ivivva and we love the brand. This is the first time I'm truley disappointed with a product.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: Seriously in love with Fast & Free! They hold up well during weight training classes. I didn't find myself having to pull it, unlike other workout leggings. I know people have mentioned the sweat showing. It showed a bit of sweat on mine but it honestly wasn't a problem. I highly recommend this over other ones and will definitely be buying more!

After wearing the fast and frees I don't really wear anything else to run or get a good tough workout in. They don't slip down, aren't see through at all AND pockets!
I love the seamless bottom as well. Very tight, but not suffocating. All around awesome pair of pants, thanks Lululemon!

I tried on several different tights for this season's Lulu haul =) and these ones took the cake!
The seams run in all of the right places, to create a very flattering silhouette on the leg. The side pockets are GREAT for holding my phone. Seriously, I can't feel that my phone is even in there. The fabric is light but warm enough for cool California mornings. The reflective details at the bottom add just a touch of visual interest.
The 7/8 length is actually a perfect "full length" for my 5'5" frame.
I own these now in two colors (black and dark gray). Both are very flattering. I will be returning the navy since it doesn't suit me, but it's also a very pretty shade.
Fit is great but after first wash, the seams started unraveling. I expected better quality with this price.

column6: i got these leggings for my birthday and i was so excited because i've wanted these for a while. they're super comfortable and i love the pockets, but after about 3 washes the stitching on the back started to come off, now anytime you barely touch that area more stitching comes off :( don't want to wear them again because i'm scared something will rip

column6: I have these in the royal blue--it is a perfect blue--one of those colors that makes you happy to put your gear on and go. The pockets are deep and plentiful and the fabric has been warm enough so far for mid 30s and high wind. They don't stay up over the menopot (that lovely middle age bulge that nothing makes better), but I don't think there is a material alive that can beat the pot. My only recommendation would be to add a soft mesh behind the knees. Another brand has something like this and it makes them just that little bit more comfortable. That being said, I am saving my pennies for more colors.

column6: I have a few other leggings in nulux and bought two of these at once since I like the fabric so much. Fantastic...for one wear. I wore each of them once and washed them each once ( following all directions). To my surprise the stitching in the back is completely coming apart at the seams. both pants have the exact same issue in the exact same place. Once again there seem to be a quality control issues with lulu. I am sad to see this keep happening over and over.

These leggings are amazing! These are my go to leggings for everything: orange theory, errands, lounging etc. I have them in black and green and both have a rich color to it that doesn't fade after many washes. It fits and feels like it's apart of your skin. It has honestly ruined me for all other leggings.

I am a loyal Lulu customer and love all of their products, but this pant took the L. After one day of wearing them, the seam in the back started to unravel, and it keeps getting worse. However, they are a great fitting pant, very conformable,and perfect for working out.

column6: I LOVE these. I have several pair. They are super thing and silky- feel like you are wearing nothing- great for wearing all day to workout then go to Farmer's market, hang out, etc. Love the material- wear my regular size. Size 4- I'm 5,6, 128 lbs.

I love this leggings. They were so comfortable and the pockets are a huge plus. But the seams are terrible. Mine are ripping apart almost to where the seam has become completely undone. For paying $130 for these leggings I would assume the quality of the material would last but unfortunately it does not.

column6:
I love these pants-- great for pet-parent's as the fabric seems to deter pet hair unlike aligns, which attract pet hair. My only qualm is that the pocket on the side that you are supposed to place your phone in, got a hole from my phone being in the pocket. For expensive pants, I would've hoped that they hold up better.
Otherwise I'd give these a 5 star review!

I have only worn them a couple of times and they are already pilling in various spots. Very disappointed about how they have stretched out

column6: I ordered my tts 8 but these were too tight, mostly in the very top of the waistband. The fabric was really nice feeling, but the fit should be perfect for the price these are going for.
These pants are amazing! Initially I was concerned due to their “naked” feeling, but they kept me warm despite their thinness. After long distances, they were surprisingly not as sweaty as expected.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: I will start with saying that I love Fast and Free pants a lot and I have 4 pairs of them already (crops). Since it's getting colder I bought those in the same size as all the other ones, 6. I loved them the first few times I wore them but they stretched so much I am no longer able to work out in them, even the drawstring isn't enough anymore. This happen with my other ones but not as much as with this ones. I still workout in my capris, but sadly not in this ones. I still will use them but $128 pants for walking the dog is little extreme. My advice: size down!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Aga1033,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. It sounds like your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux 25" has not retained its shape. column5: Truly life changing- until they weren't
column6: My first pair of Fast and Frees (crops from summer 2017) are holding up better than this pair I got in spring 2018. They are truly amazing pants- so comfortable and functional I wanted to buy every color and wear them everyday. However they've lasted about 6 months of weekly wear but they are starting to stretch. They've pilled in weird places too- the back of the calves. I take great care in washing them but for some reason these pants just don't last. The stretch in the waistband and thigh area just keeps getting worse :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey slh1028,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. It sounds like your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux 25" has not retained its shape. We stand behind our gear and want to make this right. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 1, 2018'}

column6:
These pants feel like absolutely nothing and are a dream to wear, or at least they were until I wore them a few times. Each time I wear these they stretch more and more. I stopped putting my cell phone in the pocket thinking it was dragging them down but they still continue to loosen the more I run. I pull them up and tie the waistband, but the crotch sags when I run and I am constantly stopping to pull them back up.
I am extremely diligent about washing my lululemon items because I often stretch my budget to buy them. I take care of my tights and was unable to save this pair.

I normally LOVE lululemon and swear by this brand; even though it is expensive it is normally amazing quality that holds up so well and lasts so long it is worth the price. However with these leggings within the first 2 weeks of buying them they have stretched so much and I purchased a size 2.I like wearing leggings to the gym with a swiftly tech but do not feel comfortable wearing these anymore because they have stretched so much they look indecent to be wearing a short shirt and have no compression. Very disappointed since I only bought them 2 weeks ago and they were $128. I want to buy more leggings but am afraid they may do the same thing.

column6: the leggings definitely have a naked sensation and are great for running BUT the material is weak. I washed in once and I always air dry my Lulu and these leggings picked so bad. I have only worn them about a handful of times and they look like they are at the end of their life. The money is not worth these leggings and they won't last you more than a week. They also stretch big time and I bought them small originally, overall I'd rather go and get Walmart leggings because they will probably hold up better and would probably only be $20......

column6: As these pants are super cute and soft to the touch, I went ahead and ordered them against the many reviews claiming that they were quick to wear out. True to reviews, 2 or 3 washes and the waist band is rolling over from a forward fold to a crunch, so while they are cute with boots for everyday wear, they fail to function in the studio

column5: stretched A LOT in just 3 wears
column6: I had these pants in black for a year and I loved them. I got them in a gray-ish color this year and they have stretched so much in just 3 wears that I have to pull them up constantly as I am working out. Really disappointed by the quality given the price.

column6: These are hands down the best running tights I own. They are comfortable, stay in place and not chaffing. The length is great for us shorter gals!
Love the cool and light feeling of these pants and the super functional, and stealth pockets. Perfect for carrying phone and keys. Makes these perfect for working out and running around town.

I got these leggings less than a year ago for a birthday gift. I really loved them a lot, especially the high-rise, waist drawcord, and side pockets. I am about 5'8" and 125 lbs and I got a size 4 in black. The material was very nice, smooth/silky and very lightweight and thin and the leggings made my waist look really thin and my butt look really nice. However, I noticed a couple months ago that there was a lot of piling on the seam and I noticed a couple weeks after, around my knees and above there was a weird grainy/sandy look to that area. I looked further and realized that there was a small hole near my knee as well. This was really upsetting because the sandy texture was really noticeable and they were my favorite leggings. Also, I kinda wish the leggings went down a little further and had a seam on the end. Overall, these leggings are good (not amazing) and worth the price, unless you wear them a lot (because they will wear down). I think next time I will get ones with a thicker material so they don't wear down so fast. I expected more from LuluLemon though.

I am sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux 25" is not performing as you hoped it would be. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'November 28, 2018'}

column6: I wanted to try a different style (usually get the aligns) and I am so disappointed in these leggings. They are completely see through and I bought a black pair...I can only imagine lighter colours...I only wore them once and now they sit in my closet. They are definitely not made for anything other than standing. For the price I was expecting better quality.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear Keeksssss,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux 25". We\'re sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Hang tight for an email coming your way! Chat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 28, 2018'}

column6: They are the best leggings I have ever owned and I got so many compliments on the color. Totally worth every single dollar.
Absolutely LOVE these leggings! Love everything about them. The way it fits and the way it feels. Material so light and breezy. Feels so smooth and soft!

I recently tried the fast and frees for the first time and fell madly in love! I already have five pairs I think. I love all the fun patterns and of course, I had to have a solid black too. I love the feel of the fabric. It's so soft and comfortable. These will be perfect for summer because they feel light and cool. I don't reach for them as much when it gets cold because they do nothing to keep me warm. I love the waistband and the fabric. I love the pocket and I love the raw edge of the pant. I took one star off because I'm struggling a little with the fit. My measurements are exactly between an 8 and a 10. When I wear an 8, the waistband feels a little too tight for my liking. When I wear a 10, it feels perfect but the crotch area/upper thighs sag/fall a little. It's bizarre because the waist stays in place but I have to hike up the thigh area fabric a lot. Maybe this is my fault because I am between sizes. Anyway, it drives me crazy when I teach in these but when I work out in these and actually sweat, it doesn't happen. So my take away is that these are perfect for working out (lifting/cardio) but not ideal for teaching. I am 5'9 and 155 lbs.

I was a really hard sell that any running tights could be worth more than a $100 but I admit I love these. I still gulp at the price but I can't find anything comparable. The Nulux fabric is amazing as well as the pockets and fit. Wearing about 3X a week for 6 months appears to be their life expectancy as sadly they begin showing overuse at that point. At the 6 month timeline they are a bit stretched out and I have to pull them up when I run plus the colors begin fading. But we had a great 6 months together! I assume that is reasonable wear and tear as I run in these a lot. I consider these a good investment. I like that they come in interesting patterns that hide crotch sweat nicely but still give me more color options than black.
I love these fast and free tights ! The fit and function are awesome. I liked them so much I bought two more pair. A well made tight . Love them
It is comfy and easy to move around in. It brings in the waist and is easy to run in.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column5: Great feel and design, but stretch out
column6: I was hesitant to buy these leggings because of how expensive they are, but after I tried them on in the store it was hard to say no.. .The fabric has an amazing feel, they are thin and breathable but still feel like they hold you in a bit -- and the are super soft! However, after only a month of wear they are already stretched out. While there is an elastic waistband which makes them still usable, I am really disappointed in Lululemon - especially because when I tried them on at the store this is one of the questions I asked about because I wasn't sure if I should size down or not. Learn from my mistake and size down even if they feel a little snug at first!

column6: I ran my first marathon in them. No chaffing. They are like second skin. I absolutely love these tights.

These pants are so comfy, light, and moveable. Honestly they were my favorite lulus the first couple times I wore them especially since they are high waisted. However, These pants loosen up so much after a few wears. They do have a drawstring in them which helps but even that is starting to stretch out too. I got a second pair recently as a gift and I'm hoping they don't do the same thing, but I guess we will see. For the price, I really hope they update the fit or the fabric to make it not stretch as much.

column5: Awesome for the first few workouts..
column6: I loved these when I first put them on. I did an F45 class in them and they were perfect. A few days later I wore them on a 9 mile run and I was so impressed. Then I wore them to F45 again and they seemed to have loosened and don't fit like they originally did. Super bummed. I haven't worn them since but will give them another try soon. For expensive tights I thought they would maintain their shape much longer.

column6: I’m 5’1, 118 lbs with an athletic build. I wear a 4 in these and the 7/8s fit at ankle length. I was looking for a nice, light pant to wear for running during the cooler Miami “winter” mornings. I usually get hot quickly when I start running but these felt great my entire run. They dry quickly. They fit great, they make your butt look amazing!! Love these pants! They do snag easily but so does pretty much anything with a kids Velcro shoe.
These are hands down the best tights I have ever worn. I could wear them 24/7

This is my third pair of the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". My first pair was black - amazing. My second pair was in HINSHU ALPINE WHITE MULTI. I love these leggings. They are one of few that have the drawstring which for me is critical in keeping my bottoms up during teaching classes + running.
I haven't worn these new ones yet as they just came in the mail. I got them in the GORGEOUS bright pink, STAR RUBY.
Well ladies - they're more dark berry/mulled wine/almost maroon color. The photos show them as a bright fuschia/bright raspberry possibly. They aren't, so if you're dead set on a hot pink color then pass on these ones because they just aren't. I'm sure they'll perform similarly to my first two pair that I love - just disappointed in the misleading photos sharing the non-existent bright pink.

column5: Best workout leggings lulu has ever made!
column6: I have been wearing Lululemon leggings consistently for the past 10 years for all sweaty pursuits- hiking mount Kilimanjaro, crossfit, figure skating, F45, running, etc.... these tights are by far the best. They don't move at all, hold you in tight without being too tight, wick away sweat like no other, look great, don't show sweat, are super durable and just feel amazing for all exercise. The cell phone pockets on the side are also amazing and the seams seem to hold up well with proper washing which are both nice bonuses!

column5: Love at first wear but not for long..
column6: Love the feel and fit of fabric--breathes well, comfortable, the side pocket is amazing. Overall love these pants BUT I expected them to last longer. They quickly lost their shape after a few washes and some pilling on seams.

column6:
but they just aren't worth the money. They were recommended to me as a running tight. After trying on 3 pairs (all 3 different sizes) the store salesperson helped me choose a size 8. I normally wear a 6, but, the way the stitching is done on these on the thighs there was just too much pull in certain areas. I am constantly tugging at these to keep them up. The waist area is ok, but not tight like I would like. In order to have no tugging at all I would have had to have bought a 10, and the waist gapped just standing up.
I really hope that one day you will make tights for women who do weights and who are tall. I have bigger thighs from doing a predominately weight based training and I'm constantly having to compromise a bigger waist size so my thighs will stay in! As well, the 7/8ths length on me is really a crop. I'm 5'9" and the 7/8ths length can sometimes cut my circulation!
Hope there are design improvements to this in the future.

column6: They are very comfortable & feels like you’re not wearing anything. With having said that-the material is very lightweight & not as forgiving as some of the others. If I had a perfect figure & 0 imperfections then I would love these. 3 things I look for in leggings/tights~#1) comfort #2) conceal cellulite with good support #3) conceal sweat.
perfect weight fabric and perfectly comfortable fit
column15: didn't come in enough solid colors

column6: I adore these pants. They are my overall favorite Lululemon pants of the ones that I have tried. I practice yoga, but I also do cardio at the gym. My Align pants wouldn't be ideal for my cardio pants, though I love them for yoga. These are the perfect pants for both. They are thin and light for yoga, but durable for anything like cardio or HIIT. Thank you to Bethany at the Lululemon in Malibu for helping me figure out my proper size. I was wearing a pair I own in a size too big for me when in the store and she kindly encouraged me to try a smaller size. It's a perfect fit, and though I, unfortunately, have a couple of pairs in a size too big, I still wear them and I absolutely love these pants.
These are the best running pants. I tried multiple ones but those are by far my favorites. Ran the NYC marathon in those and felt great!

I love these pants. In fact I now own 4 pair. The pocket for my cell phone is awesome. The higher waist keeps my belly from popping out. I have the long and short versions and love both! The fabric is so smooth and comfortable.
Absolutely love these tights. Comfortable and perfect for running. I'll definitely order more!

column5: terrible for workouts - slides down with movement
column6: I love lulu pants for workouts, especially those with the drawstring waist - really helps to make sure pants stay up during jumping/running, and then lets me loosen it back up after. however, these pants are functionally a huge disappointment. the pants slide down with really movement at all, including just walking! I literally cinch the waist as tight as possible (which hurts), and the pants still fall. im having to yank them up near constantly. I really was looking forward to adding another high impact/running pant to my rotation, and this isn't at all fitting the bill of a "run" pant, as advertised. i'm barely able to wear them just around the house, let alone for any kind of activity. btw, I got my usual size, I am an across the board size 6 in all bottoms. I really wish i would still be able to return for a better option

column6: I originally bought these tights just under 2 months ago when I tried them on in store. They fit perfectly, and the material is a really nice soft cool slippery feel. However, after wearing them once or twice they have stretched out to the point that I wish I purchased a full size smaller. The waist has an inner cord you can adjust, and that is the only thing saving them fitting my waist still. And now they will fold/sag under my bum and around my legs after wearing them for a few hours. I also noticed earlier today that they are starting to pill on the stitch lines in several places, and I pretty much only wear them casually, not for activities at the gym that might cause this. Overall disappointed considering the increased price compared to some other tights, but I definitely love the design and the material. Just wish I knew to buy a size down.

column5: Great Running Pants stretch out a little
column6: I love these running pants. Very comfortable and love the large side pockets to hold my phone. I bought my usual size and find they stretch out when running which is a bit annoying. I would probably have sized down if I had know. Otherwise great pants.
I love these. The fit, the pockets, the fabric - everything is awesome. I wear these to teach classes, do workouts, and run errands. They are some of the most comfortable pants I've ever worn.

I love these leggings so much I bought a second pair. I love the thin material, don't worry, they pass the squat test! Seriously so comfortable and lightweight. I am 5'5" and the 7/8 hit me perfectly at the ankle. 10/10 will be getting other colors.

This are my new favorite pants! I liked them so much i have black & dark olive ones. They have been great for running outside especially. The only thing that worries me is the seams are starting to bead on the black pair. I have been extremely gentle with them & followed all proper washing instructions. Im hoping they hold up.

column5: Not worth it for the price

column5: why reflective detail on the side???
column6:
I really like the side pockets on these tights. As a runner, I use my phone to track my distance. It is helpful to have pockets, and these are placed in a great spot to run with.
I prefer the tights that do not have the reflective detail but these are no longer available. The reflective detail does not make sense to me. It is on the side. In the dark, cars approach from behind or in front. The side reflector is not visible and therefore not helpful.
I also am not a fan of the shininess of the material in black... not sure but I feel like it makes body/skin imperfection (cellulite) more visible.

column5: Comfy and able to work out in
column6: These pants are all around great! I am short and have skinny ankles and they are still snug at the bottom and I’m so impressed with that! One thing is the waist area is a bitttt tight not that much but not as flexible as the align waist. Still great pants tho!

column5: Fabric is too slippery and did not stay up during workout
column6: Loved the fit, color and feel of this fabric but it is too slick and would not stay up during my workout. Had to constantly pull them up, and had to cinch the waist so tight it was uncomfortable. Not practical and very disappointed.

column5: Best tights for any kind of exercise
column6: I have many, many different tights from Lululemon, but these are definitely superior to all. I'm 5'4 so 7/8 is almost a full length for me. I purchased them in my usual 10 and they fit perfectly. They are very flattering, my butt and quads look great in these.
column14: they stay put in any vigorous exercise

column6: I've been in love with nulux since it came out, and these pants are the reason. They are perfect for fall and spring running - I've worn them for every marathon I've done since the tight came out. They are tight, flattering, have great pockets, and don't rub. The material makes you pretty much feel like you aren't wearing anything (in a good way). Because the material is so light, these tights just require a little extra caution when caring for them, but that's to be expected, given their feel. I'm in love!
Always a fan of the fast and frees! They are one of my favorite leggings to run in. I will say if you are in between sizes, I’d recommend going down a size

Love the color and the fit of this type. It’s perfectly for any type of fitness class and very flattering. Love the pockets to stick things in that won’t fall out. I teach all types of fitness classes and pockets great for placing timer in for classes
column14: love the color and the fit of this

column6: Bought these tights for myself for my birthday, my first pair of lulu leggings. Unfortunately after a few runs they started pilling and between my thighs the material wore down quickly. A little disappointed with this pant. They are also way to short for someone 5'10"

column6: Fast and Free is my favorite style of tights. The fabric holds you in yet moves with you easily. I also like the unhemmed leg as my calves are a little large and sometimes tights/pants will fit fine except for a too-tight calf. Without the hem, the opening stretches comfortably (and stays in place, does not ride up).
Love the pants. Great for yoga or any other type of workout. True to size

I purchased this pants hoping to live up to all the ones I've had in the past. The primary use for this pants is for my morning runs at 5:15am. I do like the reflective sides to the pants. Aside from that, I noticed right away they kept slipping down as I started my run, so I am constantly pulling them up. Another negative factor about this pants are that they make a weird noise while I walk, like a swoosh noise which I have never ever had a problem with before with other pants. With how much I paid for this pants I am truly disappointed.

Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 29, 2018'}

column6: I was so hesitant to buy these because of the high high price tag, but I convinced myself one night during retail therapy to splurge on them and have not regretted the purchase. The material is really amazing, very soft, smooth, slick, keeps me warm enough surprisingly, SUPER cute and flattering on, seriously feels like I'm wearing nothing, very very nice leggings worth the investment I think.

These Fast & Free Tights are fabulous. I don’t run in them, but rather, practice yoga. The fabric is awesome and high waist super comfy. They fit, they move, and they breathe! Love them. And the new plum color is even better when you see it in person. Can’t wait to get a second pair.
column14: everything about fit style and fabric

column6: These are my new favorite leggings. I want several pairs. I think they’re pretty TTS. I’m 5’3” 120 lbs and I got a size 4. They fit heavenly.

I bought these one week ago, and love the concept: they are comfortable and sculpt nicely. I got my normal size 6 (which I wear in most Lulu bottoms).
At first they were great...
HOWEVER, after 3 days of wearing them now, they are already not staying up properly and slipping down all the time. Super annoying.
For this price, I expect way better quality and a product that lasts and holds its shape much longer. Disappointed.

It's more just they keep falling down just walking around in them. And they don;t really retain it's shape.

Nice feel and look. Not good for excersize as they stretch over the course of a day. They fit well to start but then sag with wear and when you’re working out. Constantly having to pull them up. Will stick to the aligns next time.

There's very little pilling which is awesome. HOWEVER, recently I have noticed that some of the stitching around the ankle has been coming out which is really disappointing because I am such a fan of Lululemon and their quality. I don't really know how to fix the stitching problem as that is, in my opinion, a very integral part of good leggings.

column6: I love the nulux material! So soft! High waisted which keep everything sucked in. Very cute with crop tops!

column5: Loved them before they stretched out
column6: I bought these leggings in black not even a year ago and wash them in cold water and on a gentle cycle. I never dry them and they are showing extreme wear around the seams and they are stretched out even after washing them. I love them but wish they held up for a longer period of time. Size down if buying them.

column6: These are the best work out pants so far. From standing to floor exercise, these pants move right along with you. I will be ordering more colors. Thank you!
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: I have the Fast and Free crops in 2 colors and love them. I thought the 7/8 length would be perfect for fall. I bought a size 4 because I always wear a 4 in lulu tights. They fit initially, but after only a few wears they are stretched out to the point that they're even a little baggy in places. So I am really disappointed. Way too expensive for this quality issue. If I knew about this I guess sizing down might be an option. I'm not sure. But I love every thing else about these tights: the buttery soft fabric, the pockets, the seamless bottom of the leg, adjustable waist and back pocket plus no zippers are great because I need to go from the Pilates studio to the trail for running. I like a multi-purpose tight. My crops didn't stretch like this, so I'm wondering if there is a difference from last year with the fabric.
column14: buttery fabric pockets no zippers or hems

column6: Love these pants. Have them in several colors. Makes your butt and legs look super cute. They are little thin for winter, but still my favorite pair of leggings.

I know some people don't like Nulux (saying it stretches out after wearing), but I've never had an issue. I'm 5'2" 110 lbs with muscular thighs, wearing a size 4, and I don't really have a waist that goes in proportionally. I'm more boyish in that department.
These pants are my favorite style for running around, going on a walk, or stretching after a run and shower. I don't really wear them for running as I prefer shorts if it's warm enough to wear this material. The material is perfect if you have animals, since their hair won't stick to it. I love to wear these with a sweater or just a t-shirt depending on where I'm going. The waistband could even be a little looser, in my opinion, but I'm thankful it's not as tight as some lulu options where I can't breathe if I get the right size for everywhere else (this might be a petite girl problem, since the waistband is always coming up higher on me than most people). The pockets make the waist a little tighter than some past pants I've gotten in the same fabric, but I guess it's better if they stay put instead of sagging down. Length is absolutely perfect.
I want more of these...
Most workout pants I get never stay put so I’m constantly pulling them up, however I love these pants from lululemon. These are my favorite! I think I own like 10 in this style

Love the material and light weight. Asked the sales person if these either shink or stretch out after wearing they stated no. Initially, loved the fit and worked out in them once with both pairs. After one wash they stretched out. The waist and general fit too big not the same tights I bought in the store. I'm so dissapointed! I did follow all the wash instructions and have several items from Lululemon. My advise is to size down one size. Unfornately, I'm out 2 pairs for a total of $260. Expensive lesson.

column6: I purchased two pairs in July of these in black. They started to show significant wear by September. I haven't put either pair in the dryer and use a gentle wash setting. For $128 per pair, I would expect better quality. I have worn Lululemon for years and still have garments in good condition from 7-8 years ago. The quality of these are such a disappointment.

They'll go back to normal after a wash, but they won't hold their shape for more than a few hours. I'm very disappointed given how expensive these were.

column5: Love the fabric but stretched out after only two wears
column6: I drooled over these leggings for a few weeks before I finally decided to give in and buy them with some birthday money. I bought the black pair in a size 4 (my normal size) and they fit great when I first got them. After only wearing them twice, they've stretched out to the point that I can't wear them running without pulling them up constantly. I have the same problem wearing them while doing squats, lunges, etc. - basically anything besides sitting on the couch. I have five other pairs of Lululemon leggings (all a size 4) and have never had this problem so I'm not sure what happened with these but I really wish I had sized down from my normal. Really bummed because the fabric and feel is amazing. I wanted to love these.

Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 22, 2018'}

column6: I love everything about these. They are squat proof, inch-worm proof, I can do the splits-proof and comfortable! Somehow these do it all. The cut, color options, material, and patterns are perfect for hiding flaws (cellulite and/or panty lines) ...but I DO NOT UNDERSTAND why 7/8 is a trend. I am not a giraffe looking for capris and I am not a Corgi looking for pants, I am a majestic muscular averaged leg length pegasus. Let me live my sweaty pursuit dreams and PLEASE MAKE THESE IN FULL LENGTH. I keep trying to make the 7/8ths happen but it just is not a flattering length for me, I hate how I look in the mirror with 7/8 pants. They make my legs look short, my butt look wide, and they create an optical illusion of cankles, I can't be the only one! I have to constantly tug at the ankle to get them to come down to where I want them (medial and lateral malleolus please) but then I am left with a saggy crotch. I am one more 7/8 pant away from purchasing multiple and sewing on the extra length myself.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear dvickylo,\n\nThank you for taking the time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Chat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 22, 2018'}

column6: The fit and feel of these tights are amazing, they stay put during runs and higher intensity indoor workouts for me, and they look awesome on everyone. I really want to dub these the holy grail running pants, but they have just shown wear and tear SO quickly. I noticed that the seams have started to unravel in only a few months with 100% proper care and reasonable use, and the crotch area feels significantly looser. I have these in black, so I haven't had any weird sweat issues, the wear on these is just pretty disappointing.

column5: Best leggings for high intensity workouts i.e. Crossfit
column6: These are the only leggings I wear for Crossfit. They are smooth, not too thick, and are super comfy (naked sensation is reaaal). They are not too warm for walking outside in during winter, but are great for building up a sweat during cold weather. Highly recommend. They also do not become see through which is great especially for squats. I can really do anything in these, from jumping rope to deep stretches.

These are my favorite tights to run in. Even did Sea Wheeze in the rain. Bought the MELN color yesterday and ran only 7 Miles this morning and had to immediately change out of them. I wish I could send a picture of the gross sweat stain and pattern. A waste of $128.00 in less than 24 hours for trying to break the dark color mold.
column15: the stain and sweat pattern that formed

column5: THE Pair of Leggings You'll Ever Need
column6: I disliked wearing leggings and preferred shorts for my usual workouts, but I own three pairs of these so that says something. They have never failed me in any of my workouts, whether it's hitting the weights at the gym, cycling, HIIT, etc. They are super sweat absorbent but you don't feel icky at all, cools you down as you work out, and fits to the body like you're not wearing anything. If you're questioning durability, don't. I slid on wet pavement after falling off a scooter downhill for 18 feet - my skin ripped but the leggings made out with only two tiny holes that can barely be seen.
My favorites! True to size and very flattering. Perfect for any workout and will definitely be ordering more!

column6:
I have 2 other pair of this same tight and was pleased to add another in this lovely olive color. The fabric feels great on the body, very light--to the point where I had a friend do a check to assure me I wasn't 'oversharing'; I wasn't! The waistband is well designed to stay put without digging in, and has convenient pockets to stash a key, etc.
Hands-down the BEST FEATURE of this tight are the side pockets which are perfect for securing my cell phone. I can go for a run, box, grunt through a heavy leg day, all while keeping my music in place. Two thumbs up.

When I wore these the first few times they were great! The material is light and very comfortable, and they fit like a glove. After a few wears and washes (on delicate and laid to dry), they seemed to stretch out. The bottoms of the legging have lost some elasticity, as they are a little baggy. The waistband and crotch also are looser than when I first got them. I wear them to lounge around in, but I don't think I will be able to wear them running anymore, especially if my phone is in the side pocket weighing it down.

column6: These fit absolutely perfectly and never show sweat which is important because I sweat my body weight every workout. However, immediately after wearing the first time the thread in the seams started to unravel. column6: Mom of 2 here, 3 months post partum, got some thunder thigh problems from pregnancy weight gain. I was super excited to get these pants in the mail! I mean at $128, these pants are gonna make me look like gold! Right? I thought that anyway. Tried them on walking around the house and all I can hear is the swishing of my thunder thighs! I do not need to pay $128 to know my thighs are larger than life! Thanks, but I can't stand that swooshing noise! For that rare breed of girls with thigh gaps... these are for you!

column6: For $130 I really thought the quality of these pants would be better. They're so comfortable, it almost feels like I hardly have pants on, but almost every time I wear them I find something else wrong with them. I hardly ever wear them, and the first time I did the side seam ripped. At the time I took these to a store and they fixed them for me, however the stitching now looks messy and is coming undone. When I put them on this morning I discovered another hole in the pants, this time inside the pocket (makes no sense). I will not be buying these again, even though they are so comfortable, they are just not worth the price!

column6: The perfect go to tight when you know you’ve got things to do. Effortlessly take you from gym to street with high fashion. Might be a basic girl staple...but they are anything but “basic”

I bought a pair of these at the store and was so excited to wear them, unfortunately I only wore them once and today when I tried wearing them again they already felt loose; I kept having to pull them up because it felt like they were sliding down, I felt so uncomfortable I ended up changing out of them. Very disappointed, I expected a lot more, especially for the price.

column5: So good... for so little time
column6: I really, really love these. I've had them for less than 5 months. Yesterday, I fell on my knee and ripped a hole. I thought it'd be durable enough considering how much i paid for it, but nope ): ((I'll probably get a new pair though because I do really love them))
Love these pants they are nice and snug. I actually sized down and they fit just fine because they are stretchy.

I love almost everything about these pants but I feel like the waistband could be less cinched and lay more flat on the waist. These pants are plenty fitted and not going anywhere even if you change the waistband.

I really like how these stay put during a workout! And I love the pockets. But for the price I have to say my expectations were higher.... they have already stretched out a little, hope they don’t any more! And I’ve had them three weeks and I have two snags in them already. On the inside seam so I’m not sure how I could have got them! I’m unsure if I’d buy again for the quality-price ratio.

column5: Loved then was disappointed, seam coming unstitched
column6: I was so excited to get these leggings for running, but not that long after getting them after maybe 10-15 wears the seam on the waist started to come apart. I wash them only with other lulu items and never put them in the dryer always air dry. Would have brought back to the store but it was past the return policy date. When you spend $140 you expect quality, I’m disappointed.

column6: Love these pants, wear them in the gym and travel, being on the plane for hours, compressions and comfort, extremely wonderful.

I love my cropped fast n frees so I thought a winter long pant would be great. Though I loved the floral print when it stretches out you can see the white material it is printed on and it looks pretty bad stretching across my thighs and butt. Unless you’re skinny as a rail, I’d avoid the patterned one. I’m 5’3” so in addition, the tights were way too long. Had to go back!

column5: Seams pill and the fabric stretches out
column6: I was so excited about these pants. Bought myself and my daughter a pair. Hers are doing the exact same thing as mine, the seams are pilling up despite us never washing them with anything besides other Lulu items, never a towel or cotton. They have stretched in the same areas, near the rear and on the legs and the front of mine. When we first bought them, they seemed like the absolute perfect go to pair of leggings. Probably 5-10 wears later, we noticed this happening. I live far from a store or I would have brought them both back for return.
column15: too much money not to get at least a years wear
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear mkrarmer30,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a fix. An email has been sent with additional information. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 15, 2018'}

column6: Heavens to Mergatroid, these are AMAZEBALLS! The store manager in Lincoln convinced me to try a pair (my first pair of anything Lululemon) and I honestly didn't want to take them off. I cannot wait til they come out with full length (not camo though) so I can buy a bunch more. IF you want them to be tighter (they are not compression tights), size down a little. If you want to feel naked in them (seriously that comfy), buy your typical size. FYI: size 18 at a regular store for women is like a size 12 at Lululemon. I never thought I could fit into anything, but she convinced me to try. Now I am a massive fan! I now have 3 pair (including the compressions) and two shirts. The quality is excellent and the fit is amazing. LOVE the high waist!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Mp167706,\n\nWe're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. We look forward to hearing from you.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 20, 2018'}

column5: Tights that fit like a DREAM!!
column6:
I stepped into a Lululemon store looking for a new pair of running tights and was recommended by a staff member to give these a try. These tights fit like a DREAM!! They fit and hug in all the right places; the tights fit nicely around my waist AND they make my butt look AMAZING. The material is so soft and comfortable, I've been wearing them for running as well as around the house doing laundry and baking. My Samsung S6 fits perfectly in the side pocket and stays put during all my runs.
I usually wear a size 10 but was recommended to go a size down to an 8. I can't rave any more about these pants! Definitely try them in store in both your usual size and a size down to get the right fit.

I titled this review as buy five simply because you are going to want to wear these for every single day of your life. The feel is perfection, the fit is perfection, the lift is perfection. There is nothing I do not love and obsess over about these pants. You can run in them, you can teach PE in them, you can do laundry in them, you can sleep in them, you can do your whole life in these pants.
Better than expected. Would live in if possible. Love these!

I received a pair of these pants as a gift and I am starting to notice pilling forming as well as a tear on the waist. I'm a yoga instructor and I've only worn this a few times. I don't work out in it, ever. Pretty disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi 2lc6490,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'October 13, 2018'}

column6: These pants were my favorite the first few times I wore them, then following that they lost their shape retention although the wash instructions on the tag were followed. I am constantly having to pull them up and they do not fit in a flattering way anymore.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear tg012934,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We\'d love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 12, 2018'}

column5: Amazing material, but won't stay up
column6: These were the first pants I've ever purchased and I have to say I loved these pants at first! The material is so thin, soft and buttery! I went into the store to find a good pant for training purposes and was lead toward this pair. However, they don't have the best compression (they don't really hug your butt if you know what I mean) and after a few wears they felt a little less snug. My main complaint is that I have to pull them up. All. The. Time. I still wear them (and yank them up all the time), but I just wish they lived up to my expectations. For reference I am about 5'7 and 130lb. Maybe the material is just extra slidey? I purchased a size 4. The size 2 seemed way too small, but maybe I should've gotten those instead and let them stretch out a little.
These are my all time favorite Lulu legging! They fit great, stay in place and get me through tough workouts. I have at least 6 pairs and all are still in amazing shape.

column5: Finally a pattern I can Love
column6: I have been stalking the Flowerescent Multi pattern for weeks hoping it would come out in tights/wonder unders. There just have been some patterns lately that havent been my style so I was so happy when these came out. The fit is perfect - I love the pockets and they are very flattering. I wore them to Olympic Lifting and everything stayed in place - didnt have to pull them up. They are squat proof and fun. Would recommend.
column9: 1117 CONEY ISLAND AVE, BROOKLYN, NY 11230, USA
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column15: having to wait for a pattern i liked

column6: These felt great when I tried them on in-store, and they seemed to be exactly what I needed for my hot HIIT class, so I decided to treat myself and drop the $128 for a pair of these. They worked great for my class; I didn't feel overheated and my legs weren't dripping sweat due to the fabric of the pants. However, upon my third or fourth time wearing these, they started feeling extremely loose even though I followed the wash and care instructions. I also began to notice small holes were popping up. For such a steep legging price, I expected to be able to wear these more than just a few times before they started dying on me. I'm pretty disappointed with how these have held up. There are positive reviews on here, so I'm not sure if it's just the pair I bought or if the quality of the leggings is truly lacking.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear lululover254,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We hear where you\'re coming from and I\'m sorry to hear your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" haven\'t held up for you as expected. We\'d love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 11, 2018'}

column6: I've had these leggings in black for less than a year and the seams are already unraveling. I take extremely good care of these, as I wash them inside out on a gentle cycle and air dry them. However, a hole also recently developed on the seat of the leggings as well. Disappointing because I really liked the design!

I tried these on in store and they seemed like they were going to be perfect. The fabric felt really nice and soft on my skin and they fit nicely so I purchased them. After an hour of wearing them they wouldn't stay up and they stretched out a ridiculous amount. I constantly had to pull them up and the drawstring does absolutely nothing to help them stay in place. I've only worn these twice and after washing and drying them on a gentle cycle the threading is coming loose. I don't know if I should've sized down with these leggings or not, but I'm extremely disappointed with the quality and performance these have, considering the fact that they're $128.00.

I hate to play favorites with my lulu leggings, but if I HAD to, it would be these! Just this week I bought another pair. They are the absolute softest, most comfy leggings I've ever worn in my life. I get compliments on the colors, too. I grab them every time I'm going to travel. They are perfect for times when you just want to be comfortable. They don't have much compression, but they are somehow thick enough to hide flaws. Cant recommend enough.

column5: No support definitely not for the gym
column6: I am fairly new to lulu and definitely learning what tights work best for a busy gym. These came recommended, there is absolutely no compression I'm constantly pulling them up. I have only worn them a few times for that reason. They seemed to have more compression at first but I'm pretty sure they should last longer than a few months. The only positive is the pockets. Not worth the price!

column6: These are my favorite pants by far! Love the fit, how quickly they dry and the flattering look!

Incredible material, softer than anything I've purchased, my issue is with the seams and how they held up. They have pilled quite a bit, and small holes have started to develop. won't repurchase for this price.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi bollywood,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. Hang tight for an email coming your way! Chat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 9, 2018'}

column6: These are my favorite Lulu tights! I have them in multiple patterns and lengths. I like the patterned ones the best because they hide the sweat. I tend to sweat a lot, so I always buy dark shorts or tights. I have no issues with the patterned ones except there are not enough of them! The crops do ride up over my calves, but the 3/4 length does not. It doesn't bother me at all because they are just really comfortable and the waist band stays put.
Je suis rendue avec trois paires de ce modèle de legging et je ne me tanne pas! C'est la même sensation qu'avoir une deuxième peau! J'adore! Je recommande à tous!!! :)

I purchased these leggings only about a month ago, but I absolutely LOVE them, the fit is so nice and they're soft as ever! The seamless ankles are brilliant and I plan to buy more colours soon! Please never stop selling these!

I like to do a little bit of everything in the gym, including running, weights, and group classes. These leggings hold up to everything I put them through. I love love love the Fast and Free. They are fitted and snug with that naked sensation, but they're not tight to the point where I can't breathe or feel it digging in during my workouts. I also like the raw hemlines. Did I mention how much I LOVE the pockets on the side? They fit my iPhone 7 with room for more. For reference, I'm 5'3 and about 130 lbs and I wear a size 6.
This is my first pair of Lululemon tights. I was told they were mid rise...NOT. They also have no compression and cannot be worn without compression shorts underneath. Not happy with my purchase.

column5: Cute but doesn’t hold up well
column6: I really loved these leggings, I loved the fit, the way they felt, and the material, however, after just a few washes they started to become rough and pull on the side of one of the legs. It’s really disappointing because these leggings are so expensive and I haven’t had them for about two months.

column6: These leggings feel like a dream. The lack of seam at the bottom is genius—please, please consider making full-length in these pants, they are perfect.

These are perfect long-run tights! They are incredibly comfortable, and the side pockets are great for storing gels/chews. I am 5’4”, 125lbs, and have a muscular build - size 4 is perfect for me, but they fit me as full length, not 7/8 (I prefer full length anyway).

I'm a 2/4 and bought these in a size 2, I wore these pants one time for 2 hours and they had instantly stretched out in all the worst places, these are by far the worst leggings, I know the material is not meant to be compression but these are definitely so bad, the bunching and sagging fabric does not create the "naked sensation" these leggings claim to be. Super disappointed because I'd never be able to workout in pants that fall down and bunch constantly.

column6: I love the fabric and feel of these leggings. Provides compression but not too much compression. The leg pocket is one of my favorite features since I am always misplacing my phone!

This is my third pair of the fast and free. They move with me as I run and the pockets are my favorite. Stash my giant phone or anything else I might need on either side. The two pairs I’ve had for over a year are still like the day I bought them. Can’t beat that!

These are designed for running and would be fine for running - but they are regrettably way too sheer for yoga. I wanted to try the Nulux fabric for a heated yoga class but when I tried these on in-store (in black!) and bent over, you could clearly see my nude, seamless hipster panties underneath. I was shocked at the sheerness. And yes, I confirmed that they were the right size with multiple sales associates. I think full-on Luxtreme might be the only non-sheer fabric at Lulu.

column6: This was my first time getting these and I sized down from the reviews I read. I was pleasantly happy! Omg! These are amazing. I love the feel and the look and the pocket. These feel so good and make me feel like I look fabulous. I’m so happy with these and will get more!!!!!! Amazing ! Thank you lulu

I own these in three colors now. I bought my first pair in Vancouver when I was six-months pregnant and on vacation earlier this year (one of the reasons I agreed to a Vancouver vacation from California was the promises of Lululemon).
They've now gone through pregnancy, to the hospital for an emergency delivery, back home, and the beginnings of marathon training with me. Outside of the stitching rubbing a little on the inner thighs, these are amazing tights.
I have short legs (a 27-inch inseam) and I never knew I needed a pair of 25-inch pants until I found these.
I love these tights, they're very light and perfect for running!

I had high hopes for these pair of leggings. If you are more interested in lounging then these may be the pair for you. However, I felt that every time I walked briskly or run- these leggings tend to slide down and fold, which is not entirely the look I was going for. Other Nulux leggings don't propose this issue- however, these sadly aren't as functional as I would like them to be.

column6: I splurged on these and do not regret it at all. They are incredible. I have about 8 pairs of leggings and these are by far my favorite. They are perfect for working out in. Will for sure purchase again.

I love these. I’m 5’5” and 135lb so the first pair I bought was a size 6 and they’re great for walking but we’re sliding down when I ran. I decided to go down a size for my next pair and it’s great! Definitely go down in size if you’re planning on running or doing HIIT workouts in theses.

column6: These were a gift from my boyfriend and let me tell you, these are by far the best leggining ive ever had in my life, there so comfortable and easy to move in, there great for everyday wear and for the gym! id definitely recommend these leggings to anyone and the pockets are amazing! 11/10 would recomend

The seams come apart within only a couple months. I always wash on delicate and always hang dry so they should last much longer. Also, they kind of stretch out after awhile, I always have to cinch the waistband and I still find myself pulling them up and adjusting them when working out. If I am paying $128 for leggings, I want them to last much much longer and hold their shape.

One day in class I noticed the seam had come undone and that there was a fairly large hole in the crotch of my leggings. I'm more than disappointed as this is my second pair of lulus to have ripped on me. I'd be cautious to purchase.

column6: Loved these pants when I first got them! column6:
These are my priciest pair of Lulu leggings, I got them specifically because the sales associate recommended them for running. After wearing them for ONE run, I already have unsightly lines going across where the tops of my shoes were. I'm petite so I chose this in the 7/8 length to fit as full length on me. I got this in black and the fabric has a beautiful sheen except for the lines, which are very visible fuzzy patches that don't reflect light.
I'm assuming there's no way to "fix" this damage, how silly for a pair of expensive tights marketed as for running!

column6: Awesome purchase

I was waiting for the non reflective pair to get back into stock before purchasing these BUT I caved in and bought the regular black ones anyways.
I loved these leggings, they are so comfortable for day to day, running, yoga and weight lifting. The material is very versatile and flexible, it feels like you're wearing nothing.

When I first bought these I was obsessed, too obsessed to even work out in them. After a few months of out-and-about wear, I decided to try them for workouts. I am so bummed because after 2 workouts they just were too baggy. When I tried to run in them I was yanking them every few strides. I wish I would have been advised to size down for these leggings.

column5: My 2nd favorite style of Lulu leggings for workouts
column6: For fit and performance this is a 5-star pair of leggings however after minimal wear I have downgraded them to 4-stars. After 3 upper body lifting workouts & two washings (per Lulu instructions) the inner leg seam near the knees are starting to fray. I specifically purchased these leggings based on the recommendation from my local Lulu educator who said they were designed for running and training.

I absolutely love everything lululemon except for these pants. Everyone in the store recommended them and I honestly don't know why. I wore them once and all the threading started coming undone along the lower leg, and they stretch out significantly after wearing them once walking. I tried using the side pocket for my phone but it pulled them downwards. Super bummed out because of the price point for these pants! Knew I should have stuck with my go to Align pant!

column6: This was 1 of my priciest lulu leggings and investment rather... absolutely flattering on the body! However, with extreme great care (washing 1x a month, cold wash, hang to dry), it has deteriorated faster (bought them in Vancouver January 2018) than any other lulus (5+ years) I have ever owned. First time experiencing pilling on seams. Was never an issue on my older lulus. And even worse, the seam on my lower back area started to unravel and now hanging down my backside. Really wish I could say these are my favourite pairs, only if it didn't start to give up on me.

column6: Have been a big fan of Lululemon for a couple years now and this is the first pair of leggings to disappoint. I love the feel and performance of the leggings however, the waistband did stretch out a bit after a few wears. The biggest disappointment was it showed pretty extreme sweat marks, and I always get the black color to avoid this exact problem! After even a 30 min run workout/run, I can see the sweat marks which is a little embarrassing and surprising since I've never had this issue with any of their other black leggings. I've been a little frustrated with these leggings since I bought them for their sweat wicking, quick drying purposes!

column6: I have several pairs of Fast & Free tights and love them. They are very flattering and feel great on. I however do have a newer pair that is pilling even though I’ve taken care of all my pairs the same. Some people size down and i have a size down pair, but i like my tts better.

I love these so much. They have a good stretch to them compared to other types of leggings. They are also better at sweat wicking as my other leggings get noticeably darker during workouts. I wear a 6 normally in shorts but I buy these in a 4. I want every color!!

I was obsessed with the look of these so my boyfriend got them for me as a present! I wore them once and washed them (did not dry) and the seams were balled up like i had worn them a million times! Super upset, and didn't wear them again :(
I own lots and lots of lulu and this is only the second item to give me trouble!

column5: Low quality after short period of time
column6: I have my fair share of Lulu leggings and am confidently a size 4 in all of them. I got a size 4 in these, 2 pairs of them, and after just one wash and wearing them for a few hours they have become a pain! I have to continuously pull them up around my waist and at my thighs to keep them from becoming loose. The butt has also become very loose and I am continuously pulling them up. I am disappointed that I now have two pairs of these and they are not comfortable enough to wear them to work out. I would recommend that you size down before you make the mistake I did :(

column6: I have a few pairs of these pants and they are amazing! However, the fabric is very delicate as 1 of my pairs has received a hole at the outer seam.
These tights are great for paddling long distance change races at a competitive level. Feels barely there, dries quickly.
They are the softest lulus she’s ever worn. Very comfortable and flattering, and the carbon gray color is beautiful!
I bought these to be comfy on a 17 hour flight. They are thin and fit amazing, they truly mean it “feels like second layer of skin”! I will definitely buy more of these!

I purchased these leggings in black in my usual size 6.I loved them at first, but after a few wears they stretched in the waist and butt area. The combination of the thin fabric and loose bum and waist area is very frustrating! I tried tightening the waistband but the bum area still feels very loose and unflattering.

column6: These are really comfortable! They keep me warm at the beginning of my run and cool by the end of it. Love the cell phone pocket.

column6: Best pants ever!

I thought I found the perfect leggings. When I was in store trying these on for size, the sales lady told me that this material will not pill. I was debating between the align 2 and these. I decided to go for these because I thought spending the extra bucks on this material would be worth it to have a pant that will last me and will not pill. PLUS these pants have pockets. I've worn and washed these pants only a handful times and they are pilling on the front thighs. The seams are also falling apart and these pants are not holding up anymore. I am disappointed because of how much these cost.. I really expected them to last.

column5: Good in Theory, Terrible in Execution
column6:
These were recommended to me by an Educator in store after I expressed interest in a pant that was more suitable for running (as a part of a HIIT program). I own over 30 pairs of lulu leggings, and mentioned that the align pant II were my absolute favorite fit, finish, feel and look, and the Educator directed me towards the Fast and Free, which had the same naked feeling as the align pant II, but would offer more structure and stability for sprints on the tread. I liked the idea of the pant, and loved how they looked on, and was thrilled to have found the "align pant II" of running. I ordered my regular size (4), had slight issues with the waistband falling during my run, but that's not a huge issue for me and i'm willing to keep pulling the pants up because I love high-rise fits so much.
However, after one HIIT workout, these pants have already come apart literally at the seams, rendering the pants unwearable. I have done the same exact workouts in my wunder unders and align pant II's, as well as leggings from similar yogi-centric brands such as Alo, Beyond, Lorna Jane, and all have withstood beautifully. Additionally, I have been wearing, washing, and taking care of lulus for over 7 years now, so negligence is out of the question. To have a legging that is made for yoga, a low-intensity workout, out-perform a legging designed for running--a high-intensity, high-friction workout--is simply embarrassing. Along with buying these pants, I also bought the all the right places crop, which, so far, after one single workout, haven't fallen apart quite yet, so that may be a better bet than these, although the ATRP crop material doesn't feel quite as nice as the fast and free's.
To have stumbled upon the seemingly perfect legging suited to my preferred workout and lifestyle, and then to have it fall apart after one wear and wash is already devastating, and to have that pant then cost $128 should frankly be illegal.

column6: These pants are amazing!! They are stretchy, yet keep everything together (if you know what I mean). The material is amazing as they feel very light, yet not see-through at all. They are super flattering and the length is just right for any short girls out there. I love these so much, I own them in three different colors.

Looooove these leggings. The Nulux fabric is my favorite - super soft and form-fitting but it holds you in in all the right places. I use these nearly everyday for running, weightlifting and hiit workouts. The contouring around the glutes is so flattering. I used to love the Run the Day leggings which had similar seams/contouring around the glutes but sadly Lulu doesn’t make those anymore. The high waist is perfect and the drawstring at the waist super practical and necessary for me (my hips are much wider than my waist).
I don’t know understand the complaints about these being see-through - I have these Fast and Free leggings in 5 colors (olive, burgundy, grape, navy, light blue) and they’re definitely not see through. Maybe that’s a sizing issue...?
In terms of care, I always wash and dry all my workout gear on the Athletic Wash setting on my washing machine and dryer and have never had any issues with pilling or fabric deterioration. All my Lululemon tights hold up really well for years with little to no special care.
Overall, I highly recommend these! Fingers crossed that Lululemon makes these in more colors (and maybe some more subtle/neutral patterns)!

Have you ever experienced the empowering feeling of spin class in the nude?! Me either, but I can only imagine that spin class while wearing these leggings is a close second.
These tights also maintain a flattering fit and the new graphite color is amazing.
BUY. THESE. NOW.
