Tellement confo et légers! J'aime trop le fit et le look de ces pantalons! Les poches sont bien placées et d'une bonne grandeur. Je les porte au Crossfit, au gym ou même en randonnée! Toujours plein de bons commentaires! :)

I really like the pockets and found them useful for a run; my phone stayed put without any issue, and getting the phone out while running wasn’t difficult either. For reference, I am 5.5”, 127lbs, and typically wear a 4 or 6 in lululemon. The material will take a little adjusting; it has a sheen to it that is similar to the effect when other leggings are too small/tight. This makes me feel uncomfortable/fat, which is silly, as I am fit. I still need to cinch the waist band to ensure they do not creep down during a run. I like the reflective dots at the ankles, I do not like the raw edge, as it seems cheap and unfinished. Overall, I don’t think the design/material warrant the price tag. They certainly are not my favorite lulu purchase.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey jeckert,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux are not working out for your sweaty pursuits. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'September 1, 2018'}

column6: These are extremely comfortable and feel so good. They look even better on too. They’re tight but I’m a good way and hug your body in all the right ways!

MAD!!! I am very disappointed in the quality of these pants. I had a pair of black ones for a year and they were wonderful. Bought another pair a 2 months ago to not only have a tear in the behind within the 2 months of having them, but then brought them back into a store and the girls did not care about me or the tear in my pants. I spent a lot of money on them and for the quality to not hold up to their standards I am very upset. Even more upset that there was nothing that they were gunna do for me. All she had to say was, "sorry its just the fabric, they are known to rip, its normal wear and tear." Well I DISAGREE!! This was 2 months after having them they should last longer than that!!!! SO UPSET!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey KSHAYE,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I\'m sorry to hear the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux 25". Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'September 1, 2018'}

column6: Whoop Whoop!!!! This tight is fabulous for this petite fit chick! For reference, I’m 5”1 , 117 bs who loves to weight train! The length was fitted not loose above my ankles, a big plus for me! The Ruby Red color is gorgeous & the length was more of a full length for little ole me. Side pockets were a plus and my butt flaws were gone!!! Thanks Lulu for a winner!

I used to think that cycling or running in any legging was fine. Then I became addicted to Lululemon. NOW I CANNOT ride in anything but the fast and frees. They are like butter on you but hold everything in! They aren't too tight or anything they just do a nice job of holding things together haha! PLEASE COME OUT WITH BETTER PATTERNS THAT DON'T SHOW SWEAT!! I love some of the colors you have put out but I find that if it isn't black, sweat shows very easily. This doesn't happen on my patterned pairs but I don't have many patterned ones because the selection is usually slim
These are by far my favorite lulu’s. They stay in place and they are the best quality in my opinion. I have them in 3 colors getting ready to buy a new pair.

The Fast and Free tights are my very favorite tights ever. They are soooo comfortable and look great. Love all the pockets for phone, ipod, etc. Use these tights for running, yoga and general fitness activities. Only thing negative I can say about these tights is the cost, definitely a little pricey, but worth it.

For the price, these really should be more durable. I buy special active wear detergent, never put them in dryer, careful where I sit and still, several of the seams seem to find a way to fray after a half dozen wears. I do love the look and feel otherwise though!

I’m 5’5, 115lbs with short legs/long torso and I sized up to a size 6 and these fit great! I love the high rise fit because it covers everything and the 25in inseam left an inch between the pant leg and ankle socks. I would recommend for running or everyday wear!

These leggings are made from very fine material, very thin. I ordered in size 8 ( which is usual for me in Lulu). I had to chenge to size 6.. i have been wearing them to fitness classes diring all summer. They are still in good shape.

I love these! The fabric is great, light weight but super supportive. The pockets are great for cell phone, etc. Very flattering and functional. However, I've had these 5 months and they've started pilling along the seams, which is a little annoying (especially given the price tag). A store associate told me to be careful about washing them (which I am) and recommended I just pick off the beads. Overall, happy with the purchase and would recommend them for runs, walks, and class workouts!

Honestly im so disappointed in these leggings, the seam is coming out on the side and it is falling apart, for 128 dollars this is unacceptable. This has been happening to a few of my leggings lately after only having had them for about 1-2 months and im so disappointed
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey daniaud123,\nOh no, I'm bummed to hear that your leggings are unravelling! We stand behind the quality of our gear and I will be in touch via email to dig into this with you -- chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'August 29, 2018'}

column6: These are my all time favorite!!!! They fit well and the material is amazing!!!
Love the pockets, the fabric, just wish they were longer.
Thought I loved these first time I put on. By third wear they felt stretched out and I am constantly pulling them up. Definitely not true to size, should of bought a 4. :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Earlymorningrun,\n\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 27, 2018'}

column6: I loved the color of these pants and was so excited to receive them, then I tried them on and could see every dimple and imperfection I have and more. I was really looking forward to these pants for running but unfortunately didn't feel like the price matched the quality and had to return them.

Loved these at first but although I've barely worn them and have only washed them twice (& air dry) the seam is starting to come undone. I have multiple different fits of the other pants and have gotten more wear out of those ones and this has never happened before so I'm very disappointed especially being that this is the most expensive pair I own. :(
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: I have been waiting for Lulu to come out with a gray legging in this style and when I saw these, I just had to have them! I wore them for one day and noticed that a thread in the back was starting to unravel. When I took them off, the entire seam had unraveled and now there are tiny holes where the seam used to be. While the legging is still intact, I'm afraid to wear them because I don't want to have the leggings split on me or the holes to get bigger. The bottom part of the leggings is also loose and I haven't even washed them yet or worn them more than once.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey sydballet267,\n\nThis definitely doesn't sound right. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 26, 2018'}

column6: I have never been so disappointed with a purchase in my life. Less that 5 months and there are holes all over my tights. The stitching is coming undone at the pockets. After a couple of washes the tights have become see through. I am not impressed Lulu:( What has happened to the quality???
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear ALEXIAC,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We\'re sorry to hear that the stitching has come undone on your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'August 24, 2018'}

column6: I loved loved loved these, until I started breaking out in a sweat :( !! I ordered these in Pacific Breeze and you can literally see EVERY bit of sweat— which yes I know it’s there when you work out, but it’s embarrassing when it’s glaringly obvious in your privates (front and back)!! Anyways other than that they’re amazing— they literally feel like butter!!! Maybe I wouldn’t mind them in a darker color that isn’t prone to showing sweat! I do a bit of it all, hike, yoga, barre — and wore these hiking and to barre class! (Was embarrassed by the sweat in class )
These are great. I’m a guy who uses them for running and they work well, especially for outdoor runs in the heat. The fabric is light and keeps you cool. Pockets are handy to keep phone, keys, etc.
I love the unobtrusive feel. The high waist helps keep my tummy secure, and I never have to adjust my tights as I do my crossfit wods. I’m keeping my eyes open for new colors.

These are the best leggings for HIIT, running and any other activity you can think of!! I have two pair and I LOVE them. My go to workout leggings always!! Worth the investment! The fabric has pulled alittle around my calf and Im not really sure why which is a little disappointing but other than that these are amazing.
Love these leggings!! I have them in three different color and will prob buy more

Amazing material! So durable and I’m not afraid to wash. I love these for spin and running specifically because of the side pockets, which are big enough to hold a huge phone. Forms to your body just right after you’ve worn them a couple times. If you’re in between sizes, size down. Can’t wait to buy these again in another color.

I am literally in LOVE with these leggings! Prefer them more than the all the right places, they fit so close to the body and the material is SO thin its AMAZING! I really hope lulu comes out with a white version of these beauties <3

These are the best Lulu pants I have ever purchased. The description really does nail the name, and you feel naked in the pants yet everything is held in as it should be the seamless ankle is $$ and the side pockets are great. I have 6 pairs and want more. I am 5.5 130 lbs and pretty fit... I fit into a size 4 but sometimes order a 6 just for a comfortable fit, when I size up I use the draw string to hold them tight. I recommend these pants 100%
I love these silky smooth pants more than life itself
I’m obsessed with these leggings, they are different!! So comfortable and light I wear them all year round!
column15: the cut on the bottom isn’t a clean cut look

column6: These are the best leggings I have ever had. They actually feel like you are wearing nothing and the pocket is life changing! I have 2 pairs and will be buying more!

column5: Great but please change the waist!!!
column6:
I have quite a few fast and free pants/crops. I love the nulux material! The only complaint I have is the waistband. The wasitband cuts into my waist - it’s not high enough to cover my whole waist and it digs in wherever the edge of the pant sits. It is unflattering. The waistband on the breezy dot pant is perfect!!!! Why not merge the two- the waistband like on the breezy dot (it has pockets too) and the nulux fast and free! The fast and free needs a smoother waistband 100%. Especially after you have had them a little while the waistband becomes worse and can even start to roll and really shows through your tops in an unflattering way!!!
I love the prints so please keep prints in nulux coming because the material is so thin it really shows any cellulite on the plain colors. The prints mask any cellulite. The nulux material is absolutely the best material for working out - I do HIIT and yoga in them. Love the material especially in hot climates!!! Please fix the waistband!

they really hug your legs nicely and aren’t uncomfortably tight in any places. they don’t fall down when i’m walking or rise up in the crotch and they don’t stretch out in the upper portion either. they’re probably my favorite pair of leggings i’ve bought so far
Light comfortable & pockets what more can you ask for
These are my favorite tights for working out. Decent compression feel and really good fit. Love these and the red color is my favorite!
This style is my absolute favorite tight for fit, style and function. And this black/white pattern rocks!!!! I receive compliments every time i wear them!!!
I love this style and the comfort of these leggings! They keep me cool while working out and do not leave sweat marks. (super impressive) Can't wait to get another pair.

I love the fit and feel of these pants! It’s always so soft and smooth. All of my lululemon pants are the naked sensation feels. I wish they made more of these in different prints. And the 7/8 length is perfect for me. I’m only 5’4” so it’s hard for me to find pants that are the perfect length.

column5: Perfect for Running and Hot Yoga
column6: These pants are great the fit is tight but not too tight and they stay in place during activity. Great length at the 7/8th crop. I have worn them running and to hot yoga. They are super comfy as well if your wearing just to be fashionable. Love the cell phone pocket as well, I didn't need an arm band.
column14: stay in place no riding up

column6: Best leggings ever. They hug all the right places. Love that they are high waisted. The material makes you feel like you have nothing on.

I have own several pairs of fast and free. Great quality as always, keep everything in place. Only drawback is it shows sweat . I will have to cover myself up quickly after a high intensity class so i don’t look like i wet myself. Would not be a problem with darker color ( purple, black), but i had the problem with pink, red and teal : (
column19: {'LL_response_content': "We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us.\nWe hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear some of the colours haven't held up for you as expected. It doesn't sound like your gear is performing as intended so I've sent you an email to follow up.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 21, 2018'}

column6: I LOVE these pants - I run with my wireless ear buds and often have to wear a special belt or jacket in order to carry my phone - not anymore! These pants have deep pockets to fit even the biggest phone so I don’t have to wear extra gear! I hope to find some in capri length as well!

I have another pair or Lulu leggings that I absolutely love - so when I bit the bullet and finally ordered a second pair, I was a little disappointed. The seam on the right leg constantly twists around my leg which, for the price tag of these leggings, is a major annoyance. They have also seemed to stretch out a bit after only a few wears and one wash. That being said, I do love the 7/8 length and the pocket along the side of the leg is a nice touch.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.\nI'm sorry to hear of the stretching and twisting that you're experiencing on your pants and can understand why you're not pleased. We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 21, 2018'}

column6: I wore this the first time in hot yoga and it did not disappoint! It wicks off the sweat from you body and you leave the room almost dry in no time. It does not bunch or roll down when doing the poses, and it tucks it all in. Its also great that it has pockets for your phone, card, keys, or whatever can fit when you go for a walk or a run. The seamless hem also makes it feel like it's second skin. Definitely worth the money.
Best pants ever. Never have to stop my workout to adjust. Hope you never stop making these!
I love these pants for my long runs. I have ran three half marathons, and every one of them has been in these pants. They are my second skin and love all the pocket availability.

column5: Great pant.. except the waist band
column6: I really love the fabric and the feel of these pants while working out, except the waistband. It's bulky. The entire waistband is ad additional layer with pockets. I've never needed that many pockets, even while distance running. Might be helpful for marathon runners, but not for your average workout. If Lulu would make these with a thinner waistband I'll def own a pair.

at first this was my new favorite tight. i planned on ordering another color because i loved the fit and how flattering and comfortable they were. after just one watch i noticed pilling. i don’t think that $130 leggings should have these issues after one wash. by the way i followed the instructions on how to wash them.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Kate101001,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I\'m sorry to hear the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II Nulux 25" has pilled for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'August 19, 2018'}

column6: I always have my eye out for a nice grey color and these tights are the perfect color! My go-to’s have always been Align & Wunder Under, but I’ve been on the hunt for a material that’s better for higher intensity work-outs and I’ve definitely found that in these tights! They’re the perfect material where I feel secure but comfortable, I don’t want to strip them off the second I get back from my run. I go back & forth between sizes 6 & 8 depending on fit and material, and I’m happy I went with a 6 in these tights. I will definitely be buying more colors!

Depuis que ma fille et moi avons découvert ces pantalons, nous ne portons plus rien d’autre au gym ou lorsque nous allons courir! Ils sont vraiment confortables tout en restant bien en place! Ma fille et moi avons maintenant chacune 7 paires de ces pantalons!!! Nous les adorons!

I bought these in black and prefer wearing them over any of my other Lulu workout pants because they are so light weight and comfy. I finally bought a 2nd pair in navy and will no doubt be getting more. The side pockets are an added bonus. Highly recommend!!!

Fit and comfort is good. Very disappointed in the wicking factor. When you sweat in them you get a lot of sweat marks that stick around and stay even when fabric dries. Won’t spend the money on them again. Should be better for the price point.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear AReed,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We\'re sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" fell short of our sweat-wicking expectations. We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'August 16, 2018'}

column6: These tights are exactly what I was looking for. They have a snug fit, without being constricting and are super lightweight (a combination I havent come across yet). They have a high enough waist to cover any bulge. Pockets are an added plus and easily fit my huge Note 8. Highly recommend.
column15: ive lost weight and they are no longer as id li

column6: These are breathable and tight fitted...not hot or uncomfortable--perfect for the gym, hiit workout, yoga or long run! Also super cute around town :)
I love the matirial very confortable for running or lifting

I am so disappointed in this purchase, as I expected it to last more than just one wear for the money I paid! I bought these because they were highly recommended by the sale's associate at the store in Upper West Side. I literally wore this for the FIRST TIME to a Pilates class and it's crazy how much it stretched out after one wear! It fit so loose and it definitely was not flattering anymore. I'm very upset because I rave to all my patients and friends how great the quality of Lululemon is even after multiple washes. However, the first day I put these on, the quality did not last! Feels SUPER CHEAP!
PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THESE PANTS! You will fall in love with them when you first try it on but that feeling won't last even a day.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ElleLa,\nNice to hear from you. I\'m so sorry to hear of your experience with the stretching on your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I completely understand why you\'re disappointed with this and I\'d love to help turn this around. We fully stand behind the quality of our gear, so I\'m going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 15, 2018'}

column6: I absolutely love these leggings! Super soft and comfy. They’re literally like another layer of skin (heart eyes)

If you like to run these are must haves in your fitness wardrobe! They dry super fast and suck you in in all the right places. It’s almost like having a waist trainer with the high cut waist of these leggings. And the pockets are the epitome of convenience. Hard to get used to going without pockets once you try the Fast & Frees.

I buy all of my Lululemon pants in a size 10, and I’ve never had a sizing issue. However, the waist band on these tights is just too big. Even with the interior drawcord (an addition that I love on my Train Times pant), the tights still gap. The 7/8 length is great, and I love the pockets and the sweat-wicking material; the waist is just too large. It’s probably beneficial to size down.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear fearlesslyfree,\n\nWe are sorry to hear about the sizing issue with your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 Nulux 25". Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It\'ll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 14, 2018'}

column6: These are my favorite yoga pants. They are cool in the summer and warm in the winter, but the side pockets are my favorite feature - useful for after practice errands, phone, etc. Also, they dress up nicely with a longer shirt over them. I have a black pair and a blue pair. Love them both and don't bother to wear my other yoga pants anymore.

column5: Fast & Free was my 1st Lulu leggings 2 years ago when they 1st released this with pockets
column6: Fast & Free is my most loved Lulu leggings! I had my 1st one 2 years ago when my hubby gave it to me, I still had it & still in great condition. This new nulux material is way better especially when doing a hard core leg workouts. I love the fit, the material, the side pockets to keep my phone while I'm doing a walking lunges with barbell. I love it so much that I think I have every color of it. Will highly recommend!
They’re beyond comfortable and they work for more than just running. I love doing yoga in them, especially hot because they’re so thin and light.

These truly feel like a second skin. Comfortable, soft, and they feel barely there in the best way. I wish I could buy them in every color and wear them every single day of my life. If you must wear pants, they might as well feel like this!!

column5: Love these but seam already fraying!
column6: I absolutely love these leggings - I have 3 pairs! But, unfortunately, after a few wears/washes the seam on the side of leg is already fraying! I don't dry them and I wash as directed. Super disappointing for how much I spent! I love these but either they need to make better or lower the price. Not fair that they start to ruin so quick especially since I could live in them :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear BeckB,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We\'re sorry to hear that your seam has come undone on your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'August 16, 2018'}

column6: as much as I wish these were less expensive, I couldn't resist buying another pair of lulu leggings. I'm in love
These pants are so comfortable and flattering!
love these they are soft fitted high waste fun new colors not old looking and the best part no pilling comfy enough for running :)

Ok so we all have plenty of the one color tights. These are fantastic if you want quick wicking materials. Pockets are fab to walk doggie or go on bike rides. The once complaint is that every time I come to the website looking for patterns under this leggings... they are loud, not trendy, not stylish. Can we please please have the CAMO print that the align and wunder under currently have?
For reference curvy, pear-shape between 125-130lb got the size 6 cause the 4 is too restricting on legs.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Dear oclock,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux is not performing for you! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'August 12, 2018'}

column6: This guest did not provide a text review.
These are lightweight and flattering! They are easy to move around in. Lulu never fails on the leggings category. I could wear these all the time.

The fast and free are one of my favorite tights for running, training and teaching. They are perfect for fall,spring and summer since the fabric is thin. I love how the fabric is breathable and feel like a second skin. You are not restricted by the fabric in any way and can move freely but at the same time the waist band is tight enough to hold the pant in place while you are moving and avoids sliding. The tight has side pockets, which are a “must” in my opinion for running/hiking. I always prefer the side pockets over the back one.
However, the side pockets in the fast and free pull to the side if you don’t have thin legs....it’s probsbly due to my thighs being wider than my waist.
That would be the only reason for this tight not to be perfect. I have tried to size up to a size 6 and see if that helps, but it doesn’t.
I also see that issue on %99 of my clients that wear the F&F.
Maybe it’s just me paying attention to it..?!?
Other than that, the tight is perfect and I highly recomend it!
column14: fabric the rise & band the length.
column15: pockets pull to the side while fabric stretched.

column6: These are my favorite tights ever ever ever. I love how they fit, the fabric, the pockets, the seams, all of it! But this new version feels like it isnt made as well... The fabric feels heavy with dye and not as durable as the earlier versions.. So we shall see what happens!

column5: Favorite Yoga Pant of ALL TIME
column6: I LOVE these pants. The fit is perfect. I am 5.1 about 115 lb and curvy. Size 8. These pants feel like satin and move like a dream. I have almost ALL the colors-patterns and get compliments every time I wear them. Side pockets are a plus, especially when I am teaching and need to keep something close as I move around the room.

I have these leggings in 3 different colors and I want them all! They are my absolute favorite. I have been teaching fitness classes for about 10 years now have been wearing lulu for about the same. I discovered these only about a year ago though. After trying many pairs, these are definitely the best. The pockets are perfect, and they fit tight but do stretch out, so they are perfect for anything from yoga to cycle to lifting! One of the colors I got (dark purple eggplant) did pill a little bit on one leg, even though I never dry my lulu. That's really my only issue. But for some reason it never happened on my black or green ones. I also potentially recommend sizing down one because they do stretch easily.
column15: one of the colors i had pilled

column5: Fell in Love with the Fit
column6: I tried these on in-store for a size reference to see what size leggings I would order online and I instantly fell in love. They are AMAZING and feel like a second skin. Great for strength training workouts and day to day outings. I originally thought I was a size 8 but size 6 fit perfect. They slide on so smoothly and I couldn't be happier.

I love the color of these tights, and I'm athletic, and have very little cellulite. Somehow, these tights magnify what cellulite I have, and just fit too loose, even when sizing down. There is no support and I'm not sure what type of activity they would be good for. I returned them. I own a LOT of Lulu stuff and I rarely have anything negative to say about an item, but these are just not even worth the price when on sale.

column5: Way too expensive for what you get
column6: super expensive and got way too loose after wearing for a workout. the seams around the inner thigh started to give out too and caused a hole. thought I bought the right size and made sure I washed them correctly.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey brooklyn1marie,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. We'd love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 7, 2018'}

column6: These are the most expensive pair of lululemon leggings I have bought to date, and I'm extremely dissatisfied with the quality. My first time wearing them and they completely loosened up to where I had to keep pulling them up my entire workout. Super sad these did not live up to my expectations... I had high hopes.

I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 7, 2018'}

column6: I was so excited to get these tights a few months ago but I am so sad to say that just a few months into training for a race they started to wear and I actually got a hole on one of the legs. I am so disappointed because I am such a fan of lulu leggings and cant believe this happened! Overall disappointed in the quality of these leggings

We look forward to hearing from you.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 7, 2018'}

column6: These are my favorite pants! Love the high rise and the second skin feeling. Wick away sweat and the sweat doesn’t show!

When traveling, I put my I phone in one pocket, passport & ticket in the other. Wear a short dress, flip flops or tennis shoes & I'm good to go. I can stretch & yoga at airports yet my 7/8's are never too tight, always look & feel great!
column15: other colors are muddy so i stay with black.

column6: I bought these tights on a whim while on vacation and am so glad I did! I've been looking for tights with subtle pockets and these fit the bill. These tights are perfect for jogging, walking, and running errands around town!
These pants age so smooth, so sleek, make my behind look SO good....I wish I could wear them every day. Great quality, breathable, and comfortable.

I tried these on in store after having an employee recommend them to me. I do some cardio but mostly stick to weight lifting and HIIT workouts. I have two pairs of them and absolutely swear by these. They keep me cool, they make me look great and I have not had a single issue with them. I bought a second pair at an outlet and the same thing with that pair, they're 100% amazing. Give these leggings a try! They're worth the extra $$$!

Great fit! The only pants I have found where the waistband doesn’t roll down when I do Pilates. They stay put so I can focus on the activity and don’t have to worry about pulling up my pants. I have had some pair for 8 months and they have not stretched out fo me and still look great. Please add more colors.

I love the Nulux fabric. It is so soft and comfortable. I am used to the Luxtreme fabric which is alot thicker. Nulux is definitely completely different. The support is much lighter and seem to stretch out a lit’l more than other Lulu fabrics. I would order down a size next time. I mainly wear these for light exercise and everyday wear. Love the reflective details and the fact you can roll the bottom of the legs up which helps alter the length. Great purchase!
column15: they do stretch out a lit’l with wear.

column6: My favorite! I have 5 pair and waiting for more colors to come out. They are comfy and hold everything in all the right places. :) I have small calf’s and these fit perfect.

I accidentally bought these not realizing that they are high waisted. While I love the print, I do NOT love the fit of them. I find the high waist to be very uncomfortable when I sit down. Kind of a bummer for the price that I paid.
Fit and length are perfect ! Make more colors with this pattern!

This is my favorite leggings. It's very comfortable, soft, thin, but not see-through (I have a black pair). It makes you feel like you are not wearing anything. I wear it for yoga, pilates, and spinning. I've had it for a year now and I wear it very often. I machine wash and air-dry it. It's still in great condition and I think it will last a while.
However, I can see how the fabric could be ruined easily. I usually don't wear it for outdoor activities or casual occasions. I would definitely purchase another pair and would recommend to my friends.

All lululemon is awesome! But these tights are phenomenal. Lazer cut bottom is great so it's not tight in the ankle and pockets are a must. My favorite used to be all the right places but I have found my new favorite tight. Must buy!
Perfect pant for my boot camp style work outs!! Never have to readjust these during during class!
Best pair I've bought yet. I use them for yoga, CrossFit and running.
These are my go-to leggings. Incredibly comfortable and very flattering on different body types. Recommended to me by my 28 year old daughter and we both love them.

Loved the way they felt and looked in the fitting room but after wearing them for a few hours they got way stretched out and just didn't have the snug feeling I like anymore. None of my other lulu's have done this so I'm a little disappointed :( wish I would have read the reviews and sized down!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear Ems5,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We\'re sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" has stretched out. We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'August 1, 2018'}

column6: I have these pants in other colors and needed another pair. These get the job done and hold everything in perfectly. Perfect for running, spinning, cross training and all things in between.

I have this pair in black. With every pair of Lulus I wear, they loose their tight, booty boosting look and feel. I follow the wash instructions and they still pill on the sides and by the crotch. My pockets have tiny holes. Though this is my favorite style that they carry so I bought another pair in Pacific Breeze. The color was a light kind of robin egg blue online. When they came in the mail, they looked more gray than blue and I was so disappointed because I loved the color in the picture so much. My new pair also had a stain on them so that was very disappointing. For paying this much for leggings I would have hoped they would have lasted longer.
column15: loses tightness after a few wears
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Ems28,\nI completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'August 1, 2018'}

column6: I feel like these run quite a bit smaller than all of my other leggings. I’ve also only worn them once and I noticed that the seams look fuzzy like they’ve had excessive wear and rubbing. If they weren’t a sale item, I wouldn’t be accepting that or keeping them.
column15: already look old and ratty after once use

column6: These are my go-to pants. I was worried that the unhemmed bottoms would be a problem, but there is no issue with rolling up or folding. I have read many reviews stating that theirs have stretched out.. this was not the case for me. Fit super snug every time I wear them.. I have washed them about 7-10 times now and they are definitely holding up. The pockets are great and they are just soo soo comfy! I purchased them in green size 8 and they fit true to size. I'm 5'5", 160ish.. I love that they fit right about the ankle.

I was very excited to receive these pants, I love the unfinished hem at the bottom, the luster of the black and the super high waist but unfortunately they stretched out after just one or two wears...and not the expected amount of stretch, they're visibly very loose. They look like im wearing pants two sizes too big! Its very upsetting especially for the price and brand. I wonder if you size down if the problem would persist. I therefore do not recommend these, for you will be spending your whole work out pulling them up and will not feel the support they should provide.

column6: These pants are by far the most durable, and functional pair of lulu leggings that I own! They do not pill and remain dry during even the toughest of workouts. I cannot put into words how much I adore these pants! Though the price tag is a bit steep, these pants are worth every penny and will last you for years to come.

column5: The Pants That Do It All
column6: Overjoyed by the fit of these pants!! They literally go anywhere I need to go! Either weightlifting, running, hiking, rock climbing, yoga or dog walking they have not failed me yet! They are very light so they are perfect for the outdoors in Florida or they can be just a the warmth needed for a chilly morning! I got the navy pair which do show any light powders from rock climbing clay but that is to be expected! I am 5'2, the pants fit perfectly just above the ankle and just above the middle of my torso.

I’m obsessed with my fast & free crops so I was dying to get a pair of the 7/8 length. As always, did not disappoint. These are the most comfortable leggings I own. These are great for running, work out classes, and lounging

Love love LOVE the way these pants fit. However, I'm disappointed to see that they're pilling :( this has happened with other lulu leggings I had and I assumed with this material and the high price tag that this problem would be avoided! Love the fit just with that the pilling hadn't ruined the clean look of these otherwise amazing leggings.

column6: I absolutely loved these leggings when I bought them and after a few wears they have stretched out so much I can't even wear them. They not only fall down but look weird now with how lose they are. I am so bummed this happened because they were my favorite leggings from lulu and I have bought so many over the years. column6: These are the best pants to workout/live in. I love the side pocket for my phone and the raw edge hem at the bottom looks awesome and feels great. Definitely my favorite pair of pants I own from Lulu. Need more solid and neutral color options.

When I first bought my leggings I absolutely fell in love with them. But after a 3 months the seam started to become undone. I followed all of the washing/drying instructions and it still happened. I was really sad because I expected them to last a while.

column5: Loved for the first few weeks
column6: I loved these leggings so much for the first few weeks. The material feels like butter and they are super breathable. Unfortunately, the seams have started to fray around the pockets (despite handwashing and hanging to dry) and the waistband has stretched wayyyyy out. I'm constantly pulling them up and can no longer wear them to the gym. Wanted to love these so bad.

column6: I have never owned a pair of lululemons before, so I was excited for my first experience. I went into my local boutique and had lots of questions. My sales woman was nice and appeared knowledgeable. I was very interested in these quick drying fast and free leggings. I tried a pair in my size and they felt good. She told me that she had a pair and that I was going to love them. Not used to the naked feel, they felt comfortable and breathable. Unfortunately, after my first workout, they felt loose and baggy. I wish she would have informed me that this type of material, although wonderful, can stretch during a workout and to try a size down.

column6: Although I love the feel of these leggings and the breathability of the fabric, I have only worn these pants two times and I now have a hole on the upper right thigh. I would like to have them replaced (they cost a lot of money).

column6:
Great pants for any type of workout from weight training to spin. Fabric is light, and side pockets are practical.
But, the stitching has started coming appart and is pilling in between the legs. Enough to be noticeable when looking in the mirror during a workout.. yikes. Waistband has also completely lost its shape. It is bagging out and I keep needing to adjust it during workouts.
I've owned these for about less than a year and I can't say they're worth the money. I have other pairs of Lululemon tights that cost less and are far better quality. Disappointing.

column6: I’ve done a lot of running over the years, and I’m just coming back from an injury and allowed myself to splurge on some running gear this spring. I’ve always assumed all running tights are the same, and that it doesn’t matter what you run in. After buying my first pair of these a few months ago, I changed my attitude about running tights! I love that these don’t have a tight band at the ankle, come up a little higher around the middle, and the fabric- the fabric! It’s so smooth and perfect for running. Nice and tight, but thin and swishy! The pockets on the outsides of your legs are great! I love love love these. Own two pairs now and will never go back.
column14: how they don’t move while running

column5: LOVED them, until they quickly started fraying at the seams
column6: I went instore and tried on all the leggings and these were the clear winners, love the material, love the pockets. I wore them a handful of times, being very careful to follow all care instructions and now the seam on the pockets look absolutely terrible! They cost way too much to be falling apart.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi jagmae,\n\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. Best wishes!", 'LL_response_date': 'July 21, 2018'}

column5: Love at first feel, but not anymore
column6: I was in love when I first put these pants on - the "naked sensation" as lululemon describes it was amazing. The pants are incredibly comfortable and I felt supported throughout all my sweaty endeavors. However, after a few months of regular use, following all the recommended lululemon washing protocols (no fabric softener, washing with like fabrics, hanging to dry) and the pants have stretched out quite a bit and no longer feel like they are supportive for workouts or everyday wear. I have these in both black and navy, and they have both stretched out while my other lululemon products still fit me (so it's not due to changes in my body!) If you buy these, just caution that they may stretch out quickly!

column6: These fast and free leggings is a love/hate relationship. When I initially tried on these pair of leggings in store, "WOW"... It makes your figure very flattering. Ive owned these leggings for a few months now. I'm quite disappointed with the fit now because it started to stretch out after the 3rd week of wearing it (2-3 times a week). Im constantly having to pull up these leggings. I would use the drawstring and tie it as tight as I can, but it becomes uncomfortable. Store associate suggested to buy your usual size, but I would suggest sizing down. You have to be careful with these particular leggings because the seams pill easily. Other than that, the material feels great against your skin.

column6:
I'm really disappointed in these pants, and the follow up. I had them for 4 months, bought them for lifting weights the gym. The seams on the inner thighs completely pilled and wore off. I don't think they were structurally damaged but it looked ugly. I always hand/gentle washed and air dried these pants. I was going to just put up with it but I ended up tripping and creating a hole in the knee. That was my fault but I guess It speaks to the structural integrity of the Nulux material.
My boyfriend and I spoke to an educator online and asked if there was anything we could do. They suggested we go in store and see if we could exchange the pants or send them in. I asked my boyfriend to exchange them in store for me. The store associates said no. He gave them the pants mistakenly and now they've been sent away somewhere never to return. I'm disappointed in this whole situation and the follow up.

These pants were amazing in the store, and fit well/make your butt look so good. They were great for HIIT type workouts as well and stayed up due to the drawstring, although I mostly wore them casually (for plane rides and long drives). This is a great length for shorter girls (I'm 5'1", 110 lbs, wear a size 4 in all lulu).
However, about 2 months after I got them, I noticed really bad wear and tear on the seams on the side pockets, although I had followed care instructions to a T. This wasn't normal pilling like I have on my wunder unders, the seams just look very "fluffy" and ripped up, which makes these look cheaper than they are. They still fit great so I can wear them with long shirts, but honestly I can't be paying $130+ for pants that start fraying at the seams within 2 months. I wouldn't recommend this specific pant, although I've had great luck with other lulu (specifically the aligns).
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear r8590,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" is not performing for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'July 17, 2018'}

column6: I am very disappointed with this item. I swore by the fast and free leggings - they were my go to leggings for over a month. After a couple wears they started pilling in the crotch area and along the seams (very noticeably) which has never happened to my other lulu clothing. I only wash my Lululemon clothing with other lulu clothing on the hand-wash cycle and never put them in the dryer. Each time I wear them the pilling gets worse and worse to the point where I don't want to wear them anymore because I am afraid they are just going to rip apart. This is such a shame because its a great product but I have now wasted 135$ on leggings I am going to have to throw out.

column6: I swore by the align leggings and would wear them to do everything but then I realized I was ruining them because I was starting to do more cardio. Anyways I splurged the extra thirty bucks or whatever and have been wearing them very often and have been enjoying them. This morning I put them on and looked down to realize there was two holes in the calf. I have no idea how holes would get there and I am very careful and how I wash them so idk. Right now I am just disappointed because I haven't had them for very long.

column6: The pockets on these pants are great for at the gym to tuck away your music device. I love the feel of them, and as a curvy gal I've never had the thighs pill with this fabric. The only reason I didn't rate them 5 stars is because the seams have begun to pill and come lose, however after 2 years of regular use I don't think it's that bad!

I received these as a gift for Christmas since my friend loved hers so much and she knew that I was training for a half. I wore them 2-3 times each week and made it a point to air dry in between laundering and wears, since they did a fantastic job of not smelling and retaining its shape. I was super careful to not wash it with any cotton items and to always air dry since my friend shared her horror stories of extreme pilling on her Aligns and WUs. By March, they started to stretch out but I thought it was because I was more toned up and had completed my half marathon by then. However, it has continued to stretch, despite stopping my intense workouts, around my knees and ankles. The inner thigh seams have pilled noticeably, which is something that has never happened to my other lulu gear. Otherwise, the fabric remains as soft as ever and the pockets are still handy. I am disappointed that I can now only use it 1-2 times before laundering.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear 2018teacher,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I\'m sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" is keeping its shape! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'July 12, 2018'}

column6: I bought these about 4 months ago and the fabric is already starting to wear and the thread in the seams are starting to ball up. I've never dried them (I've always air dried them) so I am very disappointed that my favorite Lululemon leggings are already started to show some wear and tear after such a short period of time given their price.

I already have the Speed Ups which are a great pair for winter. Looking for a good summer pair and the Fast & Free changed my life. The seamless ends of the pants are perfect for a short girl like me (5'3"). I've never owned a pair so comfortable. I lift and run almost everyday. The pockets are perfect to place your phone in while lifting but I haven't tried running yet. One time I wore them 3 days in a row and on the third day they still kept their shape (don't worry, I wasn't working out). I have a larger butt and legs and these leggings fit like a glove with a perfect fit in the waist. Definitely going to buy a few more pairs. Totally worth the investment!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi RSa1,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. It’s a bummer to hear that the fit did not work out. We look forward to speaking with you soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'July 21, 2018'}

column6:
The Fast & Free Tight 7/8 are usually my go-to for any workout - yoga, running, cycling, etc. I never have any complications (no see-through, falling down, stretching out), so I have accumulated 4 pairs to use interchangeably. I really do love them!!
I recently had gotten my latest pair and I noticed a hole in the rear end (not near a seam, just in the middle of the right side) forming, and I've never experienced anything like this with any of my lulu leggings. I was really disappointed especially because these leggings are not very old (4 months), and I follow all of the instructions when cleaning them and taking care of them. This makes me want to think twice about these leggings in the future.

column6: These have very quickly become my go to pants! The nulux fabric is simply amazing feeling! I wear these for pretty much everything including my own workouts and coaching gymnastics as well as day to day activities. I purchased my normal size and even over multiple wears and washes have never had any issues with fit.

Bought these with a little hesitation because I was not familiar with the nulux fabric so I wasn't sure how much I would like them. After running in these I immediately fell in love with them. I bought them in black and they are super sweat wicking, and the pocket is a nice added bonus.

column5: Some of the best lulus out there
column6:
I bought these after hearing my friends rave about them. They're AMAZING, squat proof, and perfect for working out or even on the go daily. I love the feel of them and the rise is perfect.
Only thing is that these do pill very very quickly. I put them in the dryer once and they already had noticeable pilling. I find that if I just air dry them, it's fine.

I am extremely disappointed with these running tights. The raw edge is totally impractical. The pants ride up to knees when I run. Even if I'm walking around the house, they gather at my knees. This is extremely annoying & uncomfortable. After one wear, I brought them back to the store. I wanted to return them. Another athletic store where I shop allows you to return an item after you've tried it out. I was told that this was not Lulu's policy and that if I had them hemmed, the problem would go away. It didn't. Still bunching. If I'm paying for quality, I should get quality.

column6: I am super picky about workout pants and I LOVE these. I did not find them to stretch out or be thin. I would be sad if these changed as I am planning to buy more. I have two already and they have become my go-to workout pants for running, HIIT class and walking. The leg is so comfy and I love the fit.

column5: Very Cute but definitely stretched out waaaaaaaay too much
column6:
I love lulu and I own a ton of different kinds of gear. I have these in black and then in a black and white combo and they both have stretched out waaaaaaay too much.
I take good care of my lulu clothing and am careful to wash following the instructions, very disappointed considering they are 130 a pop.

column6: Bought this in excitement about a week ago as they felt and looked fabulous in the change room. It was also a recommendation from the staff working at lulu when I mentioned I wanted to wear it to either pilates or a spin class. I went to 2 classes within the week and then gave it a wash. I have noticed that it has become noticeably loose, not to mention a small hole in the left side pocket where you can place either your phone or keys. It may have tugged on something...but honestly for $150 (with tax) I expected more. It's also so sad that I tried on 3 types of pants that day at the store and with the price point of these, I thought I was leaving with the best pair for me.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear Riri31,\n\nThanks for taking the time to pass along some feedback on the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I\'m sorry to hear the pants are not holding their shape for you. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'June 28, 2018'}

column6: I agree with the other comment that these became SO stretched out. They began stretching out right away, but I was able to put up with them by tying the drawstring really tight. They would ride down and I would have to pull them up often especially in the leg. This morning I put them on and even the ankles were so stretched out!! There is now a slight flare around the ankle. Imagine workout pants that are flared and don't lay tight on your ankles haha... All my other workout pants are from lulu and I have never had this problem. Everything else about these are awesome though. I love the pockets and the reflective dots. I guess size down 1-2 sizes if you want them? But maybe not considering the price.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Dear Laaaaaaa,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'June 27, 2018'}

column5: The ONLY leggings I wear to workout!
column6: I love these leggings so much that I no longer wear other workout pants...I have these in every color! I love the high waist fit, the string inside to tighten when needed and the pockets on the side for cellphones, keys etc...

I love these leggings for running because they are nice and thin so I stay cool while running during spring and summertime. They are also super comfortable while still staying up and supportive for running! Even when I go on 10+ mile runs, they don't give me any issues at all. I will say, I understand the sweat stain issue people have mentioned about these leggings. I always tend to buy patterned or dark leggings though for that very reason. I definitely think you'd have the crotch/butt sweat situation going on if you were to buy a lighter color in these. Overall, these are my favorite running pants from lululemon - I will definitely be buying more pairs.

I own a lot of lulu stuff because they really do make the best products for yoga, running, weight lifting etc. I bought these because the woman in the store told me how much she loved them and they were like 'butter' every time she put them on. I agreed with her 100% - the first time I put them on I wanted to buy them in every color. However, it has been about two months and they are super stretched out. I follow all the washing instructions when I wash my lulu stuff and NEVER put them in the dryer. Super disappointing considering they are almost $130. I would have hoped they last longer than 2 months.

I really like lulus leggings and I've owned a pair of similar material before, however these are just a bit too thin for me. In sunlight they're not flattering on the back side with cellulite. They're pretty leggings on the rack and they fit well but they are too thin.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey sdkjslkjdl,\nOh no, I'm bummed to hear you're not loving your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II. I'd love to work with you towards a resolution -- keep your eye out for an email coming your way shortly! Chat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 21, 2018'}

column6: I was looking for another pair of lulus with lots of pockets and these absolutely fit the bill, and are super comfortable and flattering as well. I was excited to wear them for the first time today to a tabata class but was horrified to find that, even though I bought them in navy, I had huge, embarrassing sweat marks by the end of class. I have way lighter colored lulus that don't show sweat as easily. Super disappointed to have spent $130 for pants I can only realistically wear around my house.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us.\nI'm sorry to hear you're having such trouble with your pants! I'd love to chat with you further about this and find a resolution. Watch out for an email coming your way soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 20, 2018'}

column6: these are the best! Love the naked sensation and the nulux fabric--I wear them hiking in the rain and they dry in a jiffy. I also wear them when it's super hot outside in Florida for sun and bug protection. These pants are just amazing and I want 100 pairs. The pockets are great for your phone and the hi-rise on these is perfect. Some of the other lulu hi rise leggings tend to come up too high (I'm 5'4 with an average length torso) and make me feel like I am suffocating but these are perfect on me!

I bought the fast and frees in Dark Olive. At first I loved everything about them until I got out of my workout class. My friend pointed out that you could see large sweat marks everywhere (super embarrassing). It is really unfortunate that the website doesn't express that sweat shows through. If that was the case, I would have purchased them black. I work out 6 days a week and really need leggings that ACTUALLY wick and are quick drying. I've purchased colored tights from other brands and haven't had this problem before. This was my first Lululemon purchase and it is extremely upsetting to spend $128 on leggings that won't hold up in an intense workout.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi CaliFit26,\nWe stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We'd love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 17, 2018'}

column6:
Absolutely fell in love with these leggings, love the pockets!
But it took only two months before the seam ripped, super disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Anne5432,\nWe stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'June 17, 2018'}

column6:
Can we say Pockets??? I really like these leggings because they have storage areas for your phone/card case wallet and makes being on the go a breeze. I babywear a lot so it's important for me to have my hands free. My phone goes in one pocket and my wallet in the other. So. Easy.
My one complaint is that they are a bit too thin for the colder months so I end up being a bit chilly BUT... still super convenient. I know these are meant for runners but Lululemon needs to make an everyday mom version STAT. I would totally buy them up.

I got these in black and loved them so so much I got a second pair in a dark blue colour. If you're wondering if they are worth the slightly pricier tag, they are, I wear them as often as is socially acceptable and they have held up better than anything else I own.

I bought these leggings as I was in love with them in the store. The material is thin and comfortable and the staff member working told me they were built to last. I bought them despite the hefty price as I was under the impression that they were a good investment and they would last. I have followed the washing instructions as I own a couple pairs of Lululemon leggings and know to cold wash them and hang them to air dry to avoid pilling. A couple weeks later the thighs and seams started pilling pretty bad. I thought it might stop so I kept wearing them despite them looking worn. Fast forward a couple months and I cant wear them at all. The fabric is so stretched out that I am constantly hiking them up and the pilling got even worse. I wanted to love these!!!!
Overall, I am sadly very disappointed with this product.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Nimss,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 13, 2018'}

column6: I purchased this back in April 14, 2018. The shipping was fast which was a plus. I absolutely loves these pants. the material is so silky soft which makes you feel like you're wearing nothing when you have it on, and the pockets are deep and they kept everything in place... But, I've owned these for not even 2 months now, and I've noticed that it has hole on the back side already... I've hand washed them hang dry, so I'm not sure what happened! I'm very dissapointed because it was one of my favorite pants and it is quiet pricey and I only got 2 months out of it.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey KristinaFlores,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Yikes! Sorry to hear about your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 ll *Nulux 25". We\'re eager to work out a resolution, so I\'m sending you an email to chat more.', 'LL_response_date': 'June 11, 2018'}

column6: I've bought 4 pairs of fast and free tights (two solid pairs and two patterned pairs) over the last year, and wanted to really break them in before writing a review. I can say hands down these are my favorite tights for running!! They are so light, the side pockets are amazing, and I feel great when wearing them! These are the only tights I wear for running, and I'm constantly on the hunt for a new pair to add to my collection! As someone who sweats A LOT, I find the dark colors (black and super dark purple) to be the most forgiving, as well as the dark patterns (I have two very dark floral patterns that were released in the fall). I don't love the light colored ones that I've tried (shows cellulite, yuck), or the patterns backed in white due to pattern stretching/fading. I have had ZERO quality issues with seams or stretching. In case it helps anyone, I'm 5'6", 125ish lbs, and wear size 4 in the F&F tights (the tights fit fairly snugly on my waist, but I haven't noticed any bagging out or stretching in the legs). I wash the tights with my other LLL gear on cold, and put them in the dryer on low heat and they're good as new! Thanks LLL for a great running tight!

I purchased these back in November 2017 and have worn and washed them at least twice a week since (probably more than that) and they are still looking good as new. No piling, no fraying seams. I have worked out in them and lounge so they have been through a lot of wear. They are absolutely the most comfortable tights I have ever worn. They have ruined me for all others. I am concerned about the piling reviews and hope Lululemon has not changed the fabric content since November as I would like to purchase crops for the summer heat.

After reading all the reviews on these I was excited to try them. I sized down based on recommendations. Bad Idea in a print. They are backed in white so when they stretch in legs and hip area the pattern losing the color, becomes muted and sheer in certain spots(bend test). Maybe solid color would be better. But sadly I am stuck with them now and definitely won't be wearing to the gym. Not what I expected from a pair of lulu pants that cost over $100. These have just become the most expensive lounge pants I own
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi fllulurunner,\nThanks for taking the time to leave a review. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 10, 2018'}

column6: i bought these pants as i started my weight loss journey. They were most definitely too snug when i originally bought them, and now that i have lost enough weight they finally fit! BUT after wearing them around for a while, they seem to stretch out, and i have to constantly pull them up. They feel fine for the most part, but it sucks that they dont stay put, because besides that they are amazing pants!
column19:
{'LL_response_content': "Dear cvenus,

Thanks for making time to share your experience with the Fast & Free Tights. Congratulations on reaching your fitness goals!

We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution.

We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 8, 2018'}

column6: I originally bought these in a Size 4, my tts however they were loose and I was continually pulling them up so they were returned. I was advised to size down in these. Finally, I was able to track down the same amazing print (Hinshu Alpine) in a Size 2 only to be even more disappointed. The fit is much better however the print became very faded and lost the bold colors as they are backed in white. The side pocket and lower legs kept the bright regular color while the thighs and the bum area are faded, muted and almost sheer. They look ridiculous. These might be great in solid colors but would not recommend any prints. Very disappointed

I absolutely adored these pants--the material is so silky soft and the pockets are deep so they keep everything in place... However, I've owned these for about three months now, and I don't even want to wear them out in public anymore... I've washed them completely separate from everything else (even separate from other athletic clothes) in cold water and hang them to dry, so I'm not sure why they are falling apart! The stitching in the buttocks area has become distressed and 'fluffy' and they are becoming very pilly. I'm so sad because these were my go-to pants and I only got three months use out of them :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey emrencarv,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. To carry on this conversation, we\'ve sent you a follow up email.', 'LL_response_date': 'June 6, 2018'}

column6: I originally bought these leggings because I wanted something lighter that I could run in, but something sturdy enough for weightlifting. I love these pants and they fit wonderfully, however, after only a few washes I noticed some piling around the seams of the pants.
column15: piling after only a few washes

column6: I have had quality issues with these leggings in the past, but they are the best fitting and breathable running tights that I have ever worn, as they are my favourite race day go to. Perfect balance of flattering and compression.

I really wanted to love these pants. I loved the pattern that it came in and liked the feeling of the fabric. I was hoping it would give me a ‘next to skin’ feel while doing yoga. However, I spent most of my time hiking up the pants as they were constantly falling down. Even though they felt very tight and would hold me in, the would work their way down as I moved. Not really what I want to be doing while practicing. Dissapointing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi MutisportMama,\nThanks for reaching out to share this feedback. I'm sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight isn't performing for you. Keep an eye on your inbox for an email with some solutions headed your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 4, 2018'}

column6: I bought these in NYC about 10 months ago and after a few wares I noticed they stretched out a bit in the waste and thighs, but I could at least tighten them with the drawstring. However, about three months ago I noticed the stitching in the waste started to break and unravel. This has happened before to me with other Lulu leggings in the seem around the ankles, but never in the waste. I knotted off and kept wearing them and now the entire seem in the waste is unraveling. So much of the stitching has fallen out. I'm starting to think this might be the quality of Lulu's legging now since this has happened to two others. However, I will say I have five other pairs that I absolutely love and have no problems with. So, I'm not sure what's up with these. Maybe just unlucky.
column15: they stretched out after a month or so
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi lazenmo,\nThanks for taking the time to share this feedback. It's not good to hear that your gear is not performing as intended. I'd love to help you find a fix so I've sent an email your way so we can continue this conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 4, 2018'}

column6: I bought a pair in the store because I forgot to pack my workout clothes while I was on vacation about 2 months ago. Although the fabric felt nice, the stitching on the pants is pilling and fraying already. I am surprised that threads can even pill. Now, I don't even wear it to workouts anymore because it looks embarrassing to be wearing pants with pilling and fraying seams. I am disappointed in the quality of the item, especially given the price I paid.
column14: length appropriate for my petite stature
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi NotaYogiYet,\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 3, 2018'}

column6: I loved these leggings when I tried them on in the store. They fit me wonderfully and the material was very comfortable. I decided to use them on my weekly long run yesterday. I ran about 10 miles in a wooded state park, through some underbrush at times, and after the run I noticed the seams on my lower leg were starting to come out, the threads were making large loops. I had not even washed the leggings at this point. I am afraid if I run in them again they will completely rip open. I am so disappointed because I thought I would be paying for robust construction. I wanted to love these but I can't handle them falling apart after one use.
column9: SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, CA, USA

column6: The ruby red and the teal show sweat stains. BAD. So embarrassed the other day after spin class. For $128 I was hoping that it wouldn't be a problem. It was like a whole glass of water had been dropped on my front and behind areas.. Disappointed.

These leggings feel like you're not even wearing them. Great for any kind of workout: yoga, running, spin, CrossFit, HIIT, etc (speaking from experience as a trainer, coach, and student). Easy to move in. Pockets are a bonus to stash your phone/iPod. High waist band ensures they don't fall down. Also great for general everyday wear. Would recommend sizing down a size to account for some stretching in the fabric over time/consistent wear. Will feel tighter at first, but works best for the long run.

Absolutely obsessed with these leggings! My favorite way to work out is spin and these leggings have endured many many many classes! This fabric has absolutely no pilling and my leggings look the same as they did a year ago (and I wear these leggings once a week, maybe more). The only downside is the price tag, it is difficult to get myself to buy even one pair of these, let alone another. So I will stick with the pair I've got until absolutely neccessary.
SIZING INFO: I am normally a 6 or 8 in lulu and I wear a 6 in these leggings and they fit nice and snug! Do not have to worry about the waistband rolling or anything else. Overall great solid pair of leggings, just wish they were a little cheaper.

I honestly do not understand all the negative reviews. I own three pairs of these pants and I absolutely love them. They are the only pants that I will wear for Orange Theory Fitness They wick away sweat while keeping me cool. I think they are worth the price. I have had no problems with stretching and I have owned my first pair for about 8 months now.

Purchased in store Feb 2018. Snug fit, true to size. Worn for jogging. After 3 months of wear the left leg seam and crotch seam began unraveling. I machine wash and hang dry these tights & I have tights much older than these with all seams still in tact.
For $128, I expect higher quality from my work out gear.
I would attach a photo of the seams if I could, but there doesn’t seem to be an option for that.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Amadeusleander,\nOh dear, I totally hear you -- It sounds like you've had a less-than-thrilling experience and I'd love to help. Keep your eye out for an email from us shortly -- chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'May 29, 2018'}

column6:
Let me start off by saying that these pants really are nice. The material is super soft and comfortable and allows for a lot of movement. However, for $130 I expect the pants to fit how I purchased them in the store. I bought these THREE days ago and I already feel they are a bit stretched out and I have to adjust them/pull them up. My $30 Gymshark pants stay in place a lot better. Just like everyone else here mentioned (I wish I would have read reviews first) the material stretches out a considerable amount. I wish an employee would have told me so I could've sized down. I find this to be very annoying as I live almost 2 hours to the closet store and I already took the tag off, or I would have exchanged them. Very very irritated about this! Probably won't be purchasing any in the future because this is actually the second time this is happened. The first were the Wonder Under's.
I would also like to mention that I bought a size 6. According to the size guide, I should've gotten an 8. This makes absolutely zero sense considering how they fit!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Lifter70,\nThanks for taking the time to share this feedback. It's not good to hear that your gear is not performing for you and I'd love to help you find a fix. I've sent an email your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 28, 2018'}

column5: Feel Great, But Quality lacking for the price
column6:
I excitedly purchased these from the Hyde Park store in Tampa and was pumped because these were my first Lululemon pants ever. The in-store help was amazing and I decided to splurge on these as I loved the barely there feel of he nulux pants on my body.
My love was short lived after having these for only a month and a half, the pilling of the seams is crazy and the fit is no longer as snug as it once was. I am so bummed as I wanted to love these pants so much! Both for the price and for the luxurious feel of them.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: These are my favorite Lulu pants!! I usually wear them to spin class, and they *used to* hold up with no distraction. I got my first pair a few months ago, and I've been extremely careful in how I was them (cold wash, air dry), but they stretched out a lot :( these pants are so expensive, and I love them, but they no longer feel the way they used to...they kinda keep slipping down and are big in the waist/butt area

column6: I've had these for about 2 months and the seems are already coming apart and the pilling is extreme. I don't understand how such expensive pants can be such poor quality.

I really love these pants when you first put them on, they're comfy and fit great - but the minute I tried to run in them, they were falling down on my waist :( I should say that I have strong quads so I have to buy pants that fit my legs and hope that they fit my waist - these did in the store and I was so excited... but they let me down after my first run. I tried them for a Crossfit workout too and the same thing, they just keep slipping down. I was so excited they were going to be great but they're maybe not the best for high intensity activity.
