We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 26, 2018'}

column6: These are by far my favorite lulu pants for intense workouts! The null fabric is gorgeous and feels like a swimsuit material but with more support. I feel like I an do anything in these and recommend them to anyone who likes doing a variety of workouts!

column5: Great for the first few months, but seams are getting fuzzy
column6: I loved these pants at first, but the fabric doesn't seem to be holding up. Everywhere there's a seam, its starting to get fuzzy / tufting, even though I wash this pair only with other Lululemon products.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hello OliviaP,\n\nThanks for taking the time to reach out to us. We'd like to lend a hand with your experience and will be sending you an email shortly to make this right. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'May 25, 2018'}

column6:
These are seriously the best pants. I have three pair of them and plan to order many more! They are weightless and stay put. I ran my first half marathon in these and they were perfect. I love the side pockets. They are big enough to store my giant phone.
Please never discontinue these!

I bought these in black a few weeks ago and noticed that they stretch out so much in the booty area. Too bad because I love the fabric and the pockets. For that amount of money I expected better quality.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey liza40,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. Watch out for an email coming your way soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 23, 2018'}

column6: These pants are absolutely amazing! They fit like a second skin, but they are not uncomfortably tight. They may feel thin, but they seem to be very strong/durable and very well insulated. I love the length as well, given that I am very short and most pants tend to run too long on me - the 7/8 length is perfect! I also love the fact that these pants have side pockets; perfect for storing my phone in when on the go!

I wore these ONE. TIME. and they stretched out so bad. I was constantly pulling and tugging them up during my workout. I ordered my normal size, as I have multiple leggings/shorts/etc. from lulu. These stretched out within the hour so bad that I really won't be able to wear them. It really sucks that you can't return items like this, especially at the price point they are at. Very disappointed :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi CColombo,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. Watch out for an email coming your way soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 21, 2018'}

column6: Love these pants! The length is great. Material is great. They don't sag or stretch out!

column5: Never discontinue these - my all time faves!
column6: My go to tights for running and training. They fit me perfectly - I have 2 pairs of black and 1 navy and they are just right. The side pockets are key for my iphone on a run. I did try a printed pair and they don't fit as snugly so I stick to the solids and I'm good! The NuLux material is dreamy and holds its shape - I wish more tights came in this material. Wunder Unders were always my lululemon hall of fame favorite, but these have surpassed them!!
column14: side pockets for iphone on run
column15: printed ones don't fit as snugly

column6: These leggings have pockets I love and they feel lightweight and comfortable but I soon realized after a few gym sessions that these are completely see through whenever you bend, stretch, squat, etc. As in, all the time when you're working out! I'm so disappointed in the poor quality and am also very embarrassed that I potentially flashed so many people at the gym in these! I thought Lululemon fixed their see-through fabric issues...apparently not. Avoid these leggings!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi crookedrain,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. An email has been sent with additional information.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 17, 2018'}

column6: I bought the black ones in the store for $138 & initially loved them. I really expected more for the price, I have since then purchased this exact style in other prints & those have been okay. The seams are fraying at the sides and near the top as well. They have also gotten baggy around the hip area.

column5: SO comfortable, but sweat really shows!
column6:
I wanted to love these tights. They've got a perfect high waist and 7/8 length with the best pockets for all your necessities for a long run.
But ohhhhh my goodness the sweat that shows on these babies is incredible. I first purchased a black pair as I made my venture back in to the running world. I instantly fell in love and decided another pair would be great to alternate with my newly coveted basic blacks - even though I did notice some fraying with the stitching within the first couple wears and first wash. (to be honest, it wasn't a HUGE deal since they were so comfortable and prevented any discomfort or chafing while running longer distances)
I requested a second pair as a gift and was lucky enough to receive a beautiful teal colour. I continued to use my black pair and decided to save the new teal ones for an upcoming race.
I did one of my tapered runs pre-race and wore my race outfit just to make sure everything was comfortable and was shocked to find an incredibly noticeable "she pee'd her pants" sweat mark after 20 mins in to my run.
I know I am one to sweat when I work hard - but most times would like for it to be a little more discreet than it was with these tights.
In true lululemon form, customer service was incredible as always and offered to return my tights. I am hoping to purchase a similar pair... in a darker colour!
:)

So very disappointed in the quality of these pants and Lululemon for selling them. The stomach is way too tight and the bottom and legs seem so worn out Im afraid to wear them. I rarely leave reviews but I felt that since the price was so high and quality so poor it needed one. So not worth the money.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey STLMomma,\nOh no, I'm bummed to hear you're not loving your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II! I'd love to work with you towards a resolution -- keep your eye out for an email coming your way shortly! Chat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 15, 2018'}

column6: These fit great in the store. After one wear they are sagging in the crotch and I am constantly pulling them up during my workout. A size down was way too tight in the waist and was not comfortable. For $128 they should not be doing this!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi LuluJenn,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. To carry on this conversation, we've sent you a follow up email.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 14, 2018'}

column6: I have three pairs of these, but two of them are coming apart completely on the seams, in multiple places. I was recommend these by an educator for working out/running instead of the align pants. I'd rather deal with pilling in a pair of pants than the seams coming apart, though. $128x2 pants that I no longer wear because the pants are going to fall apart any second.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi beeg4,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback to us. We\'ll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.', 'LL_response_date': 'May 16, 2018'}

column5: what is this quality....? very disappointed
column6: I have been considering buying these pants for a few weeks and I finally decided to purchase them after loving the naked sensation when I tried them one. I had heard people talk about the incredible quality that Lululemon offers and this is how I justified the 138$ +tax. However, after only 3 wears and following the care instructions, I am extremely disappointed of how they turned out. The seams and sides frayed . Also, they really seem worn out despite the fact that I only wore them 3 times!!!! Definitely not worth 138$ and I expected a better quality. I would not recommend to anyone.

We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 14, 2018'}

column6: I've worn these leggings twice so far, and noticed the seam on my left leg is fraying, and snags in the material. I bought these at the Lululemon store for $138 and now I see they're on sale and this is probably why. Not impressed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey FicklePuma,\n\nWe appreciate you taking the time to leave a review! We always want your gear to perform for you, and it sounds like your Fast & Free Tight isn't living up to your expectations. Keep your eyes peeled for an email coming your way so that we can make this right. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'May 13, 2018'}

column6: I received these pants as my first pair of lululemons, and I am horribly disappointed. After one wear they frayed and pilled, and the look worn out after only 4 wears, I actually stopped wearing them because I was afraid they would fall apart. I own a few other pairs of different pants now that I have worn a lot more and they look fantastic compared to these. While I love the fit, they just look very junky.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey there laxmonkey6,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your experience with us! We're bummed to hear that the Fast & Free Tight missed the mark, and would love to turn this around. Keep your eyes peeled for an email coming your way. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'May 13, 2018'}

column6: This was my first first pair of tights from lululemon, they fit me well. However, I have worn them 3 times and they are snagging like crazy. For the price paid the fabric should not snag so easily. I am actually hesitant while wearing them for fear I am going to damage them further, this is not something I should even be thinking while working out, thus making these tights utterly useless.

I was very excited when I first bought these as they were my first pair of lulu's. After the first wear, the seams started pilling. After the first wash, the bottoms started unraveling slightly. I feel that the crotch area has become loose after the wash even when I followed the care instructions. I am very disappointed and would not recommend to a friend. Not worth the price.

I've had a few pairs of these pants over the past year, the full length and the crop - and I find that while very comfortable, they're not snug enough or compressive for a real workout. I especially dislike them for running. The compression is obviously a personal preference issue. However, I do notice that when buying my TTS4, they seem to fit fine at first. But after wearing them for a few months, they stretch out and don't retain their shape. If I try to size down, the waist area is too tight and uncomfortable. These are pretty pricey pants to be having this issue.

I'm so sad to say that I regret spending the extra cash on these leggings. When I initially tried them on I was so excited but, after a handful of wears and not even owning these for very long, they are already starting to frill at the bottoms as well as loosening at the waist. The pockets are also starting to loosen up. They felt so smooth (like I barely had anything on). I still have not even washed these leggings! :( So sad. I love lulu's but sometimes it can be hit or miss with them and these were one of them.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear LULUNV87,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We\'re sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" has stretched out. We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'May 9, 2018'}

column6: I was very disappointed after receiving these pants to open the package to strings already hanging out. I have only worn these pants a few times, and the seams are fraying at the sides already with hardly any use as well as quite a bit of pilling. I own many pairs of lulus and these being one of the higher priced at $138.00 I expected better quality. Would not recommend.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Dear hf17,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'May 9, 2018'}

column6: A big fan of the Align Pant, I was looking for something similar to run in and hoped to find that in the Fast & Free tight. I have only worn them twice to run and unfortunately, have found that the waistband and fabric around the hips gets loose/baggy. Not at all what I expected, a distraction rather. Maybe you should size down?
column19:
{'LL_response_content': "Dear allidefran,

Thanks for making time to leave a review.

We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution.

We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 8, 2018'}

column6: Extremely unhappy with the quality for the price. I bought these full-price and the first day I wore them they tore like tissue paper. When I brought them to the store I was told that since the tear wasn't along a seam there was nothing I can do. I used to be an extremely avid lululemon buyer and have refused to purchase anything since if that's the attitude towards 140$ legging with such poor quality.
column19:
{'LL_response_content': "Dear radf,

Thanks for making time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux.

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution.

I’ve sent you an email to follow up and help further", 'LL_response_date': 'May 8, 2018'}

column6: I'm surprised to see so many bad reviews on these. I LOVE these leggings! They are, by far, my favourite leggings to run in. They fit perfectly and comfortably, and don't need adjusting during my runs. The side pockets are perfect for holding my phone/keys/etc while out for a run, without feeling bulky. I love them for workouts too - they move well, and don't feel weighed down when I get hella sweaty. They are truly like a second skin. I've just ordered another 2 pairs because I love them so much!

Okay, I am in love with this pants when I tried them in the store. I actually ended up having 3 pairs. First couple of wear was so comfortable, I feel dry all the time, it feels cool and breezy, and I love the naked sensation (seriously, the only thing that made me feel like I'm wearing pants is the waistband that's thicker than the rest of the pant). After my 5th wash, the pants starts to feel so loose. I keep on having to pull it up. The crotch area felt baggy during my 4th workout with the pants and it just wouldn't hold its shape. I tried size 2 in the store and it felt extremely tight. I'm sure it will stretch, too, but then I don't want to risk exchanging for a size 2 and then ended up damaging the fabric while I wait for it to stretch out. I was really hoping this $138+tax pants would last longer than the Align or Wunder Under pants that only lasted a couple month. I wash all my Lulus using a garment bag, delicate cycle, cold water, no fabric softener, and lay flat to dry. Lululemon needs to seriously improve their quality.
column19:
{'LL_response_content': "Dear sweatinlulusandnikes,

Thanks for making time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux.

We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do and we'd love to make this experience right for you.

We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 5, 2018'}

column5: they were great but the seems fall apart!!!
column6: You need to size down in these!! seems so weird at first but once you wear them they will stretch out to your size! I am typically a 6 and I got a 4. They can get a little baggy around the waist and slide down. They are soo comfortable to wear but the seems are terrible!!! I have had theses for about 4 months and the seem between my legs is fraying and will probably rip apart! I will be so sad when they do, but it is pretty bad. I have owned a ton of lulu leggings in all different styles and this is the first style to do this! BE CAREFUL

I really wish I could love this product. After just a couple months of normal use and correct washing and hang drying, the pants no longer hold their shape and are pilling quite badly along with unraveling seams. They just don't fit or look right anymore and I am slightly embarrassed to wear them. The back upper fabric seems to be fading/thinning as well. Definitely disappointing, you'd think such a premium priced item would last a while. Despite the mess, I do have to add that they are certainly a very comfortable pair of leggings.

I've had these a few months and primarily use them for spin class. They are super soft and so far I have had no quality issues. I am, however, extra careful when I wash them. I turn them inside out and wash them on delicate, then hang to dry. I have two pairs and the seams are perfect and there is no pilling. I could, however, just have gotten lucky with the ones I received. I am 5'2", 120lbs and bought a size 4.
Though I am disappointed in the Dark Olive color. It shows sweat like crazy, and in the worst places! The first (and only) time I exercised in them, it looked like I had peed myself. So embarrassing! I would be cautious in purchasing a color other than black if you plan on using them for workouts.

This is the SECOND time I've had issues with the same pair of pants. I originally had it in a size 4 which was holy moly so loose and had a lot of extra fabric. It stretched out the longer I wore it. Luckily enough, I was able to exchange it to a size 2. HOWEVER, it STILL STRETCHES OUT. Even when I sized down. There's also still extra fabric. I hate that I pad $143 for these leggings. I hate them and really would like my money back.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Mandybeezindatrap,\n\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 2, 2018'}

column6: Although the pants are comfortable to wear for training at the gym, there is already pilling on the outside seam of the pants. To spend that much on workout gear I would expect high quality but if only after 2 weeks (about 4 uses) if there is already pilling on the outside seems I would say it's not worth it. Not worth the hype if pilling has already occurred so quickly and it is also very noticeable.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey new321,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm bummed to hear of the pilling you're experiencing with our pants. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'May 2, 2018'}

column5: great leggings but holes starting to appear???
column6: I got these leggings this Christmas as a gift. I really like these leggings especially for working out, but lately I noticed a small hole by the right knee, I didn't think anything of it until it started getting bigger with each time I washed it. I take care of all my lulu lemon leggings the way I was told so I am not sure why these leggings are tearing...
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Angella,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Oh no, I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'May 2, 2018'}

column6: SO i recently hopped onto the lululemon leggings train after much convincing from one of my girlfriend. She raves about the quality of lulus leggings so I thought I should give it a shot. This is my first pair that I bought about 3 weeks ago. I tried it on in store and i fell in love with how comfortable and lightweight this legging feels. The workers were very knowledgeable and counseled me on how to care for the leggings. After 2-3 wears and only hanging dry them, I started noticing the stitching are very fuzzy and falling apart!!!!! It looks like little fuzzy balls handing from the stitching!! It is so noticeable that I feel uncomfortable wearing it out!!!! It is so disappointing because i wanted to love these so much! Especially for the price i paid i expected way better quality than what I received. I have 2 other lulu leggings that i purchased last week and I have not worn them out because im afraid the same thing will happen to the stitching. Bottom line is i am not satisfied with the quality at all....huge disappointment.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Darsy,\nWe appreciate your feedback regarding the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux. We're eager to make things right because we stand behind our gear, so I'm sending you a follow up email to continue the conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 30, 2018'}

column6: Here's the thing - I am a HUGE lululemon fan. I buy everything from here for my first races or crossfit clothes. When I first tried these on, I fell so in love - to the point of actually buying 4 pairs. These pants started piling after one wear and wash cycle. The "snug" feeling that it originially had around the butt/hips is completely gone and I haven't even wore them more than once/twice. I am so absolutely fed up with lulu at this point... These past few purchases have been a disaster. The threads are coming off in the ankles and it also piles up in the crotch area too.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi GymisLIFE1111,\nWe're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 30, 2018'}

column6: I have been a Lululemon lover for years, have purchased over 20 products from lulu and have not had issues until now. I loved everything about these leggings for the first 3 wears, after that not only did they pill along the stitching (this has never happened with any other lulu product i have) but they began to fit lose and the fabric began to feel cheap. I loved these leggings when i first purchased them but these are not the leggings i first purchased. If anything they feel cheap which for being so expensive doesn't make sense to me. They also pull/snag wayyyyy too easily which has also never happened to me before. I purchased a white pair similar to these with similar fabric from lululemon as well and they also pilled along the stitching. I am following drying and washing instructions so I'm extremely confused why this is happening. I also would've purchased these a size smaller had i known they were going to stretch. I have worn many pairs of my lulus many times before washing and this has never happened so I don't know whats going on with these new styles. Disappointed, don't suggest purchasing these unless some how they have improved them in the past 2 months.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi pilatesinstructor20,\nOh no, I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 30, 2018'}

column6: I've had these leggings for about a year now and they are the best investment I've ever made! They are well worth the money! All of my leggings start to fall apart in the thigh area, except the fast and free. They were the first pair of lulu leggings I've bought and I had to go back for more after wearing these. They're in almost perfect condition after having them for a year and wearing them weekly.

column5: Amazing...but falling apart at the seams!
column6: First off, these tights are amazing. The feel, the look, and the fit are great for the gym. The waist is high, the material is light and comfortable, and the design is flattering. My concern in after the 2nd wear and wash (following instructions), I noticed loose threads and the seams unraveling in the back. I love them so much I keep wearing them, but they are looking rough, more threads coming out, and I am worried if they will last, and I don't wear them as much as I want to. I have never had this happen to any other legging or top I have ordered through Lululemon. These are such a great legging...just a disappointment that this pair isn't holding up :(
column15: seam coming undone after one wear

{'LL_response_content': 'Hello spinMOM3,

column6: LOVE the feeling of these leggings when I put them on. Of the dozens of lulu leggings I have these were number 1...until I realized that It shows every drop of sweat. 5 minutes into a workout the sweat stains are already huge. Got talked into the blue which is a great color, but with the marks they leave I wish I had gotten black. Love the feeling enough that I would probably buy a second pair in black if they weren't the price they are.

column5: best swimsuit ever... (and by swimsuit I mean pants)
column6:
I bought these on a whim to keep warm recently, and boy did they prove to be useful. I wore them in the 2018 Boston Marathon in a last minute inclement weather outfit decision. Best idea ever. The pants held up, didn't sag despite my gu/salt tabs in the side pockets, and, as good running pants, I didn't even notice a single bit of discomfort from the pants - no chafing, no extra fabric flopping around, totally stayed put, naked as advertised. It poured buckets and I was totally soaked through for the entire race, and the only chafing I had at the end was the very top of the waistband.
Plus, they are cute.
column15: why are they so freaking expensive?

column6: These tights have been my go-to for 3 months! No pilling, split seams and so convenient with pockets, however; this pant loses retention, naked sensation and compression like no other. I was told this garment fabric "relaxes" so I sized down. The waist band does not stay up, even with the draw string. It overall feels/looks noticeably stretched out to a size larger, to no avail of following the washing instructions.

column6:
I'm absolutely at my wits end with Lululemon, my last few purchases there have been defective and I am so frustrated right now.
I just got these leggings and mind you, they were a splurge for me but I put them on and not even after two hours of wearing them the seams are starting to come undone.
Otherwise, the pants fit so perfectly and are so so comfortable. I want to love these leggings but i just cannot get over the reduced quality Lululemon is bringing to the market now

column6: These are my favorite leggings EVER! I have three pairs and they're absolutely perfect :)

Honestly couldn't be more upset with this lulu purchase, I have worn these pants exactly twice, no more. Have not washed them. The waist band has already become loose to the point that I have to keep pulling them up. I don't think I can wear them anymore to the gym because they are a constant annoyance because i'm uncomfortable. I spent after tax almost $150. I'm so upset about this.

column6: I really loved these leggings when I tried them on in-store - they are super comfortable, the fit just right, and the pockets are fantastic - however I wore them for the first time today and they are already falling apart! I've had these leggings on for less than 24 hours and the seams along the inside thigh are fraying badly. I have many of pairs of Lulu leggings and none of them have ever done this, even after multiple washes/wears. I'm super disappointed with the poor construction of these, especially since they are on the more expensive end of Lulu leggings.

I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 24, 2018'}

column6: I have sooo many lulu leggings and pretty much love them all. However, these are a game changer. I don't understand the negative reviews. My fast n frees are SO comfy and flexible. The absolute best for running and any other workout. The material is for sure upgrading and makes all the difference. They are pricey but extremely worth it. So light weight and literally a second skin, plus makes your butt look so cute!!! Restock the colors lulu, I want another pair.

These were a definite splurge item for me but I have no regrets! I absolutely love these pants. They are so so comfortable but still make you feel held in. I find myself washing them frequently just so that I can wear them more. These have become my favorite pair of lulus.

I tried these on in the store and fell in love with the look and the fit of them, so I decided to spend the extra money. These were great at first, but after about two wears they began pilling and stretched to where I am constantly pulling them up (not the same as when I tried them on). I also found a small hole above the knee that is slowly growing. This is really sad because I absolutely love all of my Lulu products, and after spending the extra money I am disappointed in the outcome.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Sar12,\n\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Nobody likes when their pants stretch out, and making things right for you is our priority Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 23, 2018'}

column5: Amazing but Stretch a lot over time
column6:
The feel of this fabric is amazing. Truly like you are wearing nothing. No problems with pilling or unraveling. Have had for close to a year.
However I would not purchase again.. due to the amount of stretching, even the side pockets gape when just walking around etc. They are now baggy in the crotch area and constantly have to be pulled up. I think maybe the fabric does not maintain its elasticity. I always wash delicate and hang dry.
I am 5'4" and 130 lbs, wear size 4. Fit perfect at first! I recommended to a friend who has not had the same issues as I have with stretching out FYI.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi saralxndra518,\n\nWe appreciate your feedback regarding the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I\'m sorry to hear your gear isn\'t performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. We\'d love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 23, 2018'}

column6: Seriously love these pants so far. I haven't owned them long but love both pairs I ordered. They are extremely comfortable. Hold you in well but feel almost like your wearing nothing. I am actually going to order another color. Im hoping I don't eventually run into the issues that other reviews have stated after longer term wear, but as of now Im keeping my fingers crossed and extremely pleased with these.

I've had these for about 5 and a half months, and I absolutely LOVE love love them. They are so comfortable, stay put during workouts, and don't stretch out as much as other Lululemon pants. Because of the fabric, they don't pill in the inner thighs. I bought them in a size 6, and am usually a 4 or 6 in Lulu depending on what I want. I really did love them. Sadly, I Just noticed that they are pilling/ wearing in the weirdest spot- at the calves on the back!! I am assuming this is from my long coat I wear in the winter, but it's totally unacceptable and so strange. For $130 I feel like this probably shouldn't happen, since it doesn't happen with any of the other non-Lululemon leggings. So, these are absolutely wonderful, but the fabric I guess is not very durable.

I am a huge Lululemon fan and have owned many pants, tights, crops, shorts, etc. over the years. However, these have to be my absolute favourite bottoms from them. They aren't too hot at the gym, the 7/8 length covers my calves (I have muscular calves and it drives me nuts when leggings slide up over them when they aren't supposed to), and it has pockets. I love the side pockets the most. I can fit my iPhone 6 or an iPod classic in them, which allows me to not have to hold onto my iPod while I'm working out or put it on the ground. I also love the tight fit, which I find to have a slimming effect. The fabric is light enough to keep me cool during cardio workouts.
column14: it had pockets i can actually put things in

column6: I absolutely love these tights. I'm very picky already, I want to be comfortable and able to focus on my workout not my clothes slipping and these did just the trick. I refuse to run in anything else. I run these through the wash on a handwash cycle and then air dry. And when purchasing...always size down. If they are on the verge of being too tight, that's the size you want!

I bought two pairs of these tights because I loved the way they felt in the store. However, after one run, the entire seam over my hips was pulling and coming apart. I hadn't washed them and I was wearing a Lulu long sleeve on top. I took them back to the store and they were very nice about exchanging them but the first time I wore the new pair....SAME THING! These are by far the most expensive pair of running tights I own and I don't mind spending the money but the quality is just not there. I am super disappointed. I will try taking them back and exchanging them for a different type of tight or just getting my money back

I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 18, 2018'}

column6: I just bought these pants last week and was very happy after wearing them to a yoga class. I have multiple pairs of the Wunder Under Luxtreme and Train Times Luxtreme.. I decided to purchase these pants after it was strongly recommended by an employee at the Lulu store. Unfortunately after washing them ONCE (and following the care instructions) they are pilling in a couple areas. I do love the feel of the Nulux material and they are super comfortable but not worth the $128 price tag if they can't stand up to a single wash.

column6: I loved them when I tried them on in the store and purchased them. After one wash, they shrunk enough to where I wasn't comfortable in them during runs. They give me muffin top :( I have shorts that I absolutely love and they washed well but these didn't.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Bee2,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. Oh no, I\'m sorry to hear your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" shrunk. We’d like to get to the bottom of this and work towards a resolution, so I\'ve sent you an email to follow up.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 18, 2018'}

column5: Love, but not great if you sweat a lot
column6: These leggings are AMAZINGLY comfortable - super thin feeling and lightweight. They stayed up on a full boxing/kickboxing workout and felt great. They also fit me well - I have bigger thighs and butt so that can be a challenge, but these were great! The only downside is you could see ALL my sweat in the Moroccan Blue color. The color is really pretty, but not dark enough I guess. Anything that dripped from my forehead onto the pants, knee, butt, and crotch sweat.... Super sad cause that's kind of embarrassing, but I wouldn't get rid of them since they are SO comfortable. I will probably just lounge in them. I also sweat more than the average person so they may be good for those who don't do super intense workouts or who don't sweat much.

There is nothing worse than wearing a pant that cuts off your circulation or keeps falling down as you move. The Fast & Free tight in both the 7/8 length and crop length are capsule pieces for everyones wardrobe. The pocket options are endless and the side pocket works perfectly with the 7plus iPhone. This pant works great for all activities. I have tested them while running, hiking, doing a bungee workout, an aerial fitness class and weight training to name a few. Love, Love, Love. Highly recommend!

I bought a pair of these since a friend had them and loved them. I love the fit, feel and fabric. However after a handful of casual wears, one wash and then a handful of casual wear (no workouts) the seams are pilling and the stitching on the right pocket is starting to come undone. Crazy for a $128 pair of yoga pants. The quality must have changed as my friend has had her pair for quite some time and wears them constantly. Hers look awesome - no pilling or undone stitching. Lulu has something changed in these?
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Annie11,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out to us. It's not good to hear that your gear has not been holding up for you, so I've sent an email your way with some solutions. Looking forward to connecting with you!", 'LL_response_date': 'April 18, 2018'}

column6: i purchased a pair of these fast and free tights (size 4) after having tried on my friends. i was super excited, but once opened the package, received disappointment. the tight sort of bunches up at the crotch area, the tights were fraying a bit at the edges, so i regret purchasing online. it is kind of see through at the bum area too, so that is annoying. lastly, this product is WAY TOO overpriced for its quality. i love lulu, but this was disappointing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi dancerniya1,\nThanks for connecting with us. It sounds like your gear is not performing for you and I'd love to help turn that around. Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'April 17, 2018'}

column6: I was very excited when I get this pair. I loved the reflective details and the pockets on the side. However, soon I noticed threads coming out near my ankles and starting to pile up at the crotch area. For this reason, I am not entirely pleased with this product.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey yogiwanabe,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. It\'s a total bummer to hear you\'re not lovin\' the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" as much as we are! We\'d love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 18, 2018'}

column5: Super cute in solid colors, but pattern is backed on white
column6: Love these pants; I purchased both the 'Pixel Haze' and 'Deep Phantom' and love the feel and detailing. I own 9 pairs of Lululemon leggings in a size 6, and i had to size up to an 8 in these as they are sheer in the bum when i bend over. I love the deep phantom colorway, but will be returning the pixel haze ones as they have a white backing and look almost cheap compared to the solid color.

I was in love with these leggings when I tried them on in store.
Unfortunately, after an hour or two wearing them they felt really loose under the glutes and knees. They stretched to the point where it just looks awkward (I got a size 2 which is normally a great fit). I didn't even wear them to the gym or anything yet... I'm really disappointed in these, especially since they're priced at $128... Will stick to Victoria's Secret leggings (the total knockout are a similar fabric and don't have this issue)
Really, really wanted to love these. And sad that they discouraged me from trying out more lulu.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Mare97,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We also wanted you to love the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25"! We\'re sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Talk soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 18, 2018'}

column6: I own 5 pairs of fast n free tights but this new model is completely different. They are a higher rise and way too loose in the butt and crotch area. The compression is not as good all around either. So disappointed
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Aquachic,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. Sorry to hear your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" aren\'t keeping their shape. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I\'ll be reaching out shortly to connect.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 18, 2018'}

column6: I've always loved my Lululemon pants as they have worn so well and kept their shape brilliantly so was looking forward to try a different style. I chose these for running as they were lightweight and I loved that they had the side pocket for me to put my phone in when I run. To begin with they were great, really soft, flattering and comfortable but on only the second wear I was having to stop to pull them up. They have lost their shape and have stretched out so badly, the pocket feels a little flimsy so doesn't hold my phone tightly and the front tie does nothing. I'm also disappointed to see the thread at the front hem is coming undone. I've always bought lululemon for its quality but super disappointed that within less than a month of wearing this has happened and even more so when they cost $128.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi acjny,\nThanks for taking the time to connect. I'm sorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight is not performing for you and I'd love to help you find a solution. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 17, 2018'}

column5: Great leggings, for a short time
column6: My best friend raves about lulu leggings so I saved up and got myself the BEST pair (as the sales associate said). To be honest they were! Super sleek and comfy and could withstand many workouts. However, after a month and half they are piling on the hems and a LOT less stretchy! I'm not sure how because my other leggings fit the same but these feel loose and the hems are all lined with that fuzzy piling around the pockets. Which is a bummer because they were so expensive and yet my COMFIEST leggings but I can feel them wearing down on me! :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Roddie,\n\nIt's disappointing to hear about your gear. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'April 12, 2018'}

column6: I just bought these in another color after loving them in the Aeon color that used to be available. I bought Moroccan Blue and after my first workout it was obvious they weren't up to the task of wicking any sweat. I had embarrassing sweat stains showing from my belly button on down. Very disappointed that these don't stand up to any workouts that cause you to sweat.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey JessSweats,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" aren’t up to the task. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 11, 2018'}

column6: I absolutely love these pants! Am training for my first half marathon and am so excited about them! I would recommend downsizing though- maybe even by two whole sizes- because I am noticing that after a month of owning them, they are definitely not as tight as they were initially. I follow the wash instructions for all things Lulu, so I know its more of a design thing given the fabric. They also get loose when I run with my IPhone in the pocket and pull down a bit, which is not ideal but manageable. Otherwise, love these, totally worth the price, and just purchased a second pair in bright blue to wear on marathon day!

I wanted a pair of the Fast and Frees for a long time before I finally pulled the trigger and bought them. They are great looking and great feeling! But I worked out in them for the first time yesterday and I was crazy embarrassed about how visible crotch sweat was! And it took forever to go away! I only wear black pants, sometimes navy when working out because of sweat. But I've never had it show as much as this! My lulu go-to is the Train Times, which do not show sweat as much. So I thought with Nulux that is "quick-drying, sweat-wicking," I wouldn't have a problem. I'm very bummed and regretting spending $128.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey brthomp,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" aren’t up to the task. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 11, 2018'}

column6:
I liked the fit of these pants. They are very flattering and have lots of pockets. I purchased them in the Moroccan blue because I wanted a fun light color to wear in the gym. However, that was a mistake. This shows crazy amount of sweat in the crotch whenever I am actually working out. This has never happened to me with other Lululemon pants.
I wore this to the gym for the first time when I did HIIT cycling. I walked away with a seat shaped wetness on my crotch/butt from the sweat. The next time I wore them I finished my workout with a ski erg sprint workout. It was short-maybe just 7-10 minutes. Regardless, in that amount of time the sweat accumulated on my hip creases and crotch area. Also, I have had to wash them after each wear because it stains so easily- I can see where my previous sweat marks were, so I can’t wear them after the gym to run errands even after they dry. They show every little mark very clearly, so even as a casual wear they are not great (say a long road trip where you are eating snacks).
Maybe they would be fine if you got them in Black or a dark pattern. But mine are extremely annoying to wear because they are finicky. Very disappointed- for the price and that I purchased this color.

column5: Cute and flattering to wear out or to the gym to cross train, but don't get these for running
column6: Initially bought these for running but now when I wear them the waist is oddly loose and so the they ride down. Don't want to be constantly pulling my pants up on a run or during a track workout. I will say they are great if you are going to the gym and want to bike or strength train or something like that. If you are looking for cute, sculpting (super flattering), and comfy leggings then I would recommend these. They are perfect for running errands, hanging out, or wearing casually. I would also say they are pretty nice quality, I dont understand why everyone is freaking out about quality. Also for reference, I am 5'5 115lbs and I got these in a size four.
column15: keep falling down and constantly have to pull up

column6: literally the comfiest leggings I have ever worn, fit perfectly! I have worn them less than 5 times and washed them once, air dried, and the seems on the outside are fraying. Spent $130 on them and so I was expecting the stitching to be more durable. Don't know if all are like this or i just got a bad pair.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi channy,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I would love to help you out with this. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 10, 2018'}

column6: I bought this because I loved the fit and the naked feeling. However, the seam along the front and the crotch started unraveling a day after I bought them! I didn't wash them beforehand or even worked out vigorously, and it started falling apart. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because the employees were so sweet and let me exchange them for a new pair. I thought it was just a bad batch and that it wouldn't happen again, but lo and behold, it started unraveling and pilling at the seams a few months later. I recently exchanged them again and the employee was so kind about it. Nonetheless, I was very skeptical and felt that it must not be just me who was experiencing this. I finally found the reviews on the website and saw that so many people had the exact same negative experience. Perhaps Lululemon should recall these and try to improve the quality instead of leaving it for sale while so many people are dissatisfied.

column5: First pair! Won't be the last!
column6: I came to the store to purchase training tights- totally planned on Wunder Unders.... a staff member recommended these and WOW! Not only do I feel totally comfortable in them, they are thin but not see through. I am a Fitness Trainer and have taken these through HIIT and Kickboxing classes--- they are awesome!

I bought these leggings as crops in the summer and loved them so much that I went back for the 7/8 in September. I've taken good care of them and wear them frequently but they have started pilling and there is a hole in the pocket. The original pair I bought is just fine though.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ddashdoodle,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We\'d love to learn more and make things right for you regarding your quality concerns with your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Hang tight for an email coming your way! Chat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 8, 2018'}

column6:
The first time I tried these pants on...I was in love! They fit so comfortably as if they were my second skin, the fabric is luxurious, and I could easily move in them. Compared to other lululemon leggings, they are more expensive but I took the plunge and bought them.
However, after wearing them three times without washing, I already noticed a bunch of piling around the butt and strangely the calf area. I have purchased other lululemon leggings before but never have they piled this quickly before!! I am extremely disappointed with these pair of pants, especially since I paid so much for them to pile this quickly. I did not want to believe that lululemon quality was losing their quality but these pants proved me wrong.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey seaw,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. What a bummer to hear about your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25"! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 8, 2018'}

column6: Unfortunately the stitching is a thin polyester thread which is different from most lulu leggings - it didn't hold up at all. After a couple wears the stitching is pilled and unravelling. For the price I'd expect better quality. I splurged on these because I loved the naked feel of the fabric, the fit and the pockets. I hoped to get a few years out of them, not a few months!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey bunny7,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". We hear where you\'re coming from and I\'m sorry to hear your tights haven\'t held up for you as expected. To carry on this conversation, we\'ve sent you a follow up email.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 8, 2018'}

column6:
I bought these leggings mainly for the pocket on the side... these pants have so much more to offer than just that convenient side pocket. I wore these to the gym and they were perfect. I did not have to adjust them once while I was doing my workout so I decided to give them a go on a 10k and again, did not have to worry once about pulling up my pants. I don't think I'll run in anything else now.
I followed the washing instructions and have not experienced any negatives. I have also just laid them flat to dry and they did fine.
So far 10/10 for these awesome lulus!!

I wore these pants once and there is already a pulled thread.... this is very disappointing since its the first pair of Lululemon leggings I've purchased. I was always very hesitant to spend so much money on lulu leggings, and now I see my initial thoughts on the brand were correct. I didn't pay over $100 for leggings to pull after one wear. I haven't even washed them yet. Overall, I am very disappointed. Shouldn't have wasted so much money on leggings.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Ultimatemiddlechild,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you\'re disappointed with your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" and I\'d love to help turn this around. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I\'ll be reaching out shortly to connect.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 8, 2018'}

column6: I really loved these leggings when I first got them. I loved the way they fit and how the material was sweat-wicking, the pockets make working out and listening to music so easy. However, about 2 months after I got them they started to pill along the seams and now they are pilling along the waist band. As much as I loved these leggings for the price I wish they had lasted longer before they started to pill.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey stephaniee,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I hear where you\'re coming from and your disappointment is completely justified. We\'re eager to work out a resolution, so I\'m sending you an email to chat more.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 8, 2018'}

column6: These leggings made me a Lulu customer for life. I had always purchased their leggings due to he fact that I thought the quality was substantially better than any other brand.. however, with other styles I always found something I didn't like. Not with these. The fabric is so amazing and comfy I want to live in these leggings. They don't attract lint. Fit is amazing. They haven't stretched out so far. Run TTS. Bottom line they're a bit pricey but so worth it. Lulu, please make these in more solid neutral colors or make more 7/8 leggings in Nulux material!

column5: Great tights for every activity, but a bit short
column6:
Love these tights - the waistline is snug and will stay up during runs or weight sessions. I like the cut on the bottom, and the pockets on the sides are a lifesaver.
My only complaint is that they only come in a 7/8 length. On tall girls, this is more like a 6/8 length, so not so cute. Please bring in some full-length options :)
Would definitely recommend.

The Fast and Free tights are hands down my favorite and best tights Lululemon has to offer. The tights have a moderate compression around the waistband and has a adjustable waist string to tighten during your runs. They are light weight and feel like a second skin. I wear these tights for yoga, strength and conditioning, everyday wear, and for running. The side pocket is a great feature especially when running to hold your phone. I am 5'2 and the length of the tights fit me perfectly so I don't have to get them hemmed. My only complaint about these tights is that darker colors will fade slightly and the light sheen will fade, but other than that I would recommend these tights to everyone.

Extremely disappointed with these pants. After wearing them twice and not washing them, they are pilling like I have never experienced before with lulu. I have been a long time customer of lulu and own many products and have never had an issue like this before. If I am going to spend that much money on a pair of pants I expect them to never do this. I guess the rumor about lululemon losing their quality is true.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey MeganP1,\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. I\'m bummed to hear of the pilling you\'re experiencing with our Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25", that definitely shouldn\'t be happening. To carry on this conversation, we\'ve sent you a follow up email. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 2, 2018'}

column6: I am a huge Lululemon fan but I had to right a negative review on these leggings. The fabric feels amazing and I love the fit but during my first workout they stretched out and became loose. I also purchase the Fast & Free Crop II *Nulux 19" and had the same experience.
column14: i love the high-waist and style
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey JJT532,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I hear your disappointment with the stretching you’ve noticed and I\'d love help turn it around. To carry on this conversation, I\'ve sent you a follow up email. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 2, 2018'}

column6:
I bought these leggings 5 months ago and LOVED them for the first few months. They were perfect for weight training, completely sweat proof and so so comfortable. After they hit the 3 month mark, these stretched out about 2 sizes!!!! I originally bought a 6 and thought that I may have lost muscle/fat, so i went to buy another pair in a size 4. These were way too tight, and the 6 just perfect. The leggings that I have are loose, especially around the waist and the little waistband elastic doesn't help either, its basically useless because if you tie it up its super visible. The leggings now fall down and sag on my butt because of the loose waistband, i have to constantly pull them up! also the pockets, which are so handy developed little hopes???I only ever put my phone in there so i don't understand how they can't withstand that.
Overall these leggings were really good for the first few months, but for the high price I expected them to last way longer than that! Now they're useless and i can't wear them to the gym, so thats $140 wasted for 3 months of good wear. Cheaper leggings last longer than this!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey vck0,\nThank you for taking the time to review the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". I completely understand why you\'re disappointed with this and I\'d love to help turn this around. Hang tight for an email coming your way! Talk soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'April 2, 2018'}

column6: These are a bit expensive but I had a gift card for part of it so I went for it - love these! I've only had them for a couple of weeks but I've worn quite a few times and they fit perfectly (and true to size) and wash perfectly so far. I got them in Hinshu Alpine White Multi - very cute and flattering. No zipper so I can wear to barre but pocket on the side so good for running too.

I bought these leggings a couple months ago and was at first very happy with them. But after a few weeks, they immediately disappointed me. There was piling and weird things kept happening to the fabric, including what seems to be piling by the calf area which makes no sense because there isn't chaffing there like there would be in the upper thigh area? When I tried to go back to the store and replace them, they insisted that I must have not followed the washing instructions which was completely untrue. Not only did I follow the very sensitive washing instructions, but I made sure to take care of them after putting so much money down. What happened to my leggings was completely unacceptable after a few weeks and for the amount of money I paid.
column14: the fit at the very beginning
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey emnicola,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts. It sounds like you've had a less-than-thrilling experience and I'd love to help! Keep your eye out for an email from us shortly -- chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'March 30, 2018'}

column6: I am a loyal Lulu customer, with more items purchased than I would like to admit. However, I purchased the "Fast and Free Tight" in Black and was not satisfied. The only real difference I could tell between these tights and the Wunder Under Crop (Hi-Rise) Full-On Luon 21"(other than the obvious --length etc.) is that these tights have a tighter waist and I am not pulling them up as much to stay on. However, the pants I purchased have 0 bells or whistles (AKA pockets etc.) and pill very easily. The fabric doesn't hold up well (pilling, feels cheaply made etc.) either. I would be willing to try the latest version that Lulu has released possibly, but the pair I have I do not wish to own. Overall, disappointing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Rachel009,\nThanks for taking the time to share this feedback. I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing pilling with your Fast & Free Tight. We stand behind our quality, and we’d like to work with you towards a solve. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 29, 2018'}

column6: Bought these in January and started wearing them late February. Before the first wash there was sagging and pilling. It wasn't as tight anymore. Handwashed it and air dried and there was still more pilling. The seams are also fraying and these leggings are only two months old. I paid a $150 including tax and it's disappointing to get this quality of product as a longtime buyer of Lululemon Love the pockets, high rise and the string for the waist
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ray14,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I\'m sorry to hear that you\'ve experienced pilling with your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'March 28, 2018'}

column5: Loving the pocket, not the fabric
column6: When I tried it on in the store, it felt good, very tight fitting in a good way and felt very light- in my mind it was perfect for running. The leggings started to stretch out mid workout, I'm not sure if this is because the sweatiness was stretching them out but I had to pull them up every few minutes. I also noticed a tiny hole in the seam but it is too bad because I didn't realize this until I already took the tags off and wore them to workout in....
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Celinerunner,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I\'m sorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" has stretched out. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'March 28, 2018'}

column5: Love the material, hate the tugging
column6: I tried an 8 in store per the store associate's suggestion, they felt great so I ordered them online later. They seem to fit when I received them, but they quickly became frustrating because I’m constantly pulling them up while I run. I love the color (army green), all the pockets and the material, but they're not feasible to run in. I recommend a size down if you purchase.

I loved these the minute I tried them on in store and they were great the first couple of wears. But after a couple months, they've stretched out in the weirdest ways across the bum, crotch and knee areas. The waistband is still tight but the bagginess of the rest of the pant makes them very uncomfortable to wear and work out in.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey GHenn,\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 27, 2018'}

column6: I've had these for two months, and at first I LOVED them and thought the extra money was justifiable. Now, two months later, they have lost their shape and begun to pill. These leggings now look baggy on me and unflattering. I have taken care of them the proper way and am so upset they have not lived up to the price...............
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Lunathelemon,\nOh no! We definitely hear your disappointment with the performance of your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25” and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions! Chat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'March 27, 2018'}

column5: Pants are piling near the butt and also stretching out
column6: I have had these pants for about 2-3 months. They are beginning to stretch out a lot and pill near the seams, mostly near my butt. These pants are designed for running and that is what I use them for, but it is hard to run when you have to keep pulling them up every 5 minutes. Also, I can't wear crop tops or just my sports bra with this due to the pilling getting more and more noticeable. I now only wear them to run errands with a really long shirt. The fabric, however, is very nice and feels good.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey magic7,\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We hear where you\'re coming from and I\'m sorry to hear your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" haven\'t held up for you as expected. I’ve sent you an email to follow up and help further, chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'March 26, 2018'}

column5: The pants that could and should but don't....
column6: I really wanted to love these pants. I tried them on in the store and fell in love with the fit. Then I used them in real time and the pants just stretched out in all the wrong places. I thought maybe it was just me and bought another pair because I honestly loved them so much and love the side pocket!! They're so useful. But it happened with the second pair too! Shame on me for buying two pairs that don't performance as advertised. I really do love that side pocket but it's not worth it when all I do is swim in them and constantly tug and pull just to keep them up.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Jadey,\nWe appreciate your feedback regarding the Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Oh no, I\'m sorry to hear both pairs aren\'t performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. We\'re eager to work out a resolution, so I\'m sending you an email to chat more.', 'LL_response_date': 'March 26, 2018'}

column6: Got these pants for Christmas, I loved them so much because my legs are so short and length fits perfect. The material of these pants are so soft and comfortable. These were my everyday wearing pants. However, they have got a small hole near the seam on the knee, noticeable so I cant wear them anymore. I am very disappointed.

When I tried it on in the store, it felt good, tight in the right places, and the material is very nice. The problem though is the leggings started to stretch out very quickly about thirty minutes into my workouts, and I found myself pulling them up every few minutes. Unfortunately, for the price they are not what I expected...

I love lululemon pants and have been wearing them for nearly 10 years. Most of my pants that I've bought over the years have held up wonderfully, but these have become baggy under my butt and seem to fall down. I was excited to try the Nulux fabric, but it doesn't seem to hold up as well as the other fabrics! Don't buy these - waste of money!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ElizabethL,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25" aren\'t up to the task. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'March 25, 2018'}

column6: I bought these pants with so much hope, they felt amazing and I could not wait to teach dance in them. The first times I wore them they were great and were my hands down favorite until I had to wash them a few times. I followed all of the directions and the fabric started to pill horribly in addition the seams started fuzzing and falling apart. I took them into the store and they redid my seems although my pants are horribly pilled taking away the amazing feel. In addition the seems have started to some un done again. I loved these pants at first and they were always my go to but since they pilled they lost a lot of their appeal. I think these pants are amazingly comfortable if you don't mind them pilling.

I've been eyeing these leggings for a while and finally decided to go and ahead and purchased them. As I was recommended, I bought these in my usual Lululemon size 4. I loved them so much the first time I put these on, I loved how they felt, looked, and most importantly I felt confident in these leggings. After a couple hours of wear they all of a sudden stretched out. During my workouts I'd have to pull keep pulling them up, and it started to look really unflattering on my body. It sagged and looked horrid in the crotch and butt area. Every-time I took a step to walk, the bagginess around the knee area and thighs in the back looked so bad. It's extremely disappointing as the cost was high for a product not able to reach it's full potential. If I'm going to spend a high price on leggings, I'd want it to fit my body as great as it can and not have to worry about pulling it up. I even had to wear a long workout short to cover my butt since the leggings looked that unflattering. I'm extremely disappointed as I spent so much on unflattering leggings.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey jea9runner,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 25, 2018'}

column6: I like almost everything about these pants, the feel, the support, the material, the look, except the fact that they pilled SO much and it's not just in one spot. They've pilled on the pockets, on the sides where there is no stitching, and in the crotch/butt area. I am very put off with the pilling on the side of my legs where there is no stitching. None of my other pairs of lulus have this issue. I've only worn them a few times so there should be no reason for all this pilling. For a very expensive pair of leggings I find this unacceptable.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hello yalla057,\n\nThanks for sharing your feedback. Since your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 isn't performing as intended, we'd love to learn more and make things right for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 23, 2018'}

column5: best lulu legging for short girls
column6:
I love these leggings for multiple reasons,
-they are thin / light, feel like 2nd skin
-not overly compressed but hold everything in place nicely
-the "raw" cut hem at the ankle makes it so that petite girls can wear this 7/8 legging without the hem looking weird.
i can't wear any of the other 7/8 leggings with the regular hem because they hit me slightly lower on my ankle and stick out funny , and regular length leggings at lulu bunch up at the bottom for me because they are to long.
the fabric feels amazing, i own 7 pairs of these and they are a regular staple in my daily wardrobe rotation.
for reference, i usually range from 121 - 124 pounds with athletic build and i buy a size 6. i feel i could get a 4 when I'm on the thinner side of my weight, but i don't like over tight clothing,

column5: Love the fabric- but the stitching pills
column6: they are a great functional run pant-- and even seem to work in the winter, they feel naked on the skin. My only complaint is the amount of pilling. :(

column5: I like these pants - they do good things for my butt
column6:
So firstly I am IN LOVE with this material. This is my first LLL purchase with the Nulux material and I am a big fan. It is swishy and kind of thick and super comfortable. I feel like the makeup of the material will help it not get snagged but I have not yet had long enough to say - will update this review if it does get pilly or snaggy super quick. These are super comfortable, and have a nice comfortable rise that DOESN'T RIDE DOWN! I have yet to do super high impact workouts in these but they are great for running, especially with the pockets.
Plus they make my bum look amazing! YAY!

I really wanted to love these leggings! I am a devoted Luon fabric girl, but recently tried the In Movement and Align II leggings and loved the other fabrics! The Aligns snag and pill super easy - sad because soooo comfy! I love the In Movements, but thought I'd give the Fast and Free a go since the sales person said they have the next to nothing feel, which I loved about the Aligns. I just bought them yesterday in the new super dark purple color (forget the actual name) and worked out in them this morning, only to hear a friend comment on the sheerness! Yes in deed, I checked in the mirror and they are quite sheer! I also notice some weird sheerness on the thighs, too. Bought my correct size, too. I guess for $128 plus tax, I am definitely not impressed. As others have noted, they don't seem to hold their shape, either! I think I'll stick to the In Movements! More colors of those please! The feel of the fabric is nice, however.

These are my favorite pants because they feel like a second skin and breathe so well. They feel so light and are absolutely comfortable. If sweat or water drip onto them, they will leave a dark spot. And I noticed when wearing longer cotton based shirts, the pants will start fraying in that area. Regardless, I bought my usual size 4. I'm looking forward to collecting more because of how comfortable they are.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi FitBodyBetterLife,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Give us a call at our Guest Education Center (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'April 3, 2018'}

column6: Those pants are perfect for running and work out.

I first purchased these leggings a size up (im usually in between 2 lulu sizes) but had to return them after a month because they stretched out so much they were sliding off during yoga! Luckily, lulu has GREAT customer service and happily issued me a refund. I was so excited to order these a size smaller to accommodate the stretch and when they arrived I (luckily) put them on, walked around, and tested the squat in multiple lighting levels and I was so upset to see that they were completely sheer across my butt in a squat! I wanted to love these because the material is so soft and the pockets are amazing and the seams are perfect for us muscular gals, but these just won't be my leggings. I'll be going back to my trusty in movements instead- just waiting for them to restock my size in colors! DON'T BUY!

We're eager to work out a resolution, so I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 20, 2018'}

column5: Disappointed w lulu this time around
column6: My main reason for buying lululemon is because I do hot yoga and I love their fabric for wicking the mass amounts of sweat I produce and because they stay tight even when wet with sweat. This pair of pants, however, has left me very disappointed, esp because its one of their more expensive pants. When I tried these on in the store, the size 6 fit me perfectly, nice and tight everywhere. After my first work out with them, however, they began to majorly sag in the crotch area and are now also loose in the butt and in the knees (which is an awful look!). Now even after washing them again, they are still loose even before I begin my workout. It really is too bad because i LOVE the fabric of these pants but I would not recommend them if you like your pants staying tight on your legs, butt and groin area throughout your workout.

Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'March 20, 2018'}

column6: My sister and I tried these pants in the shop and we loved the pants so much that we couldn't wait for new colors to be available in the shop. They are perfect for running. We also love the side pockets, the quick-drying thing, and the naked felling when you wear them. However, after few weeks of having them, they starts to fray. We might have to rethink getting new colors of the fast and free pants.

We stand behind the quality of our gear and I will be in touch via email to dig into this with you!\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 21, 2018'}

column6: I tried these leggings on in a store and loved how they felt and fit! I put them on the day I bought them and within three hours, the seams started fraying. I know that these are my size so I'm thinking maybe it's from my knees touching? Other than that, they are great leggings that stay up and are a nice material.

column6: I really liked these when I first put them on, but after I wore them for the first time and went to the gym they completely stretched out at the waist band and felt loose around the butt area. I'm very disappointed because I thought these would be perfect for the price I had to pay ): I would like to exchange them for a different pair!
column15: lost its tightness after one wear
