column6: I really love lu lu lemon products because of the quality and perfect fit. I splurged on this pair of tights for running, and was really disappointed to find within a couple minutes of jogging, the crotch was sagging a few inches. I have to keep hiking them up! An annoying distraction while I'm running. I didn't find tightening the drawstring waist to help at all. I got my usual size, they seem to fit great, other than the sagging crotch. I would not recommend these---more than annoying to have to keep pulling them up. This is unfortunately the second pair of running tights from lu lu that I have had this happen with.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Tjogger,\nOh dear! I'm sorry to read of your experience. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a fix. An email has been sent with additional information.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 19, 2018'}

column6: I bought these leggings in a size 4, my usual size for everything lululemon (5'4" & 115lb). I chose Hinshu Alpine White Multi as my color, but I was unaware that this pattern had a white base. That means that any time the pattern stretches or pulls, the pattern becomes white and faded. As a long term lululemon wearer, I've learned to do the "bend in front of the mirror" tricks and sure enough, these leggings failed! They feel so smooth and comfortable on, but not worth looking like youre wearing pants 2 sizes too small or seeing any private areas.
column19:
{'LL_response_content': "Dear doctorfit,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear your pants are fading, and that the coverage of the pant is not holding up. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

Thanks,
Mark", 'LL_response_date': 'March 18, 2018'}

column6: The nulux material feels very cold, thin and I feel like wearing swimwear when I put it on. Another problem for me is that it doesn't fit very well on top of the thighs near the crotch area.

I LOVE these leggings!! I exercise almost every day.. mostly running and lifting. What I love most about these pants is how soft they are. They ARE sweat wicking! I can get away with wearing them more than once before washing. The length is perfect (I am 5'3" and wear a size 4 in Lulu). The pockets are great and I feel like I never have to adjust the waist band. I really wish Lulu would make more solid colors in this pant or re-stock their online availability! I have been checking online for a few months since I bought them in store in the black. They do have other color options in the Fast & Free 19" crop, but I prefer the full length because 19" sometimes rise up around my knees when I run.

I've had these tights for about a month now and the seems are getting snags! At first I thought I was just running into things so I started to be more careful but then it just kept happening! I feel like they are falling apart. I love the way they look and fit! But I feel like I cant wear them anywhere without making the seems worse. NOT worth the price.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Margotylvi,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a fix for you. I'm sending you an email to chat more. Speak soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'March 19, 2018'}

column5: Loved them (at first), now can't even wear them :(
column6: I own about 10 pairs of lulu workout pants, all size 8. Bought these in an 8 (6 seemed to tight in store), and for the first few workouts, they were life-changing. They fit great, they stayed up while running (unlike how the wunder unders are sometimes falling down on me), and I loved the fabric. Then it seems they started to really stretch out. I had not needed to use the waist cinch cord at all before, and all the sudden I basically had to pull it as tight as it goes! I have to pull them way higher up and keep pulling at the legs while running, and even when I first put them on, they are baggy in places. I am SO disappointed, especially since these are the most expensive pants I've ever purchased at Lulu, and after about 4 wears they just sit sadly in the drawer.
column15: stretched out a lot after a few wears
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi DBPhilly,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux. I can completely understand why you're disappointed with this. column5: Love these crops but want the pants in Evergreen!
column6: I love the crops of these but would love the pants even more in the Evergreen color. I bought a pair of speed up crops in a teal color but the compression on those are just too tight. I went to the store and they had just got in the fast and free in the Evergreen in the crop and love them. Could we please make the pants in Evergreen or Dark Olive? I have been looking for a pair of green running leggings with pockets but I didn't want such tight compression fabric these would be perfect!

This was my first lulu lemon leggings so I washed it specifically as stated. Its very expensive so I didn't want to ruin it. After about a month of wearing, the fabric starting to stretch and I'm sure its not my fault. I expected a better quality legging since I did pay $140 (incl tax).

column5: Most deceiving pair of lululemon leggings
column6: I have had my Fast and Free Tights for about 5 months, and I have already had to get the seemed restitched once, and the seams down lower are needing to be restitched as well. I do not expect that almost a $150 pair of leggings will need to be restitched twice. The lululemon in my town is also quite difficult to get to for a student with limited amount of time. They also have piling on the anterior part of the thigh, accompanied by major pilling of the fabric in the crotch. I am not pleased with these leggings. Not to mention I can only usually get one wear out of them as they do not hold their shape well.

column6:
I am a first time Lulu buyer and was excited to take the plunge and see if Lulu really was worth all the rage....
I purchased 4 items to try out: 2 pairs of leggings and 2 pairs of joggers.
For the leggings I chose the "In Movement" and the "Fast & Free"leggings.
I quickly became disappointed in the "In Movement" pair as the fabric attracts anything and everything, so i stopped wearing those quickly.
On the contrary, I fell in love with the with the "Fast & Free". They were by far the best leggings I have ever worn. Sadly, several month's after wearing and taking care of them per Lulu Lemons care instructions, the fabric is pilling and the seams are very worn. In addition to this, they have stretched out in multiple areas.
All in, these leggings cost me around $140. That is a hefty price to pay for leggings that don't hold up after several months.
Super disappointed as I would have forked out endless money to own many, many, many more pairs of this legging I fell in love with.

I really really love these pants but for the price, the quality is very disappointing.

I first tried these on in store and LOVED them. The fabric the fit, the seams, the unfinished hem- loved it all! Happily handed over $130 for them. Wore them for a week and loved them so much I went back to buy a second pair!
Here I am about a month or so later- a wasted (almost) $300. They are sagging so much. I wash them exactly as instructed (over $100 for leggings you want them to last!)and haven't lost any weight. They are terrible now. I'm in a workout class pulling up my leggings every five minutes. The elastic drawstring at the waist does nothing. There is sagging all through the knees and really down the whole leg and it's very very annoying
I wanted to love these and did so much, now I'm just disappointed and sad that my dream leggings are a nightmare.

They stretch out and fall down during plyo workouts, running and aerobics (not the end of the world, they have a drawstring). For reference, I'm 150lbs, athletic build and I bought a size 8.

I have always loved the pants here because they are so comfortable but now I am stuck with these expensive pants that I am disappointed with and don't even want to wear anymore.

I got these leggings for my birthday and I love how they fit me perfect and the pockets and everything, except the seams are starting to pill after a few wears and i haven't even washed them yet :( makes me so sad because theyre my favorite tights... idk what to do.

column5: Looks and feels great, but material doesn't justify the price
column6: I love how these were designed, the side pockets are brilliant and the reflective details are a nice touch. They fit like a second skin and I feel confident wearing them. The only disappointment for me was that just under a week of wearing them to and from class, they have already started to pill at and around the seams. column6: I finally broke down and bought a pair of lululemons. I was very skeptical about the price and what I was getting for it. However when I first tried these on they were amazing and the sales lady kept telling me that they were Lulu's and they will last longer then any other yoga's I have. Which I didn't disagree with until recently. Sadly my favorite pair of Lulu's are badly pilling on the left hip after about a year. Which is really strange because they are not even pilling between the legs yet. I have always washed them inside out, by themselves on delicate and hung them to dry. I have heard of them pilling in between the legs but never on the hip. Is the longevity of this brand only a year?

Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. column6: I have been a Lulu addict for years and recently, I've been extremely disappointed with the decline in LuluLemon's quality. However, these leggings are undoubtedly the best leggings LuluLemon offers. I have tried legitimately every single staple Lululemon legging: All the Right Places, Align, Wunder Under Luon and Luxtreme, etc. and these ones take the cake. These leggings are made for every single exercise you can imagine. I have done Spin classes, yoga classes, weight training, HIIT circuits, running, and Pilates classes and these leggings have held up so well! I'm a sweaty monster and these pants actually wick away the sweat from all of my workouts pretty well. One of my absolute favorite features is the number of pockets these pants have; I can put my keys, wallet, phone, and pretty much everything in all of the pockets these pants offer. The only cons I have noticed so far are the general thinness of the pants material, slight pilling along the waist band, and the overall cost of these pants. These pants are definitely a mix of the Aligns and All the Right Places Pants/Luxtreme material. The pants have the durability and sweat-wicking of the Luxtreme and the thin/almost-naked sensation of the Aligns. Unfortunately, these pants are thin, scarily thin. I've had problems with previous LuluLemon leggings randomly popping holes in extremely unfortunate areas (Inspire leggings and extremely mortifying crotch legging) and due to the thinness of the material, I am worried every single time I open my legs that another random hole might pop up. As for the pilling along the waistband, I understand it's pretty difficult for any clothing company to fight the pill, so I'm not exactly surprised that my pants have started pilling after 3-4 months. Additionally, the waistband is starting to wear out a bit, along with the fabric along the legs. One thing I wish Lululemon could adjust is the price. I understand that these are probably the best, most functional leggings Lulu can produce, but $128?! It's incredibly expensive and made me hesitate when buying my first pair and question buying a second pair. However, regardless of the cost, slight pilling, and thin fabric, these are THE best Lululemon leggings you could buy right now if you do more than just yoga and lounge in your leggings!

I love everything about these tights: fit, material, look. They even make me look slimmer. I wear them everywhere from running, teaching/practicing martial arts, yoga, cross fit training, to the store, or just relaxing ... The only thing I would suggest is to make more plain, basic colors. All other prints are a bit too much.
I am 5'3", 118 lbs and size 4 fits me perfectly

These are by far my favorite pair of leggings that I have ever owned the fabric is thin but not even close to ever being see thru wearing these pants is basically like being naked. I can't wait for there to be more colors/prints available.

Even though these are 30 dollars more than most other Lulu leggings, I selected this pair because the woman working at the store told me that the Nulux is the most low-maintenance fabric, and also: POCKETS! The pockets are absolutely wonderful and from what I can tell, they are so much more spacious than the pockets in the Speed Up tight. I have placed my keys, phone charger, and phone in these pockets simultaneously and they have yet to stretch out. The side pockets fit literally everything which makes the leggings so much more convenient. I am aware that there are three pockets in the back of the waistband but I haven't found any use for them so far. The day after I got the leggings, I wore them with my knee-high Hunter boots, and found that on my right leg below my knee (where the boots go up to), the fabric had become, for lack of a better word, fuzzy. Additionally, within a few days I noticed that some of the seams on the back of my left calf were unraveling, but I just trimmed them with scissors. I accidentally washed and machine-dried them with all of my other, non-athletic clothes, and was worried that they would be ruined, but was delighted to find that they remained intact. Ever since, I've been washing them normally with my everyday clothes and I have experienced no issues with the leggings. Side note: they definitely "mold" to your body; I am 130lb 5'4" with 27" waist and I got a size 2. They were originally very difficult to put on but since have become easier. Overall would buy again!

column5: SO many positives to outweigh the negative
column6: These pants are so flattering, feel beautiful and have great compression while being comfortable. However, I have purchased two pairs now and both pairs, the seam has come unravelled in different places. They still feel awesome and look great but every time I look down the stray thread drives me crazy. Thank god Lulu has great customer service :)
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey sweatinginNWO,\n\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us! We\'re so happy to hear that you love the fit and fabric of your Fast & Free Tight 7/8 II *Nulux 25". Keep in mind that our local stores offer complimentary hemming and seam repairs, so reach out to chat with them if you need! You can also give us a call or jump on our Live Chat with any questions.', 'LL_response_date': 'March 5, 2018'}

column6: Have purchased several pairs. But the last printed version I purchased have seams that are coming apart and have pilling on the butt seams as well. Not attractive. Fit great and love the fabric. Just not happy with the quality of this pair.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey KMR4405,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'March 4, 2018'}

column6: I've gotten some good use out of these pants and haven't had any issues with them. I love how comfy they are, they're snug (how they should fit) without being too tight or uncomfortable. Plus, I love the pockets - I've even put my phone in there a few times and ended up forgetting it was there because the pants are so comfortable. I'm 5'5 and 140 lbs, and I usually wear 6 or 8 and the 6 fit great.

Well at the beginning I loved these tights, now not so much. The seams have started to come apart on the legs in multiple areas & random pilling has started on the butt & certain leg areas. These tights also seem to stretch out quite a bit and tend to not stay in place as well as I hoped, I purchased TTS (size 4) and find that I'm constantly pulling them up. Overall not too happy with the quality since the price tag is so high.

My only complaint is that the stitching is fraying down the leg in a spot and now I fear that it will totally unravel which makes them on borrowed time. I hope that's not the case for the price I paid. They are a second skin and keep cool during HIIT workouts and runs. They do tend to want to fall down but that's what the draw string is for.

column6: I love these! I have had my black pair for about a year. I'm not really sure how there are bad reviews...They don't stretch out, they haven't pilled, they're lightweight, the seams have not come apart. It's really important to make sure you're wearing the correct size in these pants. They are by far my favorite pair of bottoms from Lululemon. For reference, I wear a size 4 in both bottoms and tops; 5'3" and weigh 115 lbs. PLEASE make more basic colors like True Navy, Grey, Wee Are From Space Nimbus. I will buy all of them!!

column5: Like the fast & free, not the best though!
column6: I have these in black & the new red floral print, both in size 6 - I am 5'6, 150lbs, 28" waist 38" hips and slightly larger/more muscular on bottom than on top. I tried the city lights print and it faded weirdly on curvier areas and just wasn't as flattering. The black is nice and makes my butt look good; I also appreciate the large pockets! However, the seams on my black pair are starting to fray which is not a good sign. The Nulux is nice, thin, and feels weightless - perfect for hot workouts etc, but it does show sweat stains (less noticeable in black). I tried the bright blue shade & it showed all my imperfections so avoid if you have stuff you wanna hide ;) I recently ordered the red floral print and the fabric actually feels a lot different, less "slippery" and I didn't like it until I put them on - they are GORGEOUS. The print doesn't sheer when I bend my knees or squat, they are totally squat proof, and the red is beautiful in person. All in all, I'm done buying more colors of these, will see how the seam issue holds up with the black pair before dropping $128 on another pair - not sure they are totally worth the money yet!
i have had these pants for maybe a month they are already pilling on the bum and legs and the waist band has stretched out

column5: These pants are my new obsession.
column6: A friend recommended these to me a while ago and I am so glad I finally purchased them! They are somehow extremely thin but I also feel like they do a bit of compressive work. Super flattering. They pass the squat test! And they have a zillion pockets. Buy these pants! For reference, I am 5'2", 125lbs, wear a 6 in all my other lulu pants, and got these in a 6 as well. The waist is a smidge loose but the inner drawstring solves that issue.

Got these tights as a birthday present + instantly LOVED them [so much that I bought them in the cropped + convinced my mom to get them!] They were the most comfortable tights that I owned! Fast forward a few months and the seams are unraveling, there's a hole in one of the pockets, and there's pilling all over.
My 7/8 tights were the only ones in this condition too [my cropped + my mom's were still like new!] so I take them to the store and without the manager, all they can do is depill them. This makes them better but still not great so I take them back again and the manager tells me that all she can do is have them re-seamed and everything else wasn't a "quality issue" even though my cropped ones + my mom's 7/8s still look like new! I'd say that the fact that they were falling apart is a huge quality issue!
The tights were a huge disappointment + the customer service was even worse!

I received these as a gift. Liked them so much I order several more, both long and cropped. Hadn't seen the reviews about holes and unraveling seams before ordering, so I kept my fingers crossed that I wouldn't have these problems. So far I have had no problems. They are very comfortable, provide great support, and come in lots of fun patterns and colors. They are a bit pricey, but so far, I am very happy with my purchase.

Though these are extremely comfy and feel like second skin, they should not be worn for any physical activity except for lounging around or doing errands. After multiple washes and perfect wear, the third time I've worn them they have unravelled and created a hole in one of the seams; which is unfortunate since they are almost $130. I have two leggings and will not be buying anymore.

column6:
When I first tried on the Fast & Free tight, I was a bit hesitant to invest. They're a substantially thinner material than what I'm used to and they're a bit pricier than my normal lulu tights. After chatting with one of the Educators, she assured me the tights were fantastic for crossfit and would change my workouts. My first time wearing them I was terrified they would be see-through, but once I got used to the material I loved how light weight the tights were.
I got my tights in December and by mid-January I noticed they had already begun to wear out. The tights seemed thinner than before and the material seemed to get looser and stretch out. I was shocked at how the material changed after only a month of wear. Although they were not what they used to be I still wore them on rotation with my other tights and took proper care of them.
This past week I was devastated when I was asked by one of my friends in class how my tights ripped. I realized the knee of my tight had a small hole that ripped open. I don't know when in my workout it happened, but I'm so upset that these tights couldn't last through a standard WOD like my other gear. What I love about all of my other lulu tights is how durable they are, I've never had to think twice about them, but these tights ripping within three months of purchase was so upsetting.
DO NOT buy these tights if you do any kind of high impact training. If they can't last through a crossfit WOD, I can't imagine how these would last through a longer workout. I feel like I just wasted $130 that I could have put towards more durable gear. I wear strictly lulu in the gym, and I love the quality of my gear, but these aren't even minimally comparable. I can't wear these tights in the gym anymore because I'm worried the rip will get bigger. Lulu, you need to fix the design of these, and don't encourage your Educators to recommend gear for something they can't withstand.
What a let down.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey lulucf,\nThanks for sharing your experience with the Fast & Free Tight II. I'm sorry to hear about the hole in your gear and I'd love to help you find a resolution. I've sent an email your way so we can chat!", 'LL_response_date': 'February 19, 2018'}

column6: I bought these in black about 2 months ago and wear them all the time! I'm currently training for a half marathon and these don't slip down my waist at all when I run unlike many other leggings. I was worried about pilling but one of the ladies at the store recommended washing these only with other spandex-like clothes and my hotty hot shorts (no cotton!) to prevent pilling. So far that's been working great and I have no pilling. Bring back the midnight navy color please!

These pair of leggings are perfect for long runs and are one of my favorite leggings from lululemon. The fit and feel of these leggings are amazing because it is basically just second skin! However the quality of the leggings do not seem to last long, which is pretty upsetting. After my second wear I noticed that they were already pilling at my ankles, which is very odd. The leggings are definitely an investment but I am afraid that the longevity is disappointing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey cat1321,\nThank you for connecting with us. I'm sorry to hear your gear has started pilling at the ankles. I can understand your disappointment and would love to help. We'll be in touch via email to follow up and offer some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'February 17, 2018'}

column6: I LOVE these tights. I have acquired 6 pairs and they are my most worn tights for CrossFit. Fit is perfect, the pockets are SO handy and the material performs so well, I barely get hotter in these than shorts.

I bought these pants in black and then navy because I loved them so much. I was just getting back into working out after a little hiatus. I used to be a lulu-extremist but over the last few years, I stopped due to the change in material that did not entice me. These pants are unlike the luon Lululemon pants. I wouldn't describe the material as buttery which I reserve for the Align pants, but find these pants to be more like slippery (Sort of how shiny pants are slippery- these pants are not shiny though!!). They do not slip off when wearing them, just when you run your hands over them there is less friction. When I started training again, I was a size 6 in these pants and what I love about them is that they are high-waisted and have a drawstring. I need high-waisted workout pants or I find they start to fall down. Additionally, the drawstring allows me to continue to workout and train in these pants even though my size has shrunk! This is fantastic when you are spending 140 on a pair of pants. I also find that these are perfect for working out because they do not pill. I have been consistently working out in these pants for 6 months and not one issue with the material or seams. I think this is in part due to the more slippery texture, it resists the friction that causes pilling. I also find that these pants let your body breath and do not feel restricting; something I really hate. Lastly, as a dog owner, a big problem I have with leggings or workout pants is dog hair sticking. Again because of the different material my dog's hair does not stick. This makes my life so much easier. When I need to workout and these lulus are still hanging to dry (following the washing instructions is important to the longevity of any of my Lulu-pants), I dread working out in my other workout pants. These are just the best, the best feel, the best quality, the best mobility, and they give me the best workouts.

I'm a pretty loyal lulu shopper. Half of my closet is just lulu gear. And I had heard about quality issues before, but had never really experienced it myself, beyond just the stretching and regular wear and tear that comes with continuous use. But I've never experienced anything like this before, both in the quality of the tights, and in the customer service policy surrounding them.
The first time I wore them, I noticed that a seam on the pocket coming apart. I took them to the store to see if I can get them exchanged, only to find out that the colour that I bought is no longer sold (part of the reason I had purchased these tights was because of the very pretty colour). Even though I was within the return period, because I had taken off the tag, I was not allowed to get my money back or even a gift card to the store. The only options I was given was to have it taken to a tailor for repair or choose something from the store right then and there to exchange for it.
I chose to get the tights repaired. When I got them back, it looked ok. The seam that was resewn was a lot thicker than the original and looked kind of clunky, but I let it go, because I didn't want to deal with it anymore. I've worn the tights only a couple of times since, and I notice that the seam on the inside of the calf is also starting to come apart.
It's just frustrating to deal with these issues with a pair of $140 leggings. It's also disappointing that there's isn't any accommodation for a refund or at least store credit when there is clearly a major quality issue with the leggings. This experience has kind of put me off lulu.
So beware. They may feel nice and super comfy, but they'll start falling apart in no time and lulu's policies may not be all that helpful.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Heartly,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast And Free Tights aren't holding up for you. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'February 15, 2018'}

column6: Decided to splurge on these pants. They feel incredible. The material is butter soft. By far the most comfortable Lulu pant I own. I wear them for everything - they are amazing for working out but also so comfortable for wearing around the house and out for errands. I stuck with my regular size in this fabric. Absolutely perfect. I will definitely buy another!

My first wear I was totally in love with with these. As soon as I washed them (inside out, on cold, delicate) the seams started to pill. so annoying! I am very careful with my clothes and seeing this happen after 2 wears is really disappointing. This is not my first time this has happened either. The seams are pilly and fraying.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey RileyNowacki,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'February 14, 2018'}

column6: I loved these leggings when I first bought them... about a month after I wore them and only washed them a few times (and I didn't even dry them) they began to pill and become very very thin in the places that would rub up against my body. I was very disappointed in the quality in comparison to the price.

Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'February 14, 2018'}

column6:
The good things first ... I LOVE THE FIT! The fit is amazing and I am so in love with the pockets! The side pockets fit my huge iPhone8+ which is amazing! And I can jump, run, etc with it and it does not fall off. And there are so many pockets to keep your cash, keys, credit card with you. It hugs me in all the right places and fits true to size as well. Great for working out in and even lounging around. The length is perfect and I love the high rise, it keeps everything in place all the time!
BUT after wearing it to Crossfit twice and one wash (I followed the care instructions very closely and I always handle my Lululemon with care as I have always been) .... the side seams around the quads are pilling so badly! One wash! Also, the fabric around the quads are pilling and looks scuffed up for no reason! I was hoping that this pair will last me a long time like all my other Lululemons. I've had 5 other Lululemon pants and they've held up really good even after two years of heavy use (I workout pretty much everyday). And this pair was like $130! The quality is very disappointing! I had high hopes for this one because I love the fit so so much! Was thinking of getting two more pairs in these but not anymore :( Boo ...

I bought them less than a year ago and they are pilling so much in the inner thigh area. Because of the pilling it looks like a hole will break through any minute now. So bummed because these felt amazing and were my favorite, hope they make these in a more durable quality.

Maybe I've just worn them to death, but I expected these to have a longer life-time for the higher cost.

I really do not understand why these pants cost me $138, they are definitely not worth that price.

column6: These are the best! The material feels amazing and like you're not wearing anything. It's so soft and smooth. I got both the full length version and the crop...I must say I like the full length the best as the crop hits me a bit shorter than the other crops so tends to ride up. The full length are perfect though! Hoping to come back for a second pair.

Haven't purchased a pair of lulu pants for a while. I love that my old ones kept their shape and kept my butt looking good. That's why I was so excited to get these and willing to pay $138 for one pair of pants. Those specific features. I have only worn the pants for ONE day and they have already streched out!! It is unbelievable. At the end of the day there were extra saggy wrinkles around my bottom and at my knees. I got a size 4 (my old pants were size 6 - and my weight/physique is the same). The fabric feels cheap, my underwear line is clearly visible, and the bottom looks like it will fray at any moment. I went online to see if I was losing it, but see a number of reviews say the same thing. I tried to find any running pants that had a 5 star rating and I am still looking. This makes me very sad. Lulu please bring back quality!

For the price of this legging, the quality absolutely sucks. Very disappointed.

column6: I bought these pants from the suggestion of another runner. I was looking for pants I could run in outdoors. I really prefer shorts, but it's freezing here in the south right now. These are NOT warm, so don't buy them if you're wanting to stay warm outdoors, BUT they are the perfect pant for what I was wanting. I love the smooth, yet "held in" material and how it feels like nothing is there and they stay in place. They are quick dry and I never felt "sweaty" in them. I love them so much I came back and purchased this same style in the crops.

Nulux is my favorite fabric! I despised running in pants until I found these bad boys. I use them for distance running anywhere from 4 to 15+ miles. The pockets are great for phone storage when lifting or walking, but I would not suggest for running. This is my second pair of LLL Nulux pants and (knock on wood) I haven't had a problem with them stretching out. I try to be good about washing without fabric softener and letting them air dry, but... I've messed that up a few times and haven't noticed a problem. I'm 5'6 and 150 lbs and purchased the size 8.
These leggings are my first pair from lululemon. The material has a very very light feeling and breathable. (P.S. I sweat a lot!!!) They keep me dry fast. The downside is they stretch out.

I wash and dry these and I have had my first pair for over a year and they are just fine.

When I first got these pants I loved them. They fit perfectly. After only three wears (low intensity workouts) and two washes (air dried both times), these pants have stretched out way too much. I usually do not review products after only wearing them three times, but it is really annoying that it happened so soon considering how much they cost. column6: I am very disappointed because the Fast and Frees are my favorite leggings. However, I am very disappointed with the quality and service from Lulu. I bought two pairs a month back for the first time and fell in love. The next day, I saw a thread pull in one of them while wearing them. Took them to lulu and had them repaired. I JUST picked up the pair yesterday and the repair job is so sloppy and the thread is loose and is pulling all over again!!! I also just noticed the thread on my waist band of my other pair is also loose! I called lulu and nobody answers even though the shop is open. I'm very frustrated. Lululemon is supposed to be top quality and I paid a significant amount of money on two pairs of pants that keeps pulling. I wash them accordingly and handle with care. Very frustrated with the quality and service right now.

column5: They'll suck you in and you won't feel a thing
column6:
I got these for myself for Christmas, and wish there were more cuter colors that are less bold because I love the buttery feel and tight compression fit of these so much! They hug my legs just right and I don't even feel like I'm wearing anything when working it!
My training style tends to be very high intensity, strength based, so it is important for me to find leggings that have pockets for my phone and a pair that DOES NOT slide down when I sprint.
They can make any bloated day feel lighter!
One thing though: I feel like they kind of maybe shrunk a bit in length in the wash, and I hand wash all my Lulu lemons! I used to have to roll them up a bit because I'm tiny but now they are naturally 7/8 on me..?

I want to love these, I actually bought 2 pairs within 2 weeks because I loved them so much and then after wearing the second pair for 2 days (in the house mind you!!) there is a small hole! Maybe I bought them like that and didn't notice the first day, but they should not rip after not even working out in them yet. The fabric is so nice and soft, but maybe too soft if they can rip so easily.

It alway just goes back to the original setting, but otherwise I really like these pants.

I purchased these in store and they were recommended to me by one of the staff when I mentioned I was looking for pants for Orangetheory classes. I purchased them, despite the high price tag, since they came so highly recommend and fit the way I like. I used these pants for two classes and they already have a hole in them. Needless to say, I’m wildly unimpressed. This was a first purchase at lulu and the quality of the fabric does not remotely justify the price tag. column6: I loved these tights the first time I wore them. However, after ONE wash, the seams started pilling in two different places. As much as I love these leggings, they are not worth the money.

column6: Received these pants for Christmas this year and these are now my go to leggings for running. They were recommended by an employee and I'm very grateful because my other Lulu leggings kept falling down on me. I haven't had the same issues other reviewers have had with piling or seams...I wash these on a weekly basis too. In addition to running, I do a lot of indoor rock climbing and these hold up on those walls.

These leggings really do feel like a second skin and are so comfortable to work out in. While running I do sometimes have to pull them up a bit, but once I get a little sweaty they do not move. I have not had the fraying problems that other people in the reviews have had and I've washed them several times (with other non-cotton athletic clothing, no dryer sheet). My one small drawback with this particular color (Stony Grape) when I get realllllly sweaty (my workouts are half cardio half lifting/rowing) is that it shows around the seams in the areas you don't want people seeing that you're sweating. I also love the 7/8 length. I will absolutely buy more of these, probably in darker colors.

These pants are amazing for working out, they wick moisture away to ensure you feel dry throughout your entire workout. They are so soft and lightweight, and fit quite tight so pull everything in. I do not find them as comfy for every day wear as they are quite tight around the waist, but definitely the PERFECT workout pant.

I have 5 pair of these leggings, two with patterns are fraying above the butt right on the seam. Its so disappointing I'm afraid to wash them so I can't wear them anymore.
They are too expensive to be fraying after 1-2 wears.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey AutumnLulu,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 31, 2018'}

column6: I fell in love with these tights in the store. Paying over $100 for a pair of tights is a stretch for me, but these were so buttery soft and comfortable I justified the price tag. I love wearing them, they are honestly the most comfortable pants I've ever worn. I was so disappointed when I noticed the seams started pilling after only 2 washes. For "active wear" that is meant to be worn to work out in, so obviously washed a lot, I would expect them to hold up better, especially for the price tag.
column15: they did not hold up after only 2 washes
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey mommarunner,\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Pilling is definitely not what we like to hear, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 31, 2018'}

column6: These are by far the best pants I've ever owned from Lululemon! I tend not to love tights with the waist drawcord (I find I'm constantly pulling them up during my workouts), however these are a game changer. These are my favourite pair of leggings to wear during cardio workouts. The waist height is very flattering and the material is very smooth. They have a way of combining the 'naked' feel yet make me supported all at the same time. I've never owned a pair of leggings with pockets like these, but now when I wear leggings without them I don't feel complete. For reference, I'm 5'5" and 140 lbs with athletic thighs. I bought these in my regular size 6 and they're a perfect fit. I have them in black and I intend on buying more colours.

Don't get me wrong, like most of us, I LIVE in lulu. Leggings are actually a part of my work uniform, so certain leggings I purchase I dedicate strictly to working in so they stay nice. I recently purchased these tights for work and they already have TWO HOLES in them. I just do not understand. The first tear I noticed after one wear, so I took them back to the store and they told me "that will happen" and they put a big patch on it. Now with another hole, I am just at a loss for words. Why spend so much money on a product that does not last? Not sure how anyone could dance or workout in these if they don't last walking around a store...
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey em523,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 30, 2018'}

column6: I really love the way these leggings feel! They're so cooling and smooth on my skin. However, the seams started fraying after two washes and I feel like the leggings themselves have stretched out a bit. Unfortunate since I love them so much.

I decided to ignore all the reviews about these leggings because they just felt so perfect. I am actually up to 4 pair now. I've been noticing some slight pilling for a while, but all of the sudden, it has gotten dramatically worse. I am super disappointed. I wish I hadn't purchased 3 more pairs. I hand wash all of my Lulu gear and would not expect this type of wear and tear after having such a short time. Too bad...

column6: I would call myself a collector of workout leggings and love many high end brands. These are one of my favorite leggings. I love them because they stay put but are SO light. The material is amazing and keeps me from overheating in intense spin classes! They are so comfortable I don't pull them immediately off after a workout! I can't wait to see the spring colors they have in these. The capris in this style really rolled up and I didn't like them as much but these are perfect!

Think I might have an older version of these, but regardless be very careful about sizing. I have a pair of the Wunder Under in 8 that I adore, but these were a sizing disaster. They keep slipping from my waist so that the crotch sags awkwardly. Plus, the waistband keeps rolling. Wish someone would have warned me about sizing down.

These pants are so see thru!!! On top of that, when I first opened the package the pants were dirty! They had dust marks in three different places. After cleaning them off and putting them on someone came up to me and told me they were completely see thru! These are my sixth pair of lulus and I'm really disappointed. Never had this happen in the past. I don't have a lulu where I am so its now a gamble, ill probably just stick to the wunder under to play it safe.

column6: I love these pants. I have been wearing Lulu for years, and these pants are my favourite to date. Awesome for running, strength training, etc. The material is amazing & fabulous for movement. I have 3 pairs right now & will most likely buy more. Please come up with some new colours/patterns. True to size, I wear a 6 in Lulu & they fit perfect.

Ok I never leave reviews on stuff but I really had to share how much I love these pants. If you are a runner especially, these pants are so nice. The name is so fitting, I feel fast and free! Nice job on these lulu.

column5: super soft but pill after few washes
column6: This was my first pair of lululemon leggings. I have many of the other pants including the "on the fly" pants as well as some others that are now discontinued and love them all. I decided to size up from my regular size 4 to a 6 with the leggings. Which was a good choice. I love the pockets and the placement of everything on the leggings are very flattering. I am very disappointed that only after a few washes, they are pilling on every seam and the ankles are stretching out because no seam at the bottom. I like how there is no seam, just didn't expect it to stretch out so fast. For $125, the feeling of the pants are worth every penny, but the pilling ruined them for me. Very sad about these. Looks like I will be sticking with lulus regular pants from now on.

column6: I was skeptical on whether or not 120 bucks was worth spending on pants. It really was in this case. No matter how hot, sweaty, beat up I get during any workout; my legs feel like they are encased in cold, creamy butter. Size down if you prefer a more compressed feel. 10/10, lulu.

I loved these when I first got them, but now I basically have to force myself to wear them.
After a couple washes the waistband started to kinda...roll up? in a way that made the tights dig into my stomach and waist in a almost a really painful way. (Doesn't help if I am bloated, but I'm sure that ~never~ happens to any of us perfect athlete models right hahaha)
Also the seams and butt(?) area are pilling like I could make another pair of leggings out of the pills. SAD. Just get the Speed-Up tights my friends.
Usually a 2/4, got a 4.

column6: I have several pairs of leggings from Lululemon and these are by far the worst quality. I received these pants as a gift and I loved the fit and the feel and the style. I am very disappointed in the quality of these pants and saddened that a Christmas gift went to waste as I will no longer be wearing them.

column5: I Don't Want to Wear Any Other Tights
column6: These tight are so flattering, and I believe it has to do with the design of the seams and their placement. The seams provide structure to the tights, which are made of a luxuriously smooth nylon and lycra fabric. The placement of the pockets also adds structure to an area where many of us are not so smooth, and the seams flatter. The Navy color is perfection. Please make a matching jacket!

I almost didn't purchase these pants based on all the negative reviews so I feel compelled to let you know that they are actually AMAZING- I am so glad one of the girls at lulu talked me into trying them!!
These pants have replaced all of my others- I have been wearing them for every run and to spin class for about two months straight now and they are still as silky smooth as they were when I purchased them. They wash amazing and go back to their original structured shape every time with zero pilling! They stay in place for my entire workout and never need to be hiked up- when I run, I tie the elastic waist band tighter to ensure they stay in place. Although slightly more pricy than typical lulu pants, they have certainly passed the test and I will absolutely be buying more. I did need to size down and would definitely recommend doing so!!
I normally wear wunder unders for casual wear but find myself wanting to wear these all day, every day! The big side pockets hold all the necessities needed while running errands and are so silky smooth that not even dog hair sticks to these haha. Make more tights in this fabric please, lulu!

I bought these leggings a few weeks ago and i've only worn them a few times. Yesterday I saw the seam was ripping and there were stings everywhere. I loved how they felt and how comfy they are. This is my second pair of lulu lemon leggings and I probally won't buy another.

column6: I bought these in black, size 6. The 7/8 length is full length on my 5'3 frame, without needing to hem. Perfect! They will be cropped on anyone taller than, say, 5'5. The material is light enough for cool seasons in warm climates like California. Love the reflective details by the ankles, and the two pockets which perfectly fit a smart phone.

I love these tights. I like the compression of the tights but I did have to size down. I am usually a size 4 in tights but they were too loose. So I tried on size 2 and they fit perfectly. They stay in place and are not see through like some reviews said. The sales associate showed me how the tights were designed to be stretchy without being see through...you see white material when stretched. I gave it 4 stars because of inconsistency of sizing of tights.
These are not the most comfortable pant for yoga or palates, because of the compression on the band. But they are great for leg day because the more slippery material can handle a lot of friction.

I absolutely love the look and feel of the fabric! During my work outs it almost feels like second skin! The fabric is so soft and I would definitely purchase another pair of pants or capris. I love the fun prints too.

Awesome pants! I love the pocket! They're very comfortable and extremely soft, but they definitely lose their shape after a few wears. They fall down easily and I am constantly hiking them up. The drawstring helps to keep them up but it can sometimes dig in too much. I would maybe size down in these if you do get them.

Got my first pair of Nulux pants at Seawheeze last year and can't stop buying them. It is the softest, smoothest fabric I have ever worn and these pants fit like a glove. Hope to see a lot more Nulux in different styles.

column6: I love Lulu, I buy all of my gear from here have been doing so for years. I am a marathoner, and bought these on a friends recommendation. After 3 wears and 1 wash these are loose, need to be tied extremely tight to have a chance at staying up, and have seams unraveling despite following wash instructions. These were a little pricey for me, so it is extremely disappointing to have spent this much for something that will sit in my closet.

column6: Stop debating, just buy them. These do not budge during my workouts and they're squat proof! They are comfy enough for a Netflix binge and tough enough for a serious leg day. Most importantly, they don't pill one bit. My legs haven't had a thigh gap since I was 7, and these babies are going strong. I need them in every color.
I own over 30 pairs of lululemon pants and these are my favorite to do intense workouts in! Feels like a second skin and I don't have to constantly pull them up!

A store associate recommended these to me while I was trying on other items, noting that the length is great for us short gals because it's a perfect full length for our short legs. I thought they looked bad on display due to the raw style hem on the ankles, but I reluctantly tried them on anyways. Whoa. I loved the feel of them immediately, so silky soft, comfortable, flattering (and I'm curvy, so that's hard to come by), and supportive. I momentarily considered maxing out my credit card and buying every color.
I've since worn them hiking (in temps ranging from 30 to 50 degrees), at the gym, around town, and to many barre classes. Their breathability is remarkable - they maintain reasonable warmth outside yet keep me cool when I'm working up a good sweat indoors, and their comfort is absolutely unparalleled. I have owned them for about 3 months and have had no issues with the seams unraveling or pilling, aside from a tiny bit of pilling around the ankle which is my own fault for wearing them with boots around town.
For reference, I'm about 143lbs, 5'3", and have an hourglass-ish figure. I bought a size 6 and they fit perfectly (an 8 was way too large and sloppy on me). I need a hundred more pairs of these pants.

These are a must-try in my opinion. They are the most comfortable-not compression but a nice hold- and best fitting tights I've ever owned. The 7/8 length is always super flattering and the best in my opinion. If it wasn't for wanting variety, I would own all leggings in this style. They are definitely my most favorite that lulu has ever made.
I have only washed my pants one time and they are unraveling on the edges.

column5: Great at first, but not so good after a couple of uses
column6: I really loved these when I tried them on in the store. I bought one pair, did a medium run in them (6-7 miles), and I was so excited, thinking "yes, finally longer crops that stay in place!" I loved them so much I bought two more pairs right away, as I was in the middle of training for a race. Unfortunately, my joy didn't last. After just a few uses, they are so stretched out and refuse to stay put. I follow the wash instructions to the letter, as I don't like spending that kind of money only to ruin the clothes by washing them improperly. I've also noticed two of the three pairs are already coming apart at the seams. I've had to take these out of my running gear and relegate them strictly to casual use. Even if I wear them for when I'm lifting, I'm constantly having to pull them up, which is highly annoying. Overall very disappointed, I've never had these issues with anything from lululemon before.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey halfmarathonmomma,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 15, 2018'}

column6: These leggings are by far one of my favorites! They are super comfortable and don't pill like the Wonder Under leggings. However, I haven't even owned these leggings for a year and there is already a hole starting in two places (one right above the right knee and the othere on the stitching of the right pocket) beause of the materail weakening. I am very disapointed as I paid $130 for them not to last a year!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey dancerabby,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 15, 2018'}

column6: I LOVE these leggings. These are the best work out leggings I have ever owned. They are comfortable, flattering to shape, and most importantly STAY UP WHEN RUNNING!! I own three of these and will continue to buy more. LOVE!

I've been shopping at Lululemon since 2008 - I still have all the items I've purchased along the way, and the quality has always been incredible. These pants were the exception. I bought these on a Friday, wore them the next day around the house and for my run. At the end of the run I noticed the inside and outside seams were totally frayed. I don't mean a few loose threads sticking out, I mean the seams were "fuzzy" looking and I could pull the fuzz about 1 inch away from the tights. I inspected the seam and it was pulling apart. I want to note, I never washed them. I took them back to Lululemon and received a refund but that's ridiculous for the price of these pants. I'm hoping this was a fluke.
Besides this issue I really did like these pants. They felt so nice, looked nice and I loved the pockets in the waistband. Bummer.
For reference I am 5'3", 112lbs and purchased a 4.

column5: Love the look, but slightly disappointed
column6: I received these leggings as a gift for christmas and was immediately smitten. They're buttery soft and the design is very nice. I love the color and the feel is really comfortable. Unfortunately, I only wore them a handle full of times before the seams started to rip on the bottom and pilling started occurring as well. Incredibly disappointing for a pair of leggings that cost this much money. Would definitely expect higher quality from Lulu
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi basketballrunner12,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long-lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 15, 2018'}

column5: Great feel but lots of pilling
column6: I only wore the pants three times and the seams are already pilling and I didn't do any strenuous activity. I followed the instructions for washing and I usually love lululemon quality but these pants were a let down. The pants are really comfortable but the seams are problematic.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey there,\nWe hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 15, 2018'}

column6: I just bought these leggings, and they are by far my favorite! I love the no-seam on the bottom of the pant legs. They are snug but do have a bit of stretch to them. That said, I haven't had to pull them up while working out yet, as some other reviews have stated.

I got this pant about 20 days ago. I have worn them 2 times and the seams are pilling like crazy! I am very disappointed in this because I was so excited to get them. I love the fabric but its very upsetting that I will only be able to wear this pant 2 more times before falling apart.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey njones,\nI'm sorry to hear about the pilling that you're experiencing. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to make this right. Keep your eye out for an email headed your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 12, 2018'}

column5: Great fit, but pilling is excessive
column6: I LOVE the fit, but the pilling is terrible. I wear them fairly often, but i began to notice the pilling after the first couple times I wore them. Now I can literally pick off pieces of fabric at the seams. They were originally my favorite pair.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey phinominallulu,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. I would love to chat more about the pilling you're experiencing so we can help turn your experience around. Keep your eye out for a follow up email so we can continue this conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 12, 2018'}

column6: These are by far the best leggings in the world. Everything is perfect about them. The fit, the feel, the durability! I will never buy any other leggings for running again. Yes they are pricy but they are worth every penny. They don't fall down while running which is my number one must have!! Never change/ stop making these please!!!!

When I bought these pants, the sales associate at my local Lululemon said they would be more of a compression tight and would be great for HIIT training (I do kickboxing), and would therefore stay in place. Only problem is, when I wore them in the store and tried them on at home a couple times, I felt they were compressed and stayed in place, and when I used them during a kickboxing session the other night, I couldn't go more than 2 minutes without taking my gloves off to pull them up!! THEY HAVE SO MUCH GIVE! It's ridiculous! I'm out over $100 now because I got pants that fit me just right at first then stretched out a ton when it was most inconvenient. So sad I can't even exchange them for a smaller size so I'm stuck.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Texas2dc,\nWe hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 12, 2018'}

column6: I love the details on the bottom of the legs on these! The little reflective dots and the logo are just the right touch to my workout gear. I love the material and I love that I have worn them a decent amount since I got them and they have yet to pill. I had been living in Aligns for the past several months, but since I've gotten these, I pull these out of my drawer first. I need to invest in a few more pairs!

Can I just start by saying WOWOWOW! I have 7 pairs of lulu leggings and these are my FAVORITE! So much so, that I have called lulu's in New York to California looking for them in more colors. Not a fan of the patterns, HOWEVER, LULU YOU NEED TO STOCK MORE OF THESE!
Perfect, LOVE the NULUX!!

column5: Initial awesome fit, but disappointed in quality
column6: When I first put these on, they felt amazing. However, I was extremely disappointed after the first wear. There is already pilling all along the pant seams and on some of the rear area. This happened after only 1 wear, prior to any washing, and I did not even wear these doing extraneous activity. I'm hesitant to believe these can take daily active run or circuit work. I really loved the feeling of the fabric and cut was the best I've had yet (size 6, 140lbs, 5'4 athletic build), but after seeing the quality noticeably change after one wear, I can't justify the price. I'm genuinely nervous I will only be able to wear these a handful of team max.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey BritterK,\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Pilling is definitely not what we like to hear, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 10, 2018'}

column6: These pants are super cute- especially with the dot detail and logo on the leg area. However, BEWARE these pants pill so bad along the seams. Unlike any pilling I have seen before. The seams also damage and look frayed even with minimal wear. Lulu please add the dot detail to other pants that don't pill or look worn after just a few washes!

column6: I'm very disappointed because after the first time I wore these pants there was a random circle of pilling on the front of the pants. I hadn't even washed them yet when I noticed it. I already had these pants in black and have never had a problem, but after getting the garnet color I had the pilling issue. I really love the fit of these pants, but I'm not happy with pilling after a single wear.

column6: I love these pants! They are so comfortable and stay in place well. I was really upset though that the seams started to pill and unravel only after a few wears and following the care instructions. Disappointed on the quality for the price.

We're sorry to hear you're experiencing some pilling on your gear and would love to chat with you about some possible solutions. Keep an eye on your e-mail inbox as we will be following up with you there shortly.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 9, 2018'}

column5: Great Fit - Disappointed in the Pilling on Seams
column6: Love the feel and fit of these pants. My only complaint is that after literally my second time washing there is pilling starting on the seams. I wash all my lulu in the hand wash cycle and hang dry and was disappointed to see this happening so soon. Other than that love the fit and function of the pants!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Lifterrose,\nThanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us—we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further and help you out!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 8, 2018'}

column6: These are my favorite leggings from Lulu in terms of fit, fabric, and design (the pockets are fantastic!), but the quality is a huge disappointment. The seams that run down the sides of the legging have begun to pill after only two wears and washes. I only run in these, so they aren't subject to any type of friction. In addition to the pilling, the seams near the hem of the legging have begun to fray and unravel. I'm very disappointed in the quality of these pants given the price. I'd love to use these for ages because of the fit & fabric, but I'm afraid to wear them because I they seem so fragile. Sad to say that the quality of Lulu gear has really gone down over time :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey dianahc,\nWe hear your disappointment with the pilling you're experiencing on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can dig into this with you.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 8, 2018'}

column6: I absolutely LOVE these leggings, by far my favorite ones from lululemon. they fit like a second skin but they don't chafe or anything, it feels like I'm wearing nothing. However, for the price I paid, I was surprised to see the seams start to pill after a couple of wears and I noticed a small cut in the knee. I would definately buy again but Im surprised how easily they started to fall apart.

I would love to chat more about the pilling you're experiencing so we can help turn your experience around. Keep your eye out for a follow up email so we can continue this conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 7, 2018'}

column6: I bought these pants in store and loved them when I tried them on. However, after wearing them three times, they have already begun to stretch out. Also, the seems are beggining to come apart. I am very dissapointed because these were up there in price and I expected a better quality pant.

column5: Love them, but not holding up
column6: I have two pairs of the Fast and Free tights. I love the feel of them and the pockets on the leg! However, one pair has become so pilly. The seams, by the pocket, and the thighs are pilly. I use them for lifting weights, so there isn't a lot of friction. My other pair is perfect and still feels brand new. My sister recommended these to me and hers have held up better. Seems like I got a lemon. For the price, I am disappointed that they haven't held up.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey NebraskaMom,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. I'd love to get a bit more information on your experience and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.\nChat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'January 5, 2018'}

column6: I am on the shorter end, 5'5, and these are a perfect fit for regular pants for me. I LOVE how comfortable these pants are and how breathable they are. It's a little cold where I am in January so I wouldn't advise wearing these to walk around. So far I've worn them around 5 times and haven't seen any piling yet so thats a good sign. I'm so excited to get more of these pants. Would highly recommend!!

These tights are absolutely amazing. They move with you regardless of your activity (walking, running, yoga) and they stay put... and they fit like a dream. Concerned about the seams though as they show signs of wear which is a bit disappointing considering their price. But, I bought three pairs and would buy them again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey YogaGirl7,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. I would love to chat more about the seam issues you’re experiencing so we can help turn your experience around. Keep your eye out for a follow up email so we can continue this conversation.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 5, 2018'}

column6: These tights are soft yet snug, and I can't say enough about the convenience of the side pockets! I'm so glad Lulu started to include them in some of their running tights a couple of years ago. I can fit my iPhone, gels, key fob etc in all the pockets without them sliding down. Nulux is my favorite material as it is soft, comfortable, and snug and hasn't caused any chafing behind the knees during my long runs (which is a common problem for me). I have several pairs of this specific tight, in different colors/patterns, and no problems with the quality at all (seams are in tact; they aren't see-through even after several washes and many long mileage runs). I do size down one size with Nulux. Well done lulu...

I snagged a pair of these on sale in a retired pattern and love them. They are extremely comfortable and don't slide around or slip down. I also love love love the pocket on the side. I find myself missing it when I wear other yoga pants. I have mostly worn these as an everyday legging and haven't actually gotten sweaty in them so I'm not sure how they hold up in a work out. The material seems a bit soft for that so I just don't find myself putting them on when I work out. I'll have to give it a try some day. Otherwise I'm happy wearing them as a regular pair of go to leggings!

column5: Comfortable, but not the best quality
column6: I found these leggings to be very soft and comfortable, which is why I am giving them three stars. They are perfect for running and wearing to the gym, plus they don't fall down. However, after a few wears I noticed that the seams started to come apart. I was really disappointed with the quality of the product for how much they are worth.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey runnerninja,\nI’m sorry to hear that your seam is coming apart. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to make this right. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 4, 2018'}

column5: buttery smooth fabric is sooo comfortable
column6: I bought these just before Christmas, but just wore them for the first time today. My first reaction when I was putting them on was - OH! They are so smooth! I love the way they fit. I went for a run in them and they stayed put. I didn't ever feel like they were falling down. I haven't washed them yet, so I can't comment of longevity, but I usually wash all my Lulu stuff separately and haven't experienced any problems with my gear. I have an older version of the Fast and Free 7/8 tights that are not Nulux. I really like them, but these are so much smoother and even more comfy. I tried to order another pair online, but they are all sold out in my size :-(.

I decided to treat myself to a black pair of these tights. The material feels amazing on your body and they're very flattering. I do cardio kickboxing and they don't ever fall down on me. I use the internal waistband which is my favorite feature! I see others complaining about issues with pilling and what not. I follow the care instructions and have BARELY had any pilling. Just a few little ones on the waist band, which doesn't bother me. They're holding up well for me! My favorite lululemon purchase so far.

column5: Feels Amazing, just disappointed in piling..
column6: My husband got me these (my first pair of lululemon pants) as an early Christmas present. I was so excited and they felt amazing… I love them and still do, but for the price tag was disappointed to see them already starting to pile in the inner thigh area.. I have probably worn them once/week since Thanksgiving and wouldn’t expect them to already show signs of wear.

column6: I was so excited to wear these as they are my first pair of running pants from lululemon. Only wore them once and the stitching is loose on the front seem and threads are sticking out. There is actually a gap of missed stitches. This is the most I paid for running tights and I am very disappointed with the quality. I wouldn't expect $138 pants to do this on the first wear. They also feel loose and I feel like have to keep pulling them up constantly. I gave 2 stars because the material feels fantastic!

I also notice them sliding down a bit so I don't think they'd be fit for high intensity workouts. I mainly wear them for yoga. Can't say they're worth it for the price but fabric is comfy so ill give them that.

column6: I love the fast n free feel and material, I've happily owned the 19" crop and haven't had any issues even after multiple washes. I decided to purchase a 7/8 tight because I loved it so much, unfortunately after 1 workout and 2 days of errands, the hems are fraying and the inside seams at the bottom are fraying and piling? I haven't even washed them yet. I'm so disappointed and sad mostly due to how expensive these were. I'm hoping it's just the pair I bought? Very sad. If it wasn't for the fuzzy fraying and piling these would be my go-to tights.

We stand behind the quality of our gear and I will be in touch via email to dig into this with you!\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 3, 2018'}

column6: These pants are shockingly terrible. I got the Fast and Free tight 1 in August, and by December the seams were tearing and there were holes in the back (never even been in the dryer, only machine wash cold and hung dry.) I took them into the store, they traded them out for the new Fast and Free 2, stating that the seams had been reinforced. ONE WEAR LATER (a yoga class and a 1.5 mile slow jog), the entire seam on the left leg seemed to have sprouted a full head of inch long hair for nearly the entire calf area, and the right leg seam had 4 2-inch lines of pilling on and around the seam. As a BRAND NEW pair of "reinforced seamed" pants, I am so sincerely disappointed. Poor quality at best.
