We stand behind the quality of our gear and I will be in touch via email to dig into this with you!\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 3, 2018'}

column6:
First, I absolutely love this fabric. Seriously where has it been all of my life? Will you make bedsheets?
I only wore these once and did 1 workout (not intense or high friction), but there is already a seam unraveling at the crotch. I'm a little afraid to wash them or wear again. Please please please fix this issue because these could be the best pants ever made.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey BlueIvy,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 2, 2018'}

column6: This was my first purchase from Lululemon. I have never spent this much on a pair of workout pants before. I usually buy from Athleta and was told from an employee in the store how the quality of Lululemon far exceeded Athleta, so I decided to take the plunge. (And I now regret it...I will stick with Athleta from now on). I had only worn these pants about 5 or 6 times in the 3-4 months since I owned them. I had washed them in cool water and never dried them. I was being particularly cautious because they were so expensive. I put them on to go for a run and noticed something felt weird on my butt. I took the pants off and it looked like they were beginning to run in several places on one side only. When I went to exchange them, the sales associate told me that it looked like I had sat down on concrete. I am 100% certain that I am not responsible for the runs in the material and have never sat on concrete, but even if I had, in only a few times of wearing them, if I needed to sit on a curb to tie my shoes, the material should be able to withstand that. After being asked how I washed them, if I had used fabric softener (no), and a few other accusatory questions, I let her know that I only wanted to exchange them, not return them and then she relented. I was completely embarrassed at this point and getting side-eye glances from another associate who clearly thought I was lying. Ugh. I am hoping to get my money's worth from this pair, however, now that I read all these reviews, I see that these just don't have good quality control. I wish I would have asked to return them and not take the risk!

I was so excited to wear these tights! They fit so nicely, however, after wearing them only once (not even to the gym, just to the mall), the seem is already getting fuzzy and the material on the side of the left leg is also getting fuzzy. I'm extremely disappointed in the quality, as $138 is a decent amount to spend on leggings.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Volleygal1,\n\nI’d love to lend a hand with some solutions so I’ve sent you an email that outlines the next steps—chat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 2, 2018'}

column6: I love these pants! This is my first pair of pants with the Nulux fabric. Similar to the Nulu fabric (align pants) I had to size down from a 6 to a 4. By the time I discovered these a couple of weeks ago all of the other solid colors in my size were gone. Hopefully they bring these back!

I absolutely love these pants! They are buttery soft, stay in place perfectly. My choice of workout is crossfit 5-6 days a week. These have held up so far, I wash all my lululemon gear together unless its cotton, delicate cycle medium heat. I got two more pairs and looking for another. I go a size smaller in the nulux fabric.
column15: size 6 sold out in many colors

column6:
I love these leggings for their look and feel – the material is amazing, and these are the only pair of leggings I've actually enjoyed running in. However, I've only worn these a couple of times (once just lounging, once running) and it already looks like the seams are coming out. I haven't even washed these yet – and I'm worried they'll get even worse if I do.
These would be the perfect leggings if it wasn't for how quickly they fell apart. I'm disappointed in the quality of these leggings – I've never had a problem before now. For $128, I expected them to last a lot longer than two wears.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey californiarunner123,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 31, 2017'}

column5: Cute and comfy, but poor quality
column6: I just bought these pants on boxing day and wore them for the first time today. At first I was in love; they are super figure flattering and comfortable. However, after wearing them for a couple hours, the thread to one of seams starting coming apart. Needless to say, I was disappointed in the quality given the price.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi CJ19,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 31, 2017'}

column6: I bought theese leggings for my 13 year old daughter. She’s a runner and does a lot of yoga. She’s 5 ft and 1” , and ever since Ivivva closed most of its stores she really wanted a pair of lululemon leggins. My daughter never found a pair that would fit her because they would fit her too long or would be too short and really big on her ankles. Having a small body theese leggings were a great choice. They’re great for running and really great for yoga. The one thing that I didn’t like were how the leggings need to be clean. This is a problem that I also find with most all ivivva leggings but you can’t wash them with other clothes, they get all furry and lint sticks to them. I wash all our lululemon and Ivivva black leggings together on the gentle setting or hand wash them with the help of my daughter. If you’re a high school student that doesn’t know how to take care of their clothes I don’t recommend you buy them.
column14: they are great for small bodies.

column6: These were my first pair of lulu leggings and I will probably never go back. The fit is incredible, these pants hold you in all the right places but are comfy enough that some nights I sleep in them. After one wear I was hooked; these leggings look amazing and feel even better. I'm (not so) patiently awaiting for Lulu to release my size in more colors so I can buy them up!
These really stand up to the product description and reviews. Best tights i have ever had. Feels flattening!!!

column5: All Time Best Lululemon Pants (Until They Come Out With Something Better)
column6:
I LOVE the Fast and Free Tights. I think I can only say good things about them aside from ONE little issue - the waistband is a little bit too thin to me, I like a thick waistband and I feel like length wise it is definitely wide but the thickness isn't there. Overall though if you're looking for your first pair of Lulu's or just a perfect all around, every sport compatible kind of legging, these are the ones!
I wear these for rock climbing, tennis, lifting, anything.
The GOOD:
- Really nicely fitted and flattering look.
- Pockets on the sides that don't stretch out in the wash.
- Pockets on the waistband TOO, little ones all around the waist (so smart)
- The 7/8 length is perfect for petite girls (It's normal length basically..)
- The Luxtreme fabric is VERY thin and second skin like, but it doesn't pill or gather up lint at all.
- Stays up during my workouts no matter what I do (So important!!)
The BAD:
- It's laser cut so this is kind of a good and bad thing - the cut is nice but just note that you CANNOT have this one hemmed to fit you - the length you get is the one you stick with, whether it's cropped or long.
- The waistband is a little bit uncomfortable at times because of how thin it is but it's a mangeable thing and I wouldn't want these to change too much!
Would (and have) recommend these to all my friends. They're great for dashing out and working out. The pockets on the side and waistband are REAL winners for me - I put my keys in the waistband and my phone in the pockets and they've never fallen out nor have the pockets stretched out over continued use.
I am 5'3" and wear a size 12 - these fit TTS but I think sizing down to a size 10 wouldn't hurt if you wanted something even MORE fitted. But they're definitely not something you'd want to size up in, the second skin fit is great!

Don't understand all the negative reviews. For reference, I am about 5'3" and 122lb. petite frame, not in the best shape with a little bit of a mom gut. I purchased the size 2, since these leggings have a good stretch to them.
These are amazing legging and breathable. These Fast & Free II Tights 25" (7/8) would be perfect mostly all year around (except zero degree weather). They are lightweight but holds you in. If you have a mini gut/mom gut the drawstring/drawcord highwaist band holds you in, and extremely comfortable and my favorite tights thus far. I previously tried the Wunder under tights but they rolled down at the waistband (no drawcords).
I'm very OCD and careful w/my leggings (especially for the price). I wash these on delicate/or hand wash them w/no fabric softer and air dry them. No other non leggings or jeans get washed w/them, (sometimes unzipped zippers can snag clothes). Anyone complaining they don't hold up must be high school girls or people who don't know how to wash take care of their clothes.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: These are by far my favourite leggings I've ever owned! They are super flattering, very comfortable and work for a wide range of workouts! I've worn them to spin, barre, on runs and for dryland training before/after swimming! I love the lulu logo on the back of the calf and the reflective dots are so cute! The Nulux fabric is definitely one of my favourite lululemon fabrics, it doesn't pill and feels like they glide over your body

I have worn these pants for months and still love them. They have worn really well, comfortable and light weight material, and very flattering with the high waist. My only complaint is they fall down when I run in them, but perfect for any low intensity activities.

I was disappointed with this pant. The material has no stretch and is quite thick. It is not breathable at all. I feel quite restricted in it. No way you'd want to run in these. You'd be sweaty and have little movement.
I bought these online to go running. Should have returned. Sizing is also small. I'm usually a size 6 and had to exchange for an 8.
Midnight colour is gorgeous though. I wouldn't recommend. Wish I hadn't bought.

From the first time I put these pants on I loved them. Not only are they comfy, but they have a convenient pocket on each leg. I love these pants and they are the only ones I will wear from the store. However, I have an issue with one pair, they started to pill. I figured there would be some type of "warranty" being that these leggings cost $128 but unfortunately I was told the opposite when I went in the store. I was told that I possibly dried them with towels or wore a fuzzy sweater, however this was not the case. They told me there was not anything they could do for me but I should try the pill remover from Bed Bath and Beyond, which seemed to make them worse. I love the way they fit but if you are looking for long lasting leggings these aren't for you.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Kbrowz,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast and Free 7/8 Tight is pilling. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 27, 2017'}

column6: I wear these almost every day whether going to the gym or not. Fast and Free 7/8 have become my uniform. Love them.

i bought two pair on sale last month, and these are now becoming my go-to pant. Very flattering fit, and the material is like butter. I haven't had the pilling issue that others have had. I have them in the peony material and a bright blue. just ordered another pair, I love them so much!

I splurged on these run tights, but after a couple of months they have stretched out so much, I cannot wear them anymore because I am constantly pulling them up. The seams look trashy as well with threads sticking out. I should have listened to the other reviews...

column6: I have the original fast and free tights, and after a month of use they started to pill so badly around all the pocket areas. The seems in between the thighs began to come loose as well. Now after almost a year they have begun to stretch out. I don't see how this newer version is much different. These were my first pair of lulus, and I paid a lot expecting them to last.

column6: I would live in these pants if I could - so comfortable and flattering, and very lightweight so I don't feel like I am wearing any! However, I had to quit wearing them because I got a hole (like a pinhole) right on my butt, near the rear seam. If it wasn't noticeable I would rock them regardless, but it definitely is :( There is no way I could have snagged them there, but now they are unwearable :( I've only had them for a few months, maybe since July, so I was honestly surprised to see them get a hole! I love lulu, and the quality is out of this world, so I couldn't believe it when these got a hole! Otherwise, such great pants!!

column5: Great fit, not so great quality
column6: I absolutely loved these at first, but they began pilling after only 3 weeks. I brought it into a Lululemon store, and the worker basically told me it was my fault because I "probably put it in the dryer". I told her that I NEVER put these in the dryer and have always taken extra good care of these. She said "huh, weird" and told me to use a pill remover, but that it the most she could do for me. I went to another store in Canada while on vacation a couple weeks later, and they were a little more willing to help, but still told me that my best bet is to use a pill remover. I tried using one, and it worked a little bit, but it seemed to ruin the material. The parts where there was pilling are now rougher, and other spots on the rear and inside part are beginning to pill. I've given up trying to get help from the store employees. For the price and the short amount of time I got to wear these before they started pilling, I would not recommend this.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi TiffA,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long-lasting performance for you. column6: Love Loe LOVE these pants however they began pilling after maybe a month and a half of wearing them and washing them appropriately. these are my favorite pants and I recommend them to everyone however the pilling is very disappointing. I wish they didn't pill :(

column6: I bought these to run with and loved the look and feel of these leggings that fit perfectly. After a few months the seams started to pill and really ruin the look of the leggings. I loved the feel of the leggings and truly was upset by the quick pilling, especially for the price.

column6: When I tried these on, I was speechless because the fit was great and the feeling of the material was super nice. But on my first time wearing it, the seam has started to unravel on my right leg within 3 hours. I wasn't even working out so I'm confused and disappointed because I really loved this when I tried it on in store. It definitely looks older from this one wear (slight fraying of hem elsewhere), which sucks because the quality of my other lulu products is amazing.

column5: Whats going on with the seams?!
column6: I have a pair of these in all black and i love them but the seams are unravelling and they look hideous. they are making these leggings look very old and who knows when the material is going to split apart at the seams.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey tfia,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 21, 2017'}

column6: I am a physical education teacher and personal trainer. I absolutely LOVE Lululemon's products and purchase nearly all of my clothing from Lulu. I especially loved these pants. The pockets are amazing and comfort is wonderful. I recommend the Fast & Free Tight to all of my colleagues and clients. I have purchased 5 pairs of these pants and have gifted many of them as well. However, a hole appeared in the pants. When I took the pants into a store and requested that they stitch the hole up they rudely told me no and that there was nothing they could do. Major bummer for sure. First time I have ever been disappointed in Lululemon's customer service.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey mswj,\nWe hear your disappointment with the pilling you're experiencing on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can dig into this with you.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 20, 2017'}

column6: These were my first ever pair of Lulu leggings and they are amazing. The material is great, I wear them to workout in 1-2 times/week for almost a year now and they don't pill at all and the seams hold up well. The material hugs your body and does not show any sweat! By far my favorite pair of leggings

column5: Bought 4 for myself & some for my friends!
column6: LOVE these tights!They are all I will wear to my Orangetheory class and when running long distance. They don't lose their shape and are worth every penny! My other lulu leggings can't compare, especially for a workout/run. Double plus is that they hold everything in... Highly recommended!!

column5: Was great for a month and a half....
column6: Bought these for my 7th grader. She’s worn them 1x a week for the last month and a half and the crotch is pilling big time. Super disappointed!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Katkrack1967,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast and Free Tight is pilling. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 19, 2017'}

column6:
I've had these leggings for about 6 months, so I've had time to wear them and see how they hold up. It might be important to note that I'm 5'2, a size 4 in all my lulu leggings, and have a 25' waist with 40' hips.
The nulux is fantastic, so comfortable, but without the horrible pilling the aligns get.
I personally don't like the front seam (I like my leggings very high rise, so I pull them up and the front seam causes discomfort for me) or the eternal drawstring (I JUST learned how to tie it after months and months, but when I tie it it makes the leggings bunch at the waist and they still try to slide down anyway, plus is just added bulk).
My biggest issue with these is that the waist has stretched out majorly over the past six months. I'm not sure if this is because of months of pulling them up over 40' inch hips or what, but I wore them to the gym yesterday and I had to pull them up every 2 seconds, and they eventually slid down way under my belly button (they used to stay pretty above my belly button when I first bought them) it was really irritating and made me self-conscious. Not the best way to feel during a workout.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Sundriedstars,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 18, 2017'}

column6: This is the best fabric and I love the overall look of these tights. I originally purchased two of these in size 8 and over time they seemed to stretch out quite a bit, especially in the waist and knees (for reference, I’m 5’6” and 140 lbs). I decided to get another pair in a smaller size, I was worried about how much they stretched so I tried on a 6 and a 4. The size 4 fit everywhere except the waist which was extremely tight, I was also concerned about the fabric stretching thin. I went with the 6, I cinch the waist a little tighter but they seem to work well, I’ve ordered a second pair. I think this style is the best for running, I love the pockets, but I also wear them for CrossFit. These are great tights; just take your time to make sure you get the right size.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: I had recently gotten these leggings and loved them! They were so comfortable and easy to move around in! I wore them for about a week and then they started to pill :(. Wanted to love...
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey user123,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and are sorry to hear your gear isn't performing. Give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 so they can follow up and chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 18, 2017'}

column6: These are my go to leggings, I wear them at least twice a week for regular weight lifting and occasionally some light cardio. I got these for my birthday in March, and have had no problems with them! They are so comfy and the seams look so flattering on your legs. I am looking forward to buying them in more colors as they come out, the eggplant color I have now is gorgeous and is still true to the original color!

These are the smoothest, buttery-like pants that I've ever purchased. I love the side pockets, and the dots up going up the calf give it an added style flare. SO COMFORTABLE!! My absolute favorite purchase from lululemon so far.
I got these for my birthday and love them. I have had them for 2 weeks and there are pulls in the seams. Very disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Ann15,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 15, 2017'}

column6: I bought these leggings as an impulse purchase several months ago and I am so happy that I took a chance! These have held up incredibly well even in really tough workouts and I haven't seen any signs of wear at all. These are so flattering and comfortable. My favorite part about these leggings might be that this fabric seems to be pet-hair resistant! I wear nothing but black and with an orange cat I never seem to be able to leave the house not covered in fur, but these make getting out of the house so much faster since I don't have to worry about grabbing the lint roller. These are pricey but worth it! I can't wait to get a few more fairs!

I got these on sale in store and I am so happy that I did. I'm 5'4, 130 lbs and curvy and they fit me great in size 4 which is the size of all my lulu pants (size 2 is always way too small and size 6 for me is always too big in the waist because I have an hourglass figure). High waist hits me just right (I have a short to average size torso). They are lightweight fabric but still hug you to feel good. Perfect my for my spinning classes because they don't move and also keep you feeling cool. Got the matching bra as well. Love the print! Just as pretty as in the picture!

I am a lululemon adict and have owned/own many of their different legging styles over the years. These are by far my favorite, I own too many pairs to want to admit the number. I am a pretty serious dancer and they are the best pair in terms of staying up during class. But I also live in these on a daily basis. All of mine still look basically brand new despite the constant wear and washing. I can not recomend these enough and they are totally worth every penny.

column5: Loved the pants, but they didn't last long
column6: These were my favorite workout pants in terms of being flexible and lightweight, but the fabric seemed to wear down really quickly. I've only had mine for a year and theres a hole in them already and the fabric has worn down in spots where there is any chance of abrasion.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey sheri45,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 13, 2017'}

column6: I was very excited to take these home after trying them on in store, but was disappointed to see that the seams were already coming apart/ fuzzing after ONE wear and ONE wash (according to the wash instructions). I own many lulu leggings, and these ones were the most expensive but sadly the poorest quality in terms of durability.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "I'm sorry to hear your Fast & Free Tight II did not hold up as you had hoped it would. I'd love to help you find a resolution for the seam unravelling you're experiencing—please keep an eye on your e-mail inbox as we will be continuing the conversation there.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 12, 2017'}

column6: fast and free is my favorite tight and nulux is my favorite fabric. i feel complaining... but the seems are a little weird. i slip them on and have to tug on the legs to get the seems in place (the side seem insists on being right in the middle on my shin) also, for being made for running tights, i feel like the placement of the reflectors doesn't make total sense. it seems unlike lululemon to not think through these things

Just purchased these a few days ago and wore for an Orange workout for the first time. Told these pants were sweat wicking and dry quickly. Not so much. Totally embarrassed all my sweat was very visible in the wrong areas. I purchased the dark purple color and would not recommend. For $128 I would expect much more in terms of the fabric doing what it's advertised to do.

column5: Great for the gym, phone pocket great! Great for shorties (I'm 5 ft 0 in)
column6:
I always have a terrible time finding pants because I'm really short (5 ft tall). They are always baggy in my ankles because that's where they're intended to hit the model's calves, so even with complimentary hemming, they are still baggy around the ankle. For whatever reason, these pants actually fit my ankle and since it's the 25inch I don't even need hemming!
On their functionality note, I wear these at least 2x a week to the gym for weight lifting, and they've stood up to probably 6 months of me doing that so far and still look pretty new. I adore the giant pocket on the side, I can put my phone there during a squat or whatever and forget about it. The fit is good, my midsection is nice and tight, but my legs have ample room to move around and doesn't give me muffin top or anything. The material is not good for anything abrasive though, like rock climbing, so don't wear it for that.

column5: In love but disappointed with a pair
column6:
If you were to ask me if you should purchase the Fast and Free tights I would first say yes, enthusiastically but then follow up with "but be careful with each pair you buy." I consider myself a part of the Fast & Free Addict club as I have now purchased 6 tights. So why leave a fair review?
The careful comment comes from the II tights that were changed from the original. I bought the grey ones (AMAZING color) but something had to have changed. They are so baggy and saggy. Its not the size, they are snug and I wear the exact same size in all other 5 pairs I have. I do not know if it is the change from the original Fast & Frees but its unfortunate to not be able to wear a $128 pair of tights because the fabric bunches like crazy in the knees, the bottoms ride up and it is the only pair I have to pull up on a constant basis. Maybe a bad pair of leggings.. maybe the new type of pants.. I do not know... so I would say definitely purchase as the first 5 pairs I have have lasted amazingly, have held up despite wearing and washing on a regular basis but be cautious and would recommend to try on each pair!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Sammmmyyyy,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your latest pair of Fast and Free Tights doesn't fit quite right. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would like to make this right. Keep an eye out for an email with some solutions coming your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 11, 2017'}

column6: These pants are my favorite so far and were my first introduction to the brand. I wear them probably 1-2 times a week and have had them for several months already. I've only washed them on a cold, delicate cycle with a powdered, sports specific laundry detergent and air dried. Seams are still intact (even with my giant thighs) and haven't experienced any pilling either. Super happy with these pants and can't wait to get more!

I had the original version of the Fast & Free tight and had issues with the seams and Lulu was extremely helpful with my return. When I went to the store to purchase a new pair of leggings, the sales associate assured me that the issue would not happen again and that is not the case. The fabric is quite thin and the seams are coming undone profusely. I am constantly impressed but the design and attention to detail in Lululemon products but these leggings have never been put in the drier or put in situations where fraying should occur and I am frustrated that the same issue is happening in the "new and improved" item.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey sscherba,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email', 'LL_response_date': 'December 8, 2017'}

column6: These are so comfortable with their high waist and just enough stretch. Love the pocket for my phone. Perfect for my early mornings in the gym!
column15: like the 3/4 best. crops ride up on calf.

column5: Felt great on at the store but after worn For a run SO baggy in the crotch
column6: I am a huge lulu fan and have never left a review before but was really disappointed with the quality of these after worn. I tried these tights on at the store and LOVED them. I wore my black pair once to run errands and loved them so much I immediately bought a second pair. However, after my first run in these I regretted that I had already gotten a second pair:( they were falling down the entire time and got SO baggy in the bottom area. I thought maybe after a wash the form would return, but it only got worse. Now I'm stuck with two baggy pairs of tights that now barely stay up when I'm walking:( thought these would be the best things ever but am really disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Sararan,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 5, 2017'}

column5: Super comfortable but already falling apart
column6: I was so excited when I first got them because they fit perfectly and felt great. However, after I washed them the first time I noticed that the seams were frayed and coming apart. I followed the care instructions, so I'm pretty disappointed that they're already falling apart.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey em07,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 5, 2017'}

column5: life altering fit, but falling apart at the seams!
column6: After borrowing lululemon leggings and shorts from girlfriends, I was so excited about my first purchase. After trying on almost every pair of leggings, I decided that these would suit my needs best for running/yoga/barre. And I love love love the material, and the fit is totally flattering! I have had the leggings about 4 months, and they have been literally falling apart at all of the seams on the thighs since the 2nd wash (i followed all the care instructions exactly) I still wear them, but they look cheap and sloppy. I'm so disappointed in the quality of lululemon. I've read the reviews about these pants, and it seems like I'm not the only one with this problem. I'm a big believer in "you get what you pay for", but that is definitely not the case with these expensive, but poorly made pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey cait086,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast and Free 7/8 Tight is falling apart at the seams. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 4, 2017'}

column5: Falling apart, weird fit but comfy fabric
column6: I own many lululemon leggings and I have never had a problem. When I ordered these online I was very excited, I love how they looked and when I got them I found that the fabric is super soft and very comfortable. However, the fit is very weird and they are constantly falling down and very baggy in the crotch region. Also, I have only worn the leggings once and washed them per instructions and the seams on the legs are already coming apart. As I said, I love lululemon leggings and I wanted to love these but there is just too much wrong with them.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey lovetorun92,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast and Free 7/8 Tight isn't holding up and the seams are unravelling. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 4, 2017'}

column6:
I bought these pants a few months ago in the olive green color and was IN LOVE - the color is amazing, the fabric is so comfortable, and I love the way the length cuts off at my ankle.
However, after the second time I wore them, I was in a lululemon store when I noticed the seams on the butt began to look furry or something. The girl at the store was so gracious and had me bring them back later to sort it out. Since I loved the color and they were out of it to exchange, I decided to keep that pair of pants and just get the seams fixed. Once I got them back, I've worn the sparingly because of how much I love the color and fabric and was scared to ruin them.
But now, I've worn the pants just a handful of times (either just around or maybe pilates) and the pants stretch out so much near the crotch that I have to constantly pull them up and they just look plain weird. AND PLUS I've noticed the seam starting to fuzz up again!!!
The main reason why I love lulu is for the quality, and this is the first pair that I've really had issues with. I only ever wash cold and hang dry for ALL of my lulu gear, so I really don't know what's going on. So disappointing for $130 pair of pants and so sad because I really love the color. :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey keepitmoving,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast and Free 7/8 Tight is having the seams fall apart and not staying up. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 4, 2017'}

column6: I fell in love with the material at the store and bought it on impulse. It has a buttery fabric that fits me perfectly and is extremely flattering. It was my first Lululemon purchase and I had been hearing how Lulus last forever and how the material won't fade. I wore it a total of four times since I bought it this summer. It was chafing after the first wash and now the material looks scuffed up. I have been hand washing as instructed by the cashier but the material is not durable. I'm extremely disappointed as this was my first purchase.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey MalloryElizabeth,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Fast and Free 7/8 Tight is chafing and the material is not holding up for you. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 4, 2017'}

column6: These pants WERE my favorite running pants from LuLu! I have had them for a few months and about a month ago I noticed the inside falling apart so I took them to a store and they sent them out to their seamstress. Came back looking fine but after one run they are falling apart again! Not a lot of piling but the threading is coming undone and the material on the inside is becoming thinner and thinner it's almost see through, I'm scared to even wear them to the gym in case they rip! If it weren't for these pants falling apart I'd give them 5 stars! A $130 pair a pants should last me at least 2 years, not months :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Julianagabrielle,\nI'm sorry to hear your pants have begun coming apart. I'll be reaching out shortly to work on a solution with you—keep an eye on your inbox!", 'LL_response_date': 'December 3, 2017'}

column6: Sad. I'd been wanting a pair of Lulu's for a while but was hesitant after reading consistent bad reviews on quality. Despite this, I finally decided to try it anyway & got 2 different tights at once. This one was my favorite of the 2 & but sadly, the seams started pilling after the first time I wore them - before even washing them! (wanted to test quality due to reviews on pilling & seams coming undone). And of course after only a handful of subsequent wears & few hand-washes + air-drying, it got even worse. The stitching looks like fur. You'd expect more for this price. My friend owns several pairs that she bought years ago & they've held up fine. I'm willing to pay the hefty price for good quality but it doesn't seem to be the case anymore, unfortunately. Seems like quality may just going down (or quality control) which is such a shame. Very disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Bella1233,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long-lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 3, 2017'}

column6: Everyone raved about lulu so i finally caved and bought my first pair of leggings. I bought these in the pants and crop. I LOVED them at first, key word loved. I loved the convenient pockets and fit. How they felt like you didn't have leggings on. After the first wash, by themselves, inside out, and no drying they started pilling. I am extremely disappointed with the quality of material versus the amount of money I paid for them.

I love lululemon, but I am very disappointed in these leggings. I'm usually pretty true to size in lululemon, and they're pretty much the only leggings I buy. I'm 5'10'' and 130 pounds. I got a size 6 and it fits great on the legs but SO baggy up in the hip/crotch area. Im having to pull the string extremely tight and in between the inside of my legs the fabric rubs and chaffes. I've tried wearing them, washing them with cold water and letting dry and nothing helps the fit. I'm not sure if I needed to go a size below, but the fit does not seem right for the price I paid. Also I am starting to notice some fraying on the side, nothing too noticeable but I have only had the leggings for a few weeks.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey lululemongirl123,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 1, 2017'}

column5: I love the way these fit BUT....
column6: They started to pill as soon as the first wear. I really love the way these fit, but the fact that they are already falling apart is disconcerting. These are my first pair of lulu's so I was pretty excited, but now I'm not sure if I will order any other pants. Also, they say they are sweat-wicking, but I noticed wet spots after a pilates class on the front and back of the pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey VeronicaGo,\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Pilling is definitely not what we like to hear, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 1, 2017'}

column6: I'm really disappointed in this purchase. I'm a college student and never splurge this much on leggings but I bought these at my local lululemon store because they were so soft. After the first run, I washed them and they literally fell apart at the seams. There are holes around all the seams and they collect lint on their seams as well. I've never been so disappointed in a purchase.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey trailrunning,\nWe\'re sorry to hear you\'re experiencing unraveling seams with your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II *Nulux 25" . We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 30, 2017'}

column6: LOVE these leggings! Went into my local Lulu and wanted a new pair for spin, barre and running. These feel like butter on your body!! Until now I have only worn wunder unders (I have about 12 pairs of the same black pair), but I will be purchasing more of these!

After I wore the tights the first time, I noticed they start to get extremely baggy in the bum area and I kept having to pull them up every couple minutes which was getting very annoying. They don't hold their shape in the butt area very well, it almost felt like they were sagging. I ordered my correct size 4 that I always wear at lulu so Im not sure if I needed to go a size smaller. Other than that, I haven't had any of the other problems mentioned. I do think these are too expensive for the quality though, if you are going to charge $128 for one pair of tights they better be good! But the fabric is awesome and very comfy and besides the fit in the butt becoming somewhat baggy, the rest of the fit is cute.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ellevv,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!', 'LL_response_date': 'November 29, 2017'}

column6: I love love love the feel of these leggings however, for $128 you would expect for them to stay in place and for the stitching to not fall apart..... On top of that, they still pill very terribly. I would not recommend these to anyone; stay with the wunder under.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey clueless,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 27, 2017'}

column5: Hole in less than a month!
column6: I had bought these leggings in black and the full length (instead of 7/8) in August and had only worn them a couple of times to find a hole above the knee in September. This was my first purchase from Lululemon and I had been very excited to get something but was extremely disappointed when they didn't hold up as I had expected. I loved the material and the quality other than the hole (which just keeps getting bigger), but probably won't purchase these pants again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey mmwhite2436,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 27, 2017'}

column6: I waited for a long time to get my first pair of Lulu's quite frankly bc of the price. I finally broke down and got the fast n free in black. I love the fabric which is why I'd give them 3 stars. However, within a week the outside seam on my left leg was coming undone. Wish I had read reviews first. Stuff happens and I don't expect my leggings to solve world hunger or anything. But for $128, they shouldn't be falling apart immediately, especially when I follow the wash instructions to the letter.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey dancemami,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 24, 2017'}

column6: These leggings are awesome! The Nulux is as soft as butter on and don't snag in the wash. Mine have been washed at least 10 times and I have had no problems! I would highly recommend, especially while they are on Black Friday Sale. These are at the top of my Christmas wishlist! I have the Midnight Navy color and they are beautiful! They are rich and almost have a purple-y tint. I also have Capri color and it is gorgeous!!! Flawless! Definitely my favorites!

I am 5'2 and I bought size 2 and it fits me like a glove. So in love. I have 7 of them. I can't wait for more colors. Great pant and quality, yes I am going to buy more. I believe that most people that complaint too much have buyers remorse, I don't mind paying for quality and unique style. 95% of my athletic clothes is from Lulu and I am so satisfied that I keep going for more. I can't wait to buy the new prints.

column5: Had to get these replaced twice
column6:
I had been eyeing these leggings after trying them on in store one day and decided to treat myself for my birthday back in June.
The first time I wore them was just sitting in the car on a road trip and I noticed seams coming out in the crotch area. They became more unraveled throughout the day(minimal movement) so I changed and went to get them repaired/ replaced.
Kind customer service replaced them in store with an exact same pair and I was happy to give these a second chance as I thought I just received a faulty pair.
Fast forward 2 months and the seams are coming out on my second pair in the butt area. I had been carefully caring for them after being paranoid about the last pair. Taking these back yet again and won't be trying this pair anymore.
Wanted to like them so much, but they just aren't of quality.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi SummerM,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!', 'LL_response_date': 'November 23, 2017'}

column6: At first I loved these leggings. They are incredibly comfortable and the drawstring makes them great to work out in. However, upon a few wears, as other reviewers have noted, the seams started to wear very quickly. I have only had these leggings for a few months and there are already holes in the seams. I regret purchasing these.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Brooms22,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II *Nulux isn’t holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 22, 2017'}

column6: I purchased these over the summer and I have been waiting to review them to see if I had any of the issues others have mentioned but so far they are perfect. The fabric almost has a cooling feeling and the fit is perfect.

I wasn't sure if I wanted to write a review because I thought I was going crazy but then I see that others have had the same issue. I've worn these pants two times, neither settings involved rigorous activity (they haven't even gone through the wash), and when I went to put them on today, I found fraying on the stitching on the inner thigh. This is my first pair of lulus so because of that fact and the price, I've been treating these extremely delicately. It's a bit disappointing that these haven't even lasted a week of wearing before showing this wear and tear.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey EmilyT,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 20, 2017'}

column6: I bought the olive green tights and they show sweat like crazy. They are also very loose even with the waist band tightened. I would not recommend wearing these for any type of exercise where you might sweat. These might be good for running to the store, but that's about it. I got out of my warm yoga class and it looked like I had wet my pants. For pants that are so expensive I would expect these to be made of better quality material that doesn't show sweat. This was my first pants purchase from lululemon, and this definitely does not make me want to come back for more.

I bought this in the navy and black in a size 4. I have loved the navy but the black pair is defective. The material is starting to fray and it looks like I have had these leggings for multiple years when I have really only had them for a few months. It makes me sad the the quality of Lululemon pants is so variable. The durability does not match the price tag
Because of the variability in quality I would not recommend these to a friend
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Mkrun,\nI'm sorry to hear about the fraying you're experiencing. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to look into a resolution for you. Please give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300—we'd love to make this right.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 18, 2017'}

column5: Love the fit but then there were holes...
column6: I am only able to budget so much for clothing money and I saved for a while to buy these pants. They feel like a second skin and are SO comfortable! But after having them only a few months I found a whole in one of the pockets and there is also one on the left knee. I was pretty disappointed that these are one of the more expensive pairs of pants and they started to disintegrate so quickly...
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Mullery,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 18, 2017'}

column6: I fell in love with this print (peony) and went to my fav Lulu associate and explained that I'm a yogini through and through and the only running I do is to a sale. She explained all the great features about this tight and she was so right. These make my booty look fantastic! This is extra important because I teach yoga and people need to look at my derierre. The fabric holds you in without being constrictive and is super wicking. There are pockets to keep notes and other important teacher things! They've washed well too.

Love the fit of these pants but they do not hold up. My dog greeted me when I got home and his paw barely grazed the pants and they ripped immediately. For the price, they should hold up better especially if you want to wear them for more intense workouts.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey KateMac1421,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 17, 2017'}

column6: I did not read these reviews before purchasing these leggings and I am so glad I didn't! So many are saying the seams are coming undone or the fabric is pilling, but honestly I haven't had a single issue with mine. Other than the price, I would say that I have had a perfect experience with these. They are so smooth, slimming and hold everything in. Not only do I feel good wearing them but I have actually gotten compliments that they are complimentary to my body. Since I only have them in black I plan to purchase another color in the near future. Thank you Lulu!!!

I LOVE how these feel when you put them on! They're super easy to get on (as someone who usually does the 'pants dance' when I put on any pants) and they're very comfortable. I like the high waist, they stay up when I squat, run, inchworm, sit up, everything! My only complaint is that I wish they came in a full length option instead of the 7/8. I like the 7/8 but man my ankles get cold! I have 2 pairs, and I've tried on almost every other pair of leggings in the store and nothing compared to the comfort and look of these. oh and the pockets are a game changer
column15: don't have a full length version

column5: My pants were not hemmed - both pair
column6: I like the tights, but was unhappy with the fact that both pair of tights that I ordered were not hemmed. I don't recall seeing this in the description. Not happy at all.

The design and style are very very cute but I've only had these for about a month and a half and they're already pilling and the seams are falling apart. I'm very upset with the quality because they are not worth the price for how long it lasts before pilling.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey april4,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 17, 2017'}

column5: Started out great but then became loose
column6:
When I tried these on they felt fantastic and looked great! I bought them to use for running, but very shortly into my first run I kept having to pull them up.
I wish I had been advised to size down in these (I am in between 4-6 in jeans and was told at the store to get the 6 in these- this was my first lulu purchase), and after my first wash the waistband became even looser.
I still wear them casually so I can get my money's worth, but I am disappointed that I cannot use them for running.

column6: I really love the style of these leggings, but like a lot of other reviewers have stated, the seams on them are constantly falling apart. I have never had this problem with other Lulu products, but I've had them for about a month or so and already the seams have started to come up in countless places to the point that I'm concerned they are going got start forming holes and become unwearable. Highly disappointed by the quality of these, I would definitely not waste your time with this style.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey yoga jones,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. I'm so sorry to hear about the seam issues with your Fast & Free Tight. column6: I loved these pants when I tried them on in the store and bought two pairs. The fit was great and the fabric was amazing!!! BUT, after wearing twice and washing (NOT drying) they are balling up and coming undone in multiple places along the seams. CRAZY to pay this much for pants that won't hold up for even a few wears!!!!!!!! Super disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey JMART,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 14, 2017'}

column6: I wanted to love these pants... They are so comfortable and feel so silky smooth when you put them on. Unfortunately during my first wear the cut hem began to unravel. It has continued to do so ever since. I also have noticed pilling within the seams of the pants... Overall very disappointed in this purchase
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Brisk97,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear of the issues you're experiencing and can understand your disappointment. I'd love to learn more so I can lend a hand with some solutions—please keep your eyes out for a follow up email headed your way shortly.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 14, 2017'}

column6: I tried these on in the store and fell in love with them. When I went to a lululemon outlet I saw they had the color (psychic) and size I wanted and bought them! The blue is such a pretty blue in person. Unfortunately, that's where the love stopped. I wore them for the first time to a body pump class and although I didn't feel like I worked up much of a sweat, it left horrible sweat marks all over my butt and crotch area. And I was wearing underwear! This has never happened with my Nike pants ever. I was so disappointed, as this legging says it is quick drying and sweat-wicking and it was my first lululemon purchase. I wouldn't have bought them had I known.
I love the fit of these pants. Form fitting, flattering, keeping everything in place. The patterns are fun, too.

I have been wanting these SO BAD. The first time I tried them on I was IN LOVE with how they felt (like butter!). I waited 7 months before I purchased the Fast and Free. I have only washed them once, right after I purchased them and have probably worn them in the house and to run errands (not even a workout in them!) 4 or 5 times max and not even a MONTH of owning these leggings I noticed a fray on the knee. I have a collection of lululemon leggings and none of them fray like this. I was a bit worried about the other reviews with these leggings but I thought I wouldn't have a problem. Wrong. I am so disappointed. I waited so long to buy these and they are the most expensive leggings I've purchased.

column6: Before I even washed it, the seams started unraveling after my first wear. Fits like a glove but terrible, horrible quality. Very disappointed with this purchase.

column6: Like others have experienced, the seams on these pants began unraveling after 1 use. I own several pairs of Lululemon leggings and I have never experienced this problem. Unacceptable for the price point.These should have been recalled a long time ago. Returned immediately.

column6: I bought this pant about a month ago and I loved the feel and the fit, but recently this pant has started to pile up and become very loose. It is very uncomfortable every time I run because it slips and I have to keep pulling it up. For $128 this pant is very low quality and I would not buy it again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ggsolange,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 8, 2017'}

column6: i love wearing these as a physical education teacher and coach. They cover well are not see through and fit like a glove. I get tons of complements on them and make me look very slim.

I'm not sure if it's just these pairs of leggings, but my mom and i got matching black ones and are super disappointed with the quality. Especially for $128. The seam area has a lot of pilling and the ends of the leggings look like they're fraying/ spreading out. I'd stick to other leggings with an actual seam. Such a shame because I was hoping these would feel and look the same for a while. I've worn them only about four times.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey belle3500,\nNo one likes pilling—that’s definitely a thumbs down from us. We’ve sent through an email so we can learn more about your experience and look into some options.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 4, 2017'}

column6: When I first purchased the tights I was in love The fit was great and the material was amazing. But unfortunately, after some wear and washing (properly) the tights seemed to, especially the pockets became loose. The pockets also pilled very quickly, and many snags appeared on the pockets out of nowhere. Overall nice leggings, but for the price I'd be hesitant to repurchase because of the pilling.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey lulufanatic55,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow-up and help.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 4, 2017'}

column6:
I gave these leggings two stars because the material is very soft and comfortable.
But, I have only had these for about two weeks and they are already terribly pilled. I also only wear these casually so they have not endured as much stress as they would if they were ones I worked out in, which they claim they are made for. I have owned many pairs of Lululemon leggings and these are the only pair I have ever had a problem with! Very disappointing for leggings that cost $128.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey mmcg13,\nI'm sorry to hear that your pant isn’t performing as expected and I'd love to look into some options. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 4, 2017'}

column5: These Things are the Real Deal
column6: I went into the store after these were first released and tried on a bunch of different leggings they had in stock. This particular pair were above and beyond their greatest pair in stock! I now own a black and a garnet pair. They are SO comfortable, and honestly I would wear them every day if that wouldn't be frowned upon. As a wedding videographer they are my FAVORITE pair to wear under dresses because of the handy pocket and how incredibly comfy they are. I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because my first pair picked pretty badly. I followed the washing instructions to a T and ended up taking them back in and an associate replaced them for me. But, I bought my garnet pair shortly thereafter, so it didn't prevent me from buying again! They really are the best.

I gave these leggings two stars because they are hands down the most comfortable leggings I've ever worn. I purchased them a month ago and 3 washes in, they've started to pill along all seam lines. Per the instructions I was given when I purchased them in-store, I wash them inside out, on cold, only with other workout clothes, and hang to dry. I took them into the store today and am even more disappointed with the associate's response than I am with the pants themselves. Even though I explained my care process, she tried insinuating that I was washing them incorrectly. While she proceeded to admit that the pilling should not be happening, she said that there was nothing she could do since the thread wasn't unraveling. She then TOOK OUT SCISSORS from a drawer and started to cut off all the pills. For leggings this expensive, I don't exactly find that to be a helpful solution.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey mrshester,\nI hear your disappointment with the performance of your Fast And Free 7/8 Tight II and will be following up with an email so I can dig into this with you.\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 31, 2017'}

column6:
I am a huge lululemon buff and my wardrobe is filled with lululemon items. However this time, I am greatly disappointed with this purchase.
The material of this pair of leggings are very soft and comfortable but when working out, I found myself often pulling them up!
I have never faced this problem with other lululemon leggings.
It's embarrassing to keep pulling them up even for low intensity workouts!

Hi everyone,
Just a quick note to let you know that the Fast and Free leggings stretch out and the stitching is very weak. I tried running in the last pair that I purchased and was tugging to keep them up the entire time. I have not lost any weight so that was not the problem. I would stay away from this brand.
column15: they stretched out and stitching is coming undone.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Sparty123,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 30, 2017'}

column5: Nice material but gets dirty so easily
column6: I have worn these pants maybe 5x now - I have washed them 2x and hang them to try - I have not had problems (yet) with them unraveling or pilling, however I will say the material, as nice as it feels, attracts so much dirt and debris. They also collect lint from other clothes or anything when you wash them as well. The material is really nice against the skin - it is silky smooth and cool to the touch. I do think they wick moisture - I wore them while running in the rain and they did well. They kept me feeling warm also. They have gotten a tad bigger, maybe, but it isn't that noticeable. Some reviews say they stretch out so badly but I haven't seen that yet. I hope these stay as they are and don't start unraveling like other people said - I was scared to wear these after I read the reviews. I just feel like I need to baby these pants.

I have been a long term loyal customer of Lululemon that has bought many amazing pants, but I must say the fast and free is my favorite. They are light weight, fitted, smooth as butter, and they make my booty look good!! All my friends that I have recommended them too love them too!

column5: My Most Disappointing Purchase From Lulu.
column6: I tried these on at my local Lulu store and FELL IN LOVE. They were the most expensive ones I tried on, but I bought them anyways because they were so incredibly comfortable!! Because I paid almost $135 for them after taxes, when I bought them I had high expectations. I wore them maybe twice before the seams started to pill! I am so disappointed in the quality of these leggings. I have several other pairs, and none of them have pilled like these have. For $135, I expected these to be the best leggings ever. I was sorely disappointed with the quality of this product. DO NOT BUY THESE if you want them to look great for a long time. The store representative ensured me that these leggings would last me for years and years, but I have now had them for about a month and I am about to throw them away because the pilling has made them look so trashy. I love Lulu, but this was a terribly made product. Very disappointing. Don't buy!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey lalalane,\nWe hear your disappointment with the pilling you're experiencing on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can dig into this with you.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 30, 2017'}

column6: When I tried these on, I fell in love with the feel of the fabric and fit. But, the first time I wore these pants -- just to run errands -- the seam on the leg unraveled in the first hour. I took these to the store and the seamstress repaired them. Now, the entire seam on the rear has completely unraveled, again from gentle use. SO DISAPPOINTING. I love all of my other lulu pants and of course the most expensive ones I own fall apart :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey laruff1,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 26, 2017'}

column5: Love these leggings, but the pockets pill!
column6: I LOVE these leggings. They are so flattering on my body type (strong legs and booty) because they have just the right amount of seaming so they cover up flaws. I am also short (5'4") so I can wear them right out of the store without hemming them. However, the material where you slide your hand to get into the pockets pill very quickly which does change the appearance of the pants and something I wouldn't expect from Lulu. I keep buying them...I am on my third pair! I can't bring myself to CrossFit in them, so when I retire them from work wear, they go to the gym!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ey28,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 26, 2017'}

column6: I absolutely loved these pants upon trying them on in store. They slide on so easily and the material feels amazing, however, don't let this initial impression fool you. I have only worn these leggings 3 times and there is already a pull in the material on the front of the thigh. I am very disappointed in this quality, seeing that any other leggings I have purchased from lululemon have exceeded my expectations and held up so well. Will be returning to my wunder unders and not be wearing these anymore. Such a shame because they were so cute and have barely been worn!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey bella435,\nOh no! I'm sorry to hear you've noticed pulls on your gear. I definitely hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and help.\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 25, 2017'}

column5: Loved this pant but white piling on the black material was a big disappointment!
column6: I absolutely loved the fit and comfort of these pants. They are my absolute favorite lulu pants. I could not believe, however, that after 2 wears (handwash, no tumble dry), they started piling and I could see white specks of elastic fabric on the seams. I was very disappointed because i wanted these pants to last. It was something I was not expecting at this price level.
column15: poor material did not last long
