column6: These pants feel like butter and are great on. But after 1 wear and no washes the seams are unraveling. I was deciding between two pants, and clearly I chose the wrong pair. For this price this should not happen. A very disappointed lulu customer.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Krkeller32,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II isn’t holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 25, 2017'}

column5: Fabric is perfection, but the seams are falling apart
column6: The seams around the ankle and the inner thigh are beginning to fray and come apart after only owning them for a month and wearing them no more than 4 times. Upon examining them closely, it seems like the type of thread used is just kind of "fluffy" (for a lack of a better term?) and don't seem as durable. Sooo sad because I absolutely love the Nulux fabric. My align II pants have never had any seam issues in the over year I've owned them as I wash my leggings gently and always lay flat to dry.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi losangeleslulu,\nI'm sorry to hear you're experiencing seam issues with your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II. We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 24, 2017'}

column6: These are the best pants Lulu has ever made! They stay put high on my waist during any and every exercise sesision, and they feel amazing. It truly feels like a second skin. The pockets are perfectly placed and I can't live without them! Great job Lulu, please continue making these in a variety of solid colors!!! My only complaint is that on one of my pairs the seam is unraveling big time. I wash all of my Lulu items properly, separately in cold water, and I hang dry. I am very upset about this because I am so in love with these pants and afraid they might not be wearable soon. Lulu please help!

I bought these pants two months ago. I wash them on cold and hand dry. The seams have already started fraying where the pockets are and today I noticed a hole on the pants. The material is very thin and these are definitely not worth the money.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey cyclist101,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 24, 2017'}

column6: I bought these pants a few months ago and I was very excited because it was my first lulu purchase. After my first wear, I noticed a seam had come loose, so I fixed it myself. Now, there are two seams loose and the right side began pilling. I have only worn them to school three times, and I have tried to take care of them by hand-washing them and drying them on a rack. I really wanted to love these pants, the fabric is so soft and lightweight, but I am disappointed in the quality. This is the only pair of lulu leggings that has fallen apart on me.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Sarasch,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 23, 2017'}

column6: Loved the feel of these, Nulux is amazing! Super light and comfortable but after two wears the seams are fraying and almost unraveling. I've only washed them once and I'm scared that to since I don't want them to get any worse. These pants aren't cheap which I'm normally fine with since lululemon has great quality but I would not recommend these.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey A101,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 23, 2017'}

column6:
I fell in love with these pants and I am STILL in love with them after nearly a year.
Mind you, I have over ten pairs and so I never wear the same pair more than once every couple of weeks; in which case, I have not had any of the wearing out problems that others seem to complain about. I also turn them inside out, put them in a garment bag, use dri-fit wash in cold water, and hang them to dry...
(Yes, time consuming - hence the ten plus pairs so I don't do laundry as often)
It is true, that I need to use the drawstring to hold them up after a while but that is what it's there for! I LOVE these and highly recommend them. The sizing for the newer version may be a little off, compared to the prior version, so I recommend going to the store to try them on. (They have a teeny bit more of the naked sensation which may cause you to need to size down, which I had to do for the crops but not the 7/8)
Anyway...that's my two cents.

When i first tried these in store, I had to get them because they feel like BUTTER!!!! The thing i was skeptical about was that it doesn't have any seams by the ankles so it almost looks like the pants were never completed. With that said, they rise up. Many people did say that about these pants but I purchased anyway since the staff said it wasn't going to be a problem! I find myself constantly having to pull them down and is unflattering when it starts to bunch up. No thank you!

Absolutely loved these pants at first, incredibly soft and sleek. Fit like a glove, super lightweight, sweat-wicking, and stayed in place. After the second wear, they became extremely loose and I could feel the material pulling away from my skin with every move I made. The stitching was snagged or falling out in every seam. These were my favorite pants for about a week, and now I don't even like wearing them because they fall down. Super disappointed! I really hope Lulu makes a new and improved version.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey misfitmelinda,\nThanks so much for taking the time to follow up on your Fast & Free Tight II. An email is coming your way so we can dig into the retention loss and unraveling seams you've noticed.\nChat soon", 'LL_response_date': 'October 20, 2017'}

column6: Super lightweight, pockets are in the perfect location and don't cause the pants to fall when my phone is there, perfect length. For ref. I am 5 feet, 105 pounds and a size 2 fits perfectly. Super high waisted which I love and feels amazing when I workout.

column5: Wanted to love but fell apart after one wear :(
column6: I bought these a week and a half ago after trying them on in the store. They didn't have the size/color combo I wanted so I ordered online, which I most often do because I can rarely actually make it into the store and the shipping is always fast. I got the aeon color which is like a dark purple (hard to tell from the photos online because they look like a dark navy but they are in fact more purple-ish). I have probably 15+ pairs of lulu leggings and I instantly loved the fit and the nulux fabric of these pants. They truly fit like a second skin, are really stretchy and provide coverage but feel like you are wearing nothing which is exactly how I like my workout pants. Unfortunately I wore these one time and washed them according to instructions as I do with all my lulu's, laid flat to dry, and when I went to put them on to wear for a second time I noticed the stitching across the butt was almost completely unraveled for about 8 inches across. I am so sad because I loved these pants! However, I am pretty upset since I literally just bought these and this is the most I have paid for any pair of lulu pants. They should definitely hold up longer than 1 wear (where all I did was run in them) and 1 wash (which was exactly as instructed)! What is even worse is that when I looked at the receipt that came with these pants, it is mismarked and says that I ordered then on 5-10-17, so I anticipate they are going to give me trouble if I try to take them back to the store thinking that I ordered these months ago when I just got them :( Please lulu get it together, I am a loyal fan but this is a bit ridiculous!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi klt08,\nThanks so much for taking the time to share your thoughts. Our designers are all ears when it comes to feedback. I'm sorry to hear the stitching is unraveling on your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II. We’ve sent through an email so we can learn more about your experience and look into some options.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 18, 2017'}

column6:
naked feeling
no pilling
perfect fit.
these tights are it.
PLUS POCKETS!

The style, cut and feel of these tights is the most comfortable and best ever! I'm a longtime lulu customer and have had countless tights and crops over the years and these are by far my all time favorite. The fabric is SO comfy smooth and soft, yet still able to give you support. Fabric and cut are not constricting or pinching in any areas. Love the high waist of course which prevents any muffin top, and really like the unfinished hem because it's so smooth, and doesn't rub, yet the pants stay in place without riding up. (I also have all the crops in this style and the hem on those can sometimes ride up since its closer to your knee, but they're still not uncomfortable. and I actually prefer the crop length). Big plus -- these pants also are not see through! Despite the light feel when you put them on, the fabric actually feels and looks like a more dense weave than many luxtreme pants and I haven't found this nulux fabric to be see through at all, even on the lighter prints (haven't tried the lighter solids so I can't comment on that). And POCKETS! A definite plus and what made me try them in the first place. The pants also stay in place and don't slip or require tugging during workout, even doing burpees. There is an elastic drawcord at the waist if you need to cinch, but it doesn't really seem necessary. Fit TTS, always get my usual size 6. 7/8 length is great, not too long, flattering, comfortable and functional length. I did experience some fraying on the pocket stitching of an early pair of crops in this style, but the stitching/thread now used seems to be less fuzzy and haven't had that problem recently. Hopefully this style & fabric never go away and lulu offers more fun patterns!

I got these leggings and absolutely loved them.... at first. They fit perfectly and really did have the naked sensation feeling, but after two wears and 0 washes.... the stitching is just absolutely falling apart. It started unraveling in the butt and the thighs. I'm extremely disappointed. Especially for $128 they should be practically be invincible. Saddened by the quality of my lulus and hope that I can either be refunded or a new pair will be sent since I contacted customer service.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey megnicole,\nI’m sorry to hear you’re experiencing unraveling seams with your gear. Please know we stand behind the quality of our gear and I’d love to dig into this with you. Hang tight for an email coming your way!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 17, 2017'}

column6:
I have a medical issue that causes my skin to hurt & easily bruise. Finding fabric and compression that feels good & doesn’t irritate my skin is a challenge. After one 30 minutes ride, the bend behind my knees will have bruises from where my tights scrunch up when peddling. These are the only tights that make my skin feel good & don’t cause me bruising or skin issues. Super light fabric, low compression.
But, I have to agree with other reviewers, the threading comes loose easily. I returned a pair after the threads on the front seam came loose. The girl in the store said “we’ll you can’t yank them up when you put them on!” OMG...seriously? She acted like I was an idiot who didn’t know how to properly care for clothing, or get dressed.
Anyway, I swapped them out for a new pair & bought the cropped ones also. So far so good.....
I sized down 1 size
column9: SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, CA, USA

column6: These leggings are my first lululemon purchase and I couldn't be happier. They fit perfectly (I'm 5'5 and 115 lbs and I went with a size 2) and are so so comfy. They are also super flattering. My only complaint is that I can't wear any other brand of leggings now because they just aren't as good as these. If you are on the fence about getting these: GO FOR IT! They are 100% worth the price and you will not regret it!

I have no idea why I waited so long to try these on; but once I did, it was love at first try-on! Nulux is my absolute go-to material for pants. I'm a shorts gal when the weather is warm, so I'm always reluctant to pull out the pants....I get hot. I was told by a lulu educator to try them, and she was right, I could tell they were gonna be perfection. I have since bought 5 pairs, and will definitely be adding to the collection. I must add, I remember when lulu released its first un-hemmed pants, I believe last year, and I remember some reviewers not liking it; can I say, I find it very flattering, because the pants lay nice and smooth against the skin.....it just looks clean. I find them TTS. I am 5'3, 120-125lbs, and bought my normal size 4. Other reviewers seem to have had a problem with the stitching, but I haven't found that to be the case. I wash with my other lulu's, and hang to dry.

column5: First time I have been disappointed with a Lulu Product
column6: I own over 20+ lululemon leggings and this is the first pair I am upset with. I put them in the color 'psychic.' They are so comfortable, but when working out you could see my sweat in the places you do not want to see sweat. I was embarrassed by this especially because they are $128. I have never experienced this issue and I am always one to buy different colors. It is disappointing because they are cute on but NOT for working out when that is what they are for. Very disappointed.

The seam on the butt started fraying and getting fuzzy the first time I wore the pants. I sent them in and got them repaired. I wore them again and the same thing happened. I have 2 pairs of these pants and it only happened to one of them. Disappointed. ):
column14: really good fit and super soft
column15: that i can't send them back and get a new pair
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Bayarea,\nI’m sorry to hear you’re experiencing fraying with your gear. Please know we stand behind the quality of our gear and I’d love to dig into this with you. Hang tight for an email coming your way!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 17, 2017'}

column6: I had only tried the 31" Wunder Under's before this pant. So when I tried these, I fell in love with the fabric and the look and the length!!! They are so cute on and I love the pockets. I agree with reviewers that say Lulu needs to have better stitching. How is it that all of my other brand yoga pants don't unravel? Your stitching always unravels! It's crazy. 5'8" 115lbs and got a size 4.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi NSS426,\nWe stand by the quality of our gear and we’d like to make this right. Keep an eye on your inbox, as we’ll be reaching out shortly to get the ball rolling on a solution for you.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 14, 2017'}

column6: This guest did not provide a text review.

I got these about a week ago and when I tried them on in the store they were perfect! They fit just right and are the perfect 7/8 length for me. I loved all the pockets and the reflective material along the bottom, and this material does not pill at all! However, after wearing them just twice and never having washed them yet, the stitching around groin has begun to start unraveling and fraying. I've never had this happen before, and am pretty disappointed about it.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey runnergirl2854,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 13, 2017'}

column6: These were my absolute favorite lulu leggings of all time, so much so that i bought them in the crops too... but they are starting to pill and the seams are starting to pull and unravel... I am so sad... I've only had then for a couple months, with less than 1 wear per week and always wash on delicate and lay flat to dry...such a sad day to have to retire my favorite lulus after less than 10 wears....

column6: I CANNOT EXPRESS HOW MUCH I LOVE THESE PANTS! They are so light and truly make me feel like I'm not wearing them. They are great for long runs or running to class. I highly recommend them; they are worth the price.

column5: Love, but wish they were more durable
column6: I love the fabric and fit of these pants. I am a distance runner and am always looking for pants that stay put and have lots of pockets. These pants fit the bill and even had some reflective hits which is always great. But the fabric is not very durable. After a trail run I must have snagged them on something as there are 2 holes in the knee now. I was super bummed because I have been lulu pant girl for years and never had a pair of pants rip before like this. This was also the most I had ever spent on a pair of running pants so I was super disappointed that they ripped so easily. Now there are two holes in the knee that I fear will start to run because of the fabric and deem these pants unusable in the near future. I got these in the nouveau mach blue black pattern and I never buy patterns. Such a bummer.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey foxinsox,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 11, 2017'}

column6: I loved these tights at first - they fit great and the pockets are awesome. However, after wearing them ONCE, I already noticed snags in the fabric on the thigh. A few months go by, there's several more snags in the same area, and there's a hole on the butt - I can't even wear them anymore. I'm incredibly disappointed in the quality of these pants, seeing as how I paid $128 for them, assuming they'd be durable and high quality, and was only able to wear them for a few months.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey RACHAAAEL,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 10, 2017'}

column6: I love these. I love the pockets. They hold my phone, keys, whatever without sagging (even on long runs). They are literally a game changer. I also love the drawstring. I keep the pants undone when I am running around town, but as soon as I hit the pavement or treadmill, I draw them up real tight so nothing moves around. Also love the high waist. I am 5'8 and they do not go down to my ankle, but about 5 inches above. These are amazing!!!

I adore these pants. I'm 5'4, and they just hit my ankle which is the perfect length for me. I wear them for running and hot yoga as well as out and about to class and errands and they've held up really well. Wish I weren't a broke grad student so I could afford a few more pairs!
So comfy and very flattering.

I LOVED the fit, style, and feel of these pants at first. However, after a couple wears, the seams have totally frayed!! Also, there is a strange patch of pilling on the butt that has just showed up out of nowhere. I wash the leggings alone, air dry them, and I am very careful with them. I thought that these leggings would be durable and last a long time but they have disappointed in that department. That being said, I still love how they feel and the way they look. I hope Lulu can fix these pants!!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey runninggalpal,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 5, 2017'}

column6: I wanted to love these pants so bad. Everything was perfect about them, the length was great, the pockets are perfect, and the material is great. I asked two associates about the hem on them and they assured me that they would not fray because this material is not woven so there is no possibility that the hem would fray. I wore these pants one time for four hours of running and washed them per the directions with hang drying them. The seams are fraying and unraveling already. I've worn them so it is unlikely that I will be able to return them to the store. I also bought these in crop version but have not taken the tags off. I am so upset that I wasted my money on these.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey emh2110,\nOh no! We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 5, 2017'}

column6: I really loved these pants when I tried them on at the store, but after wearing them once the seam was snagged. I was so disappointed, I paid a lot of money for these. They fit and feel great, but the seam was my only problem with them.

column6: I got these pants a week ago as a gift and I put them on and fell in love. A few hours later I realized the seams on the thigh were snagged and I was very disappointed. The first time wearing them and they are snagged. I overall love the pants besides that. I wish the seams were more intact because each time I put them on the snag becomes bigger and stretches more.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Eliza123,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 3, 2017'}

column6:
Love these tights. Very comfortable and soft but hold you in ... I could wear these all day.
I've had so many compliments, even from my husband, who never notices what I wear to workout.

column5: Worn one time and pant seam ruined
column6: Got these pants yesterday and wore them for the first time today. The pant seam has already started to fray and certain areas of the pant have started to pill. The only thing I have done in the pants is walk a couple of miles!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey AllyD12345,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 3, 2017'}

column6: I want to love these pants because they are very comfortable for running, but unfortunately the stitching on the outside pockets and on the inner thigh is already coming apart after a few months. For $128 I would expect them to be more durable.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey CCos,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II isn't holding up as expected. Please feel free to give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 to continue this conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 2, 2017'}

column6: I love the FnF! I regularly rotate between these and the Tight Stuff Tight. I choose these when I need a little more forgiveness. Aside from athletics, these are also the most comfortable pants I've ever worn while traveling.

These pants are so sleek! Love the reflective detail and wear them at least once a week! I guess that's the problem though. I wear them too often? The knee area is so stretched out. I am constantly pulling up the pants because they don't grip my leg like they did when I first bought them. I wash and hang dry with the rest of my lululemon and everything else has held up so well. I just wish these held their shape a bit better.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey MV310,\nYikes! We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 26, 2017'}

column6:
So the FnF 1.0 - I had issues with unraveling but since lulu is so good about standing behind the quality of their product, I moved into the 2.0 version and am not looking back. I have about 5 pairs of these and love them so much, I actually get excited when they are coming up in the rotation (I keep my tights in a cycle so I wear them out uniformly). I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews but these are like a heaven-sent from the sweat gods that understand you just need something that will keep you cool, chafe free, and keep the sweat away from your body when you packing in the extra training time. I have these in a 6 and that is my standard size and have zero issues.
A word of advice though - if you are trying to accomplish a hard workout where buckets of sweat are going to be an issue, don't get the lighter colors. I know there are some tights out there, where sweaty butt angels aren't noticeable but these are not the tights to wear in the lighter colors.

column5: Best tights for running AND yoga
column6:
I used to go running in Nike tights that had a large zipped pocket in the back and to wear different tights for yoga because zips aren't great when you're lying on your back. These pants are not only comfortable, but they hold my phone (iPhone 6) well during my runs (I use the back pocket for the phone and the side ones for keys and ATM card), and the lack of zippers make them perfect for yoga too. They do a great job at handling sweat (they don't smell and dry quickly) and the pattern (dotted gray/lavender colour) is a bit different. I just hope they go on sale so I can justify getting a second pair.
For reference, I am 5'10 and got a 4. The leg probably hits a bit my ankle above shorter women but I don't mind.

I would have to say that I wouldn't recommend these pants to a friend due to the pilling on the seams and wear on the fabric I've noticed. I have these pants in navy and in the vibrant jungle green and black print. I decided to keep my usual size in these pants, although several of the sales assistants indicated that you could downsize with this material. The NULUX feels amazing on and is so smooth to the touch. However, over the course of a few months I've noticed the seams have pilled around the ankles as well as other friction spots. Additionally, just having my iPhone in the pocket on a few runs have made a worn spot on the fabric! WHAT!??!?!?! I have pants that are several years old in the Luxtreme fabric that have never had this problem. For the higher price tag you would hope the fabric and seams would hold up better.
The cut is awesome! I also love the fact that the pant although designed for running, doesn't have a zipper on the back so I can transition to mat work without a painful zipper poking me.
Please make these pants in the Luxtreme fabric! Love you Lululemon!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey WunderUnderWoMOM,\nWe're sorry to hear of the disappointment with the performance of your Fast And Free Tight II and will be sending an email your way to follow up and help.\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 26, 2017'}

column6:
I fell in love with these when I tried them on the first time.
I normally do not invest in leggings but wanted a more durable one.
I chose lululemon because my friend told me that their leggings are so comfy and last long.
But what a disappointment. Only after one wash, the seams started to get fuzzy.
I did not even tumble dry them. I have seen a number of reviews about faltering quality. Why aren't they doing something about it?
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey moimoi,\nOh my, I'm sorry to hear of the seam issue you're experiencing, and I definitely understand your frustration. We're eager to work out a resolution, so I'm sending you an email to chat more. ", 'LL_response_date': 'September 24, 2017'}

column6: When I first bought these about a month ago I loved them! They looked so sleek and they fight very well. I loved the "naked sensation". After about 4 washes they have started piling and the inner seam is even starting to rip a little. I expected much higher quality for these leggings and am very disappointed that they are not lasting as long as my other lulu leggings have.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey lemonlife,\nThanks for touching base with us. Oh no—pilling is not what we like to hear, and we stand behind the quality of our gear 100%. We're all over a resolution for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 20, 2017'}

column6: I tried these leggings on back in February and have been absolutely in love with them ever since. I've been saving up since then, since then cost $128, and was finally able to purchase them last week. Super comfortable and feel amazing, and I was so excited, but in just DAYS, they have somehow stretched out to the point where they just feel like garbage wearing them because they feel like they are constantly falling down. I am so, so disappointed, as i waited for so long to finally afford these and $128 later and they feel horrible. (Also, I haven't even washed them yet, so it's not like I washed them incorrectly.)
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey bulldog17,\nWe're sorry to hear of the disappointment with the performance of your Fast And Free Tight II and will be sending an email your way to follow up to help.\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 20, 2017'}

column5: Comfortable but the seams are getting fuzzy already
column6: I really love the feel of these pants. However, a month into wearing them the seams have started pilling and getting fuzzy. It's a very expensive legging for this to be happening so quickly specially if we take care of it.. a little disappointing
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Lubsb,\nSorry to hear that your Fast And Free Tight II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 20, 2017'}

column6: Went for a mountain trek in these pants. Several hours, a few butt slides on a few rocks and thistles, some class 3 traversing and no pilling, no holes and they stayed up. Granted I had compression shorts underneath, but still I wasn't pulling these tights up as I ran. On a huge plus side they advertise that they keep you cool, they do that, but they also keep you warm being up at , up at 14,000+ ft with no extra layers and just these pants. I was plenty. Just wash inside out and hang dry and they will last!
column14: they survived being dragged across rocks!

column6: I got these pants in store in the army green color. I love the fit and look of them. The stitching is very flattering and I love the pockets. However after the 3rd wash, and I never dry, the seams started pilling and getting fuzzy. The pants used to look so clean and sleek but now look old. I was very exited to upgrade from my alight pant but I have to say that they have held up better. I was so excited when I first got these pants and now I am disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Sophie1010,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 15, 2017'}

column6: I have had these pants for about 6 months now and they have noticeably stretched out, you can only tie them so much before the tie becomes uncomfortable. Im not sure if thats expected after 6 months of wear but I'm disappointed i spent almost 150 on pants that ended up stretching so much. They were good at first tho I guess.....but unfortunately I had the same issue with the tight stuff tight. Not sure if Lululemon's quality is diminishing but overall i am unsatisfied.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey simmer,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 13, 2017'}

column6: I bought these pants and they ripped very easily just from a few wears. I had only worn them a couple times and had not even washed them yet and they tore. I am very disappointed in these pants and Lululemon, for creating a product that is so expensive but poor quality.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey HH123,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 12, 2017'}

column5: These are falling apart after 3 wears
column6: I just purchased these 7/8 pants a few weeks ago, have worn them 3 times and the seams are pilling and falling apart. I paid $128 for HORRIBLE quality pants that can't even last through 3 workouts. When I called in to Lululemon, customer service was awful, the only option they gave me was to wait for a return label, send my pants in, wait for a gift card to get sent to my house, and then re-order the pants which will take several weeks to process and receive a new pair. They also gave me no option to return for a full refund, only a gift card. Needless to say I will NEVER purchase Lululemon again and I will tell everyone I know not to buy from them. When you pay that much for a pair of workout pants you expect them to last and if not, you at least expect customer service to handle the situation in a better manner. Don't waste your money on $128 pants, they are terrible quality and won't last
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey INLO,\nWe hear your disappointment with the pilling and fraying seams you're experiencing on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can dig into this with you.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 13, 2017'}

column6: After much internal debate with myself, I finally splurged on a pair of lulus. As a first pair, I have converted and am a believer. Great fit and material!! However, after a couple wears, the stitching along the sides are becoming undone which makes me a little sad.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey tunafishie,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 12, 2017'}

column6: I have bought lots of items in the past, but this quality was very disappointing. I had worn these two times and when I washed them the fabric was ripped on the thigh. I have washed others in the past in the same manner and this time I really did not think the fabric quality was up to par..
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey erinburgess,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 12, 2017'}

column6: I love love love the feel of these pants!! They really are buttery and feel as though they are almost not even there. That said, i an extremely disappointed with the seams on the pants :( after not even days, HOURS, the stitching at the sides first came off complete;y and are now fraying. I didn't eve do physical activities, literally was just sitting in the car for a few hours. really sad because these are literally the best feeling pair of leggings I have owned and considering the $128+tax price tag....
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Vmos,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free Tight II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 6, 2017'}

column6: These pants are made with the most comfortable lulu material yet! They are so comfortable and have just the right amount of compression to create what I think is the best fit of any lulu tight I've owned. I own these in 3 different colors and will be coming back for more!

column5: Best pants so far for hot weather!
column6: This is my favorite legging of all time! I write this review in the hopes that people will give these a try. I have over 20 pairs of lulus (and various other brands) and have tried all evolutions of their leggings and crops for over 10 years. Each fabric and style has pluses and minuses - but this legging does it all. Flattering, comfortable, cute details on the ankles - really the best legging so far. First, you have to feel the fabric - it is REALLY buttery soft. They say that this has that "naked" feeling - I prefer a bit of feeling hugged - so I sized down from my usual 8 to a 6 with no issues. The thing that is really spectacular on these ones (as opposed to the 'all the right places' or 'tight stuff') this has a kind of side seam (you can see it in the pictures) that keeps any thigh imperfections to a minimum. This is important because these thinner fabrics (I am looking at you nulu used in the pushing limits crop) are cooler for hot temps - but don't leave a lot to the imagination. This 7/8 pant - I have the black, black with white dots and the green leopard-y looking one - is my number one favorite pant from lulu of all time. I have had no issues with the seams. I machine wash with tide pure and hang dry. EVERY time. Stays in place while running and I don't bother to tie the drawstring. Keeps you cool. Really a great legging. Thank you lulu!!!

I bought these pants last week and wore them for the first time on a 10 mile run. Even with my heavy phone in the side pocket these pants didn't move at all for the whole run. The waistband stayed in place and I didn't have to worry about pulling them up at all. I washed them with no problems and then wore them for a boxing class and they worked great.

I purchased these pants in store about a little over a week ago after falling in love with the lavender printed pair. I was advised by the sales associate to order my normal size even though the waist was supposed to stretch out a little bit. I wore these pants to class, to weights, and to cardio and they performed beautifully. They did show sweat stains but it wasn't a big deal to me. Throughout the day I could feel the pants stretch a little but overall they stayed in place throughout my very active day. However, when I went to was these pants, following lulu's washing instructions to a T like always, I took them out of the washer to find that the seams had already begun to unravel. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED, this is totally unacceptable for a pair of $128 leggings.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey jojorows,\nWe're sorry to hear you're experiencing unraveling seams with your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II. We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 30, 2017'}

column6: I bought these pants in black just this past weekend, and was so excited, as they seemed like they could easily transition between yoga and running. I put them on this morning before a run, and realized that in natural sunlight, the pattern on my undergarments was completely visible! I was so sad, as I was looking forward to wearing these! Fortunately, I hadn't taken the tags off yet, so they have to go back to the store this week : ( So bummed... but I can't justify $128 pants that I am nervous to wear.
I wore my pants twice, had not even washed it, seams are coming off, its insane for the price point, will never purchase another pants from lululemon if they keep this up.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey walkie,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended. Please feel free to give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 to continue this conversation.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 28, 2017'}

column6: When i first got these I RAVED about them; they were my absolute favorite leggings ever. But after having them for a few months they have stretched out so much that I can't even walk around without having to constantly pull them up. I am very disappointed because I loved these leggings and now i can't even wear them anymore. I wash them according to the instructions so there is no reason they should be this loose after less than a year of wear.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Jpakey,\nYikes! We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 25, 2017'}

column6: This is the second pair of fast and free tights I have - I have one full length and I recently bought these. After two workouts, the seam in the back became unraveled and some of the other seams showed signs of weakening as well. I'm SO disappointed especially for the price tag I paid on these. If this is the quality of lulu products now, I will definitely no longer be shopping here.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Workoutgurl,\nWe hear your disappointment and will be following up to lend a helping hand with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 25, 2017'}

column5: The best Lululemon Pants I have ever owned
column6: These are by far my most favorite pair of lulu leggings. They are so comfortable and soft, while still holding you in. The additional pockets are perfect to hold your phone while at the gym or on a run. They are insanely comfortable to work out in and I haven't felt like they have stretched out. I need these in every color!

These are my most favorite pair of workout pants. I am a size 4 in most my LLL gear. I have about five different pairs of pants from top to bottom and I bought three of this one. They are soft and breathable during my workouts. My initial pair of pants was a size 4 and found that it was slightly loose but still comfortable. When I went back to buy my other two, I opt for size 2 and they fit wonderfully.

Just bought these yesterday and was looking forward to bringing these to college with me next week, but they didn't even last a day. They began to unravel this morning in the back. Luckily I'm still able to return them because they aren't worth the 128$ I paid for them.

column5: My name is daydesire, and I am a Fast and Free tight addict
column6:
These are so great! I love these pants! The fabric is extremely soft and you feel free to move. My favorite features are the pockets, the string to keep these from falling off, and feel of the fabric. The bottom of the pants just ends....it's magic! There is no seam, nothing. I have these in three colors, and always new patterns and colors.
One small note from my experience with constant wear and tear during workouts (weight listing/yoga/dance, etc.) is that some specific colors pile. Specifically, I own these in nocturnal teal (which is by the way my first and favorite color so far in these tights), and it has bunch of places that have pilled. I did not experience (yet? or will not at all?) pilling in other colors.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about the pilling of your pant. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 18, 2017'}

column6: I like these leggings. They are comfortable and very flattering, however I have come across a few problems. I am usually a size 6 in all other lulu leggings, but these are just way too big. If I try to tighten the elastic at the waistband to help prevent them from sliding down, the elastic seams rip out from the hole and I have to push it back in every time. I have washed them only once and there already seems to be pilling at the seams which is earlier then expected considering my others never pilled that fast. I love the feeling and high quality look these leggings show and would consider keeping them if I was able to get a size down.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Jillllybean,\nYikes! Sorry to hear that your Fast And Free Tight II aren't holding up—literally. Expect an email in your inbox from us, so we can chat and find you an option that works.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 15, 2017'}

column5: Dreamy Material with some flaws to beware of
column6:
I adore this material and love the outline of this pant's design. I like that the gusset/ inner thigh area doesn't have the strange seam that the Run the Day 7/8 had. I got them in black and I love this pant except for the dots on the lower hem.
The material is soft as a baby seal. However, I regret that the sales associate at the store where I purchased it did not inform me that I should size down. The darn pants have already stretched out. I washed them once so far in cold water and tumble dry low for 20 minutes then hung them to dry. I wish I had gone down a size so badly because I love the pants and for this price, I feel burned. Train times, not nulux but made of luxtreme is also a great pant but keeps its size and doesn't stretch. I'm finding that my lululemon pants shopping has the same challenges as denim. The product is pricey but nice and is a staple of my wardrobe, but I need to know all the info prior t buying so I don't end up with baggy portions on my pants. I wish I could exchange these but alas, I have washed them.
Again, love the pants just want to say it's wise to size down by 1. I love that you can put them in the dryer as well.
column15: sizing is deceptive due to strech factor of nulux
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Nazanin,\nOh dear. We don't love the sounds of your Fast And Free Tight II stretching out on you. We'd love to hear more about your experience and how we can turn things around. Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 15, 2017'}

column6: I purchased these in the store without reading reviews first and I defiantly wish I would have! These pants have already snagged and pilled. Are the comfortable, yes but they constantly ride up in the legs around the calves and it drives me insane. As a new Mom I was so looking forward to having some comfortable and hassle free leggings to do everything in and now I find myself with my hands full and constantly having to stop what I am doing and readjust and pull the legs of these leggings down. Such a bummer and sooo expensive for a product with these problems. I would say they run true to size and the fabric is very comfy.

I don't think this quality can deserve over $100. I feel so disappointed about this pant now...

column6: I have owned multiple pairs of Lululemon leggings and this has been the only one that left me very unsatisfied with my purchase. Within a day of wear, the sides of these leggings began to have pills even though I have not gotten it caught next to anything. None of my leggings have ever done this so this made me very disappointed in my $128 purchase. Save yourself some money and buy another type from Lululemon unless they can solve this problem.

column6: I was extremely excited to purchase these as my first Lululemon pants. Upon trying them on, they felt AMAZING and I was super excited to work out in them. The price felt steep, especially considering I am a full-time graduate student, but I had saved my money in order to treat myself. After TWO wears and meticulously following wash instructions, the seams are unraveling and there is even a HOLE in the rear seam. Great. These will be my first and last purchase. So so so disappointed.

column6: I am so bummed! These leggings are super comfortable, but after only 2 wears (AND NO WASH!) they are already coming apart at the seam. When I spend $128 on leggings, I expect them to last!

column6: I am just getting back into working out and stocked up on these and a few other items at the store the other day. I LOVED these when I tried them on at the store, the fit and feel was great. That said, the first day I wore them I already had pilling. Very sad day indeed. I'd stick with some of the classics.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Tracy1234,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 15, 2017'}

column6:
I am hiking the Continental Divide Trail and chose these tights because the pockets were large enough to fit my compass, phone/maps, or any other miscellaneous items I need to access quickly. I liked the drawstring because I know I will lose quite a bit of weight and they overall are very comfortable and dry quickly.
Unfortunately they failed spectacularly as far a durability. They have snagged and torn repeatedly in the knees and really anywhere that touches the ground. The seams are unraveling as well, which surprised me because laundry is a rare luxury out here. Not many items can last an entire thru hike but I expected these to hold out for more than a quarter of the trail, especially for $130.
I've met people on trail who swear by Lululemon so I guess I just got unlucky. Maybe these would be good if I was lying around the house or running around a maintained metropark but they simply are not made for higher impact activities in rugged terrain.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi megasonic,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We’re sorry to hear that your pants aren’t holding up as expected. column6: LOVED the feel and fit of these pants but the material/quality is not worth the price. The material pilled only after a couple wears.

column5: The one time I should have listened to reviewers...
column6: I was really hesitant to purchase this item due to the negative reviews however, I gave Lulu the benefit of the doubt and decided to purchase them anyways (just like the aligns, which I do not regret one bit). Initially, I was extremely pleased with the buttery soft feel and the way they fit and conform to my body. I really thought that these would be my new go-to lulus for running & training and had even considered purchasing more! Now I am glad that I didn't because after my third wash, holy pilling! All around the waist line... definitely not worth what I paid!! So bummed because I really loved these. Btw, they fit true to size - I am 5' 1", 117lbs, athletic build - size 4 in wunder unders and got size 4 for these.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi mamav,\nI’m sorry to hear about the pilling that you’re experiencing with your Fast & Free Tight II. column6: I tried these on in the store today and INSTANTLY fell in love. I bought the navy color and it hides any imperfection you might have. I wear an 8 in the leggings and I bought these in an 8 also. they are so amazing, feel amazing, look amazing, and fit like a glove. absolutely perfect. hope fully I will be able to get more colors! they are so smooth and soft and they really do feel like butter. obsessed! also, I am a bit tall so they go maybe 3 inches above my ankle. I am 5'9".

I was marketed these pants as 'more durable' and good for weight lifting/ gym training. I have owned two pairs now, first tore at the knee very easily- wrote that off as user error. The second pair the seems were coming apart after one bikram class and one wash. Seems continued to fray to the point that I don't where them. Frustrated because I normally purchase the align or wunder under as they seem to hold up better and was convinced to purchase these just for them to fall apart after minimal use.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Namasteinsavasana,\nWe hear your disappointment with the fraying seams you've noticed on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can follow up and help.\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 4, 2017'}

column6: First off let me just say these are one of the comfiest lulus I have. But I was really disappointed with these pants. They are awfully made! The stitching is falling apart on my pants and not just the seams, like the actual fabric is also coming undone. I love the pants but am not happy with quality. Would not recommend them for the amount they are selling them for!

column6: Normally i don't write reviews but I decided to share my opinion on these leggings. I've had these for a couple of weeks now and they are the best leggings I've ever owned. They don't ever fall down and fit like a glove. But after four wears the seams started coming out. I even hand washed them. If purchasing, be aware that the seams might become loose.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Maddie02,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 1, 2017'}

column6:
First off I ADORE this material and the high rise on it. As a weightlifter/crossfitter I have so many problems with tights falling down. WELL, NOT THESE!!. However, like everyone else, after a few wears, I had major stitch breakage and unraveling, as well as some pilling on/near the seams. I will send them in to be re-stitched by the seamstress, but I'm not sure it will help this problem from reoccurring.
So sad because this fit is literally my favorite of any lulu crop/tight that I own.

column6: I bought these pants with hopefullness that they would live up to the price. Unfortunately after 2-3 wears (worn during leisure time and never washed) the seams started to unravel. With the price of these pants I was expecting better quality from barely any wear. Its disappointing because I love the fit and feel of these pants. I only hope that I could get more wear out of them before they start to unravel completely.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Lulurf,\nSorry to hear that your Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'July 29, 2017'}

column6: Love the silky feel of these leggings but the seams are unraveling in the back. It started after the 2nd wear so I took them back to the store and they repaired the seam, which, by the way, doesn't look that great, but now it's happening again. So frustrating when they aren't exactly cheep. They also stretch out after about 30 min of wear. Want to love these and would buy another pair if it wasn't for the stitching, which appears to be an issue after reading other reviews.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey SamHam,\nI completely understand when your gear is not performing for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way so we can lend a helping hand.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 25, 2017'}

column6: The first time I wore this I was absolutely in love with it. I love the material it's super light and comfortable. I have since worn it a total of 4 times and now the stitching is unraveling in multiple places. It's too bad because I really like the fit of it. My other lulu pants that I've bought long before have outlasted this one and I wear that one at least once a week. I don't do any crazy activities only yoga. Super disappointed in this product.

column6:
I actually bought three pairs of these pants and i absolutely love them (at first!) They are very comfortable and light. I dont really mind paying for it being pricey but my only concern now is they start to unravel at the seams.I actually hand wash them with a soap just for dark colors only and it still pilled after all. I thought i was doing something wrong the first time i wash my first one thats why i bought two more and i was hoping the second and third will not have the same problem but it still did. Its weird that i have other Lululemon and this never happen.
I dont want to loose hope cause i really like them!

column6: I recently purchased these tights and fell IN LOVE with the Nulux material. I honestly don't think I have ever enjoyed another Lulu pant more... while they held up. On my second wear, I noticed unraveling in the seams of my pant. I'm super disappointed because I genuinely enjoy wearing these pants more than any other Lulu pant I own (and I own almost all of them) but the quick unraveling and fraying of the seams given the price tag had me more than a bit disappointed.

column6: I LOVED these pants as soon as I got them. Probably my favorite out of all my pairs. The material is perfect, and they fit very nice. But, as soon as I washed them the first time, the seams in the pocket started unraveling. I only wash my lulu clothes with other lulu clothes on cold. I left the unraveling unnoticed because I liked the pants too much. But then after the second wash, the waist band and almost all over the pants the seams were coming out. Very disappointed as I cannot wear them anymore. :(

column6: I bought these for myself on a recommendation from a friend, was so psyched and loved them the minute I put them on. First two wears were fantastic, no issues at all and they easily became my favorite pair of leggings. On the third wear, I noticed that the seams had begun to unravel. The unraveling became much worse when I took the leggings off and now I certainly can't wear them again for fear of making the hole worse. I've gone through many pairs of leggings from lululemon over the years and this was the first time I've ever had an issue. Suffice to say I'm slightly devastated :/

column6: I bought these about two months ago and only wear them when Im prepared to constantly pull them up. They are constantly falling down at the waistband when working out, and even lounging. I love the style and how they look, but it is frustrating that they didn't hold their shape after about two or three wears. I follow the washing instructions religiously with all my lulus, so it was disappointing to see these not hold up in such a short amount of time.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi barrebeaut,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We’re sorry to hear that your pants aren’t performing as expected. We stand by the quality of our gear and we’d like to make this right. Keep an eye on your inbox, as we’ll be reaching out shortly to get the ball rolling on a solution for you.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 19, 2017'}

column6: Absolutely Fantastic!! The fit of these tights holds everything in just right without being too tight or cutting into the waistline. The texture is a perfect blend of soft and thick.

I have 6 or 7 different tights, and these are my favorite yet. I bought my usual size 4 and they fit perfect. I was worried about running in them, as I didn't think there would be enough compression but I was wrong. These were great to run in, even in the hot summer evening. I will be ordering another pair!!!!

I would love to know what kinds of workouts people are doing to get these pants to snag and stitching to come undone. I've been buying LLL for over 6 years now and I've bought thousands of dollars worth of stuff throughout the years. I've slowed down my purchases considerably and I will be the first one to criticize LLL when they do something wrong. However, these pants are absolutely perfect. They are pricey, but to me they are worth the price. I have 3 pairs of the original version an one pair of the II version and all of them are outstanding. Sometimes I run in them but I use them primarily for crossfit and all of my pants are good as new. I was even vacuuming one time and a pair got sucked into the vacuum and I pulled and pried and they came out. Washed them and no signs of any tears or damage. The prints and dark solids also hide imperfections very well. Nulux is the best fabric ever. I also enjoy the unfinished hem because I sometimes get ankle muffin top and this prevents that. Please don't ever stop making these.....

column5: By far the best workout leggings I've ever owned!
column6: Please make these leggings forever! The length is just right, sweat wicking fabric feels amazing, pockets are large and positioned perfectly, waist is high but not too high. A+

I absolutely loved this pants when I first got them. I never tried a material liked this before, it's so breathable and light, almost like you're not wearing pants at all! But atlas, this pants did not last. By the first wash, I noticed unraveling at the seams. By the third wash, there was chaffing at multiple places and even more unraveling. I washed using cold water on the delicate cycle with ONLY other Lulu pants. I really wanted to love these pants but absolutely not worth the price with the quality you're getting.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Izoak,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. we’re sorry to hear that your pants aren’t holding up as expected. We stand by the quality of our gear and we’d like to make this right. Keep an eye on your inbox, as we’ll be reaching out shortly to get the ball rolling on a solution for you.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 12, 2017'}

column6: Comfort wise in my opinion can be compared to the Align 2 pants minus the annoying piling. The fabric feels pretty amazing and the fit is nice. I love when I don't have to tailor my lulu. I'm 4"11 and the length was just right. But if you're taller, it will look great on you! All things positive has its negative. My only issue was the seam around the waistline started to unravel all around my waist. When I wear a crop top or just a sports bra, you can see fuzzy seams that developed all around my waistline due to the seams that had unravel. At first when I saw the unraveling happen I didn't want to pull it so I just cut the small piece off with scissors. Then I wore them a couple more times and and MORE parts started to unravel. I eventually ended up with a collection of all the pieces I cut off. I had bought these for some time now and never washed them because I hardly wore them and I am now afraid to wash them. I don't even want to wear them anymore because due to more unraveling mess. I've experienced piling with lulu pants, and now I finally experienced unraveling seams with lulu pants :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi mtn416,\nYikes, we're sorry to hear that unraveling seams is going on with your pant. We stand behind our gear and would love to make things right for you. Keep an eye on your inbox - I've sent you an email to follow up and help.", 'LL_response_date': 'July 12, 2017'}

column6: I was excited about these pants because they were going to be my second pair ever of Lululemon yoga pants but these are absolutely terrible. They pilled after wearing them just once and the material not as nice after wearing a handful amount of times. Stay as far away from these as possible
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ewhite,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 12, 2017'}

column6: I bought these pants hoping that I wouldn't experience any pilling like I have with my other lululemon pants.. HOWEVER, there is pilling on my left hip area!! How is that possible?! Nothing even rubs on that part of my body! I wash these pants (along with all my other lululemon) inside out, cold wash, hang dry.. So disappointed considering I've only had it for about a month and probably have worn/washed them three times
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey lulugirl11111,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and are sorry to hear your gear isn't performing. Give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 so they can follow up and chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'July 12, 2017'}

column6: So yes, I read all the reviews prior to purchasing these pants and I bought them anyway because in the store when I tried them on they fit amazingly. The fabric is truly wonderful and feels great on the skin. Fast forward to when I received them still felt great, then ... I wore them to work out. First wear, snag on the seams. Kept working out... more snags. This is on non contact areas too! Seams on the front, the pockets, etc. Basically everywhere with a thread. Cut off the snags bits on the surface then decided to wear them a second time... to walk my dogs. By the end of my 5 block walk the threading on the front (not even inner thighs) snagged! I don't even know from what!! This is the first time I've written a review on their new online system. I used to purchase $$$'s every online upload day around 4 years ago. Quality has never been the same and I have only purchased 5 items since the last 4 years. I don't know how quality is so terrible yet the prices have significantly increased. Pants never used to be more than $98. Wunder under crops were $68! Swiftly Long sleeves were $64 now they're $78 in a few years! These prices and quality make zero sense. I'm so glad I purchased a lifetimes worth years back.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey malibuathlete,\nThanks so much for taking the time to share your thoughts. We hear your thoughts and will be sending an email your way so we can follow up and help.\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 6, 2017'}

column5: Very nice shape but poor quality
column6:
Actually I loved this pants when I first try it on, it really comfortable and helps shape the line of legs visually, the cut and the pocket details are delighted. but the loose and line unstitched just happened soon after.
It looses only after 2 washes, especially the keen, the loose is obviously, actually I did asked the sales people in store if it may unshaped when I was making the decision about the size, they emphasized it will not unshaped at all.
Recently, I found the line unstitched at the bottom of the pants, the off line goes up to the waist, who should I contact with about this? I really worried if it may get worse or splitopen. (I am 126 lbs, 173 cm, I bought size 4)
The unstitched is something I think should not happen on a good quality legging especially on this price
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey hdeng,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and are sorry to hear your gear isn't performing. Give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 so they can follow up and chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'July 6, 2017'}

column5: Perfect Fit, but Didn't Last Long
column6:
The fit on these were amazing! I do a variation of workouts and they're really comfortable. I didn't feel like I constantly had to adjust them, or pull them up. I've had issues with color fading after washing, but not with these thankfully!
The only downside is that the seams started to unravel fairly quickly. I'd still recommend them due to the fit, but hopefully this gets resolved in production.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey tbracey25,Thanks for taking the time to reach out today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and are sorry to hear your gear isn't performing. An email is headed your way so we can follow up and lend a helping hand.\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'July 6, 2017'}

column5: My absolute favorite until the seems started to come loose.
column6: These are by far my favorite set of lulus. They are lightweight which is wonderful because I do a lot of running. They are perfect length sitting right at my ankle. (I'm 5'5 128lbs and ordered a 4 for reference) I would have given these a 5star rating, however after washing them 3 times, and air drying, the seems are coming loose on the side pocket. I was disappointed because for the price they are, I expected better quality.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey kaylemurray,\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Unraveling seams is definitely not what we like to hear, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox so we can get this fixed as soon as possible.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 5, 2017'}

column6:
From the moment I pulled them out of the packaging I was in LOVE. I just received these yesterday via the mail so I haven't worked out in them yet. So of course, I tried them on and they feel like silk! I mean I was able to slip them on like butter and they feel amazing; they have a very comfy cooling sensation. Now I'm relatively new to Lululemon and only have three leggings. In the Hot Like Angi leggings that I purchased last month the size 8 fit perfectly. Now either these leggings run a bit big or I'm losing weight but the size 8 in these are slightly big. I mean they look and feel amazing and are not too big or loose for me to exchange them, not that I could because the size 6 in the gray/dark carbon color is sold out, but when I buy the nile blue color I will size down. Because I just received these I haven't fully worked out ( I do kickboxing, strength training, TCX and cross fit) in them yet, but I did do several burpees and jumping jacks, even ran around my apt to see how they hold up and I'm satisfied with how durable they are. The waist band did slide down a bit, again because they are a bit loose but after doing 15 burpees overall the tights held in place.
They're are some reviews that say these tights are completely not see throw in the dark carbon-well for them that may be true, but for me not so much. Honestly these leggings are about 10% sheer, but nothing outrageous. I mean they do pass the squat test! For me unfortunately I have a spot of cellulite the size of a nickel on the back of my right thigh that does show through and when trying these on with normal VS cotton panties you could see the pantie line which happens to be the case with most leggings these days.
Still love these. At the moment I'm 5'3 157 lb small upper body curvy lower body. Normally were size M or size 29 or 8 in jeans and size 8 in BEBE dresses. Highly recommend!

I love the fast and free crops, so I decided to try these. I am 5'3" and 134#, bought a size 6, and these fit me like a full length tight, which is fine because I hate 7/8 length tights anyway. I love all the pockets; they really make these perfect running tights, as I can hold gels, my keys, my ID, and my phone. If I had one suggestion on the pockets though, it would be to make a more secure ID pocket with a zipper or a fold-over flap; I am always concerned my ID is going to fall out. The fabric is very lightweight and comfortable, and definitely goes along with the "naked" sensation. I bought these in nile blue and the color is pretty. They passed the squat test for me, but I only gave them 4 stars because they do show sweat, which is unfortunate. I will keep these, but wear them on cooler days when I'm less likely to sweat. More patterns and colors please!

column5: Worn Once, Seems already coming loose
column6: I just purchased these pants 3 days ago, have only worn the pants once for two hours, and the seems are already coming undone. I am so disappointed because I was so excited when I tried these pants on and they felt so comfortable. For the amount of money I was expecting way better quality. So disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey MadisonGal,\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Yikes! Seam issues are not what we want to hear and we want to make this right for you. Look out for our email so we can get this fixed as soon as possible.', 'LL_response_date': 'June 30, 2017'}

column5: Fast and Free are my favorite Lulu tights!
column6:
So far I have purchased 4 Fast and Free crops and two pairs of these Fast and Free 7/8 in the Nile Blue and Black. I use them primarily for running. I LOOOOOVE these tights. I think they have an amazing feel, with the naked sensation but still somewhat compressive for support. I love the side pocket on the leg which I like to use for my phone when I'm running. The only negative in my opinion is that I prefer mid-rise and low-rise to high-rise
I am 5'1", 110 lbs. and wear size 2 in the Fast and Free Tights.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column6: These pants ripped on me. I hadn't even used them much and they ripped down the crotch area. I ended up getting rid of them. I'm a frequent shopper at lulu but I was very disappointed in this purchase.

I absolutely LOVE these leggings. I run/workout all the time and these hold up on even my longest runs. The high waist is super comfortable and flattering and they don't fall down at all. I love how many pockets these have, perfect for my keys on a run or sticking my phone in when at the gym. I haven't had any issues with holes or the seams and will definitely be buying more!

I got the Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II in the dark carbon color! I have muscular quads and the dark carbon color makes my legs' muscle definition pop! I also love the right amount of compression of these tights! What I find fascinating is that both the Fast & Free 7/8 Tight II and the new Final Lap Crop (which I also have) are made out of Nulux, but the Fast & Free has a lot more compression than the Final Lap Crop which feels more like a Nulux version of the Aligh Pant! Nevertheless, they are both amazing and flattering! Lastly, if you are wondering the difference between the Fast & Free I vs the Fast & Free II, it's the reflective dots at the ankle. The II has more reflective dots than the I. The rest are the same as far as I know, they feel the same when I wear them as well. Highly recommend this for training, running, walking around, or lounging! It's so versatile!

Bought these because I liked the carbon color and I really love the pant as well! I like the pockets on the thigh for my phone and they feel great once they are on. The carbon is not sheer at all, i am happy with these.
These are perfect for training days!!! Stuck to my regular size 4 and they're not too tight and not loose at all.

I have had these pants for about 4 months now and I have not had a single seam or thread come undone so I'm not sure what others are doing in order to get these unraveling and what not. These are amazing for any activity, low or high impact but the ONLY qualm I find is that the waist band is a little too tight compared to the rest of the pant. Can you seek to improve this? Otherwise Nulux is life-changing, we need more styles! Worth the $
